additionalHouseRules:
No refunds for weather related issues.  This includes lack of snow.
$5 per key cash deposit & $45 gate remote deposit where applicable
 Chains, snow tires, or 4-wheel drive mandatory during ice or snow

This is a vacation rental agreement under the North Carolina Vacation Rental Act.  The rights and obligations of the parties to this agreement are defined by law and include unique provisions permitting the disbursement of rent prior to tenancy and expedited eviction of tenants.  Your signature on this agreement, or payment of money, or taking possession of the property after receipt of this agreement, is evidence of your acceptance of the agreement and your intent to use this property for a vacation rental.  Rentals exceeding 90 days do not fall under the NC vacation rental management act and are not subject to the same protections adhered to by the NC Vacation Rental Management Act.

Maximum occupancy must be strictly adhered to.  Occupancy count includes children.  Exceeding the occupancy limit set for your unit is ground for immediate eviction.  No exceptions and no refunds!

Accidental Damage Protector & Security Deposits:  The Accidental Damage Protection Plan is included in the advertised total amount and indemnifies you and your family up to $1500 for any accidental damage during your stay. All accidental damage must be reported to our office in writing by the end of renter’s stay in order for Damage Protector to apply.  Damage Protector is a surety contract and is not insurance.  RRR is not an insurer, insurance agent or underwriter.  The Accidental Damage Protection is non refundable.  Damage Protector does NOT cover intentional damage, excessive cleaning, theft, Acts of God, gross negligence, pet damage, utilities, rent, pay for view cable charges, additional costs incurred during stay per renter’s request, or loss of use.  Any intentional property damage or items listed above will be billed to the renter and may be charged to renter’s account or credit card on file without renter’s consent if RRR is unable to contact renter to request authorization.  

A security deposit can be elected in lieu of Accidental Damage Protection.  The cost ranges from $200 to $800 depending on the rental unit.  It is fully refundable by mail within 30 days of departure providing no damages have been made to the unit and the unit has been left tidy (according to our check out procedures) or (less any allowable deductions).  The security deposit can be paid in advance by personal check, money order, certified funds or credit card. Security deposits paid upon arrival must be paid by cash or credit card only. 

A few homes may require an additional security deposit beyond what is required above in this rental agreement.  The renter agrees to reimburse the homeowner for any damages to the property caused by renter that are in excess of, or not covered by Damage Protector or the security deposit.  Such damages shall include reasonable attorney fees and court costs.  The provisions of Article 5, Chapter 42A of the North Carolina General Statutes (Landlord and tenant Duties) are incorporated herein by reference as if fully set forth.

The renter fully understands that RRR is a rental agency engaging in the rental of private property of others.  RRR reserves the right to refuse service to anyone RRR feels will not be responsible for the property he/she is renting. RRR does not rent to anyone under the age of 21.  Each rental unit requires a person 21 or older to rent and sign the rental contract.  This person must be present at check-in and for duration of rental.  Renter understands that RRR has the right to terminate this agreement, re-enter the unit, or take necessary measures to remove the renter from the premises in the event renter and guests violates the conditions of this agreement.  RRR is not responsible for the loss or theft of clothing, money, jewelry, etc. and is not be held liable for any accidents or injury of any nature.  RRR reserves the right to move any reservation that might come about due to unforeseen circumstances (house sold, out of rental program, owner’s use, act of God, etc.)  Under no circumstances is the obligation of RRR more than that of refunding the renter’s deposit. Rates are subject to all applicable taxes.  Rates are subject to change with notice.

Accommodations: All of our vacation properties are individually owned and reflect each owner’s taste.  Rearranging of furniture is not permitted. If you have specific standards or requirements for your vacation residence we advise personal inspection of the property prior to making reservations. Burning wood in any gas fireplace is prohibited and subject to forfeiture of security deposit.  Grilling is not permitted on any porches, decks or walkways.  All units are provided with enough garbage bags, paper towels, dishwashing detergent, bath soap, and toilet paper to get you started.  If you need more of these items, you can purchase them at Food Lion located on Tynecastle Hwy or other local grocery stores.  Firewood is NOT provided.  Propane/grill accessories are NOT provided. A one-time linen fee is charged on all units.  Linens are provided with initial set-up.  Additional linens/towels are not provided.  Towels for pools and/or hot tubs are not provided. There is a fee for extras and exchanges.

Renter agrees to indemnify and hold harmless RRR and the owner from and against any liability for personal injury or property damage sustained by any person (including renter’s guests) as a result of any cause, unless caused by the negligent or willful act of RRR or the owner, or the failure of the RRR or the owner to comply with the Vacation Rental Act.  Renter agrees that RRR, the owner or their respective representatives may enter the premises during reasonable hours to inspect the premises, to make such repairs, alterations or improvements thereto as RRR or owner may deem appropriate, or to show the premises to perspective purchasers or renters.

RRR does not guarantee any weather, road or ski conditions and there will be no refund as a result of either.  Transportation is the sole responsibility of the renter.  Snow tires, chains or 4-wheel drive is mandatory during adverse weather as stated by Sugar Mountain law.

There will be no refund for weather related issues.  This includes but is not limited to lack of snow or inclement weather preventing the renters’ arrival.  We strongly recommend accepting the travel insurance to assist with obtaining refunds for these situations. No refunds are made for early departures or no shows.

Travel Insurance: We offer travel insurance through Red Sky Travel Insurance.  This provides coverage should you need to cancel or interrupt your trip as well as primary medical coverage, coverage for lack to snow and much more.  Please read your “Description of Coverage” for details.  If no computer access, please ask us to send you a copy of the Insurance Policy. Insurance premiums are non-refundable.

Check-in: Check in starts at 4:00 pm. RRR does not guarantee check-in time. Check in at our office.  No early check-ins are guaranteed.  Renters are not permitted to enter the unit without first coming to the office and checking in.  No entry is allowed until units are cleaned and inspected.  There is a refundable $5.00 per key deposit (cash only) due at check-in.  There is also a refundable $45.00 deposit on community gate remotes where applicable (cash or credit card only).  Our office hours are from 8:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Monday through Friday and 5 p.m. on Saturdays with extended hours during ski season (including Sundays).  If you will be arriving after regular office hours there will be a late arrival packet left for you in the green “Check-in” box at the front of our office.  This is provided if you have paid in full and have a signed contract.  The packet will have your name on the front and inside you will find a map to the unit(s), one key, and emergency phone numbers in case of a problem.  NO arrivals on Thanksgiving or Christmas Day as our offices are closed.  Upon check in, if you have any housekeeping issues or other issues related to the comfort of your stay, please contact our office immediately to report specifics.  There will be no refunds upon checkout for issues that were never reported immediately upon check-in or during your stay.

Check-out:  10:00 a.m. All units must be vacated by 10:00 a.m. on the scheduled departure date and keys returned to office unless PRIOR arrangements have been made for late check-out.  Failure to check out on time will result in a $50 late check-out fee.  Failure to comply with check out procedures listed below will result in additional charges.

Before checking out please do the following steps:
Tidy Unit
Load and start dishwasher
Clean out refrigerator – do not leave any food in kitchen
Take out all trash to appropriate receptacles (trash MUST be bagged)
Turn off all lights
Unplug small appliances
Turn thermostats (heat) back to 55 degrees in winter
Lock and secure all windows and doors

Ordinances: 
Most properties limit number of vehicles and parking spaces.  Parking is not permitted on town streets.  Renter is responsible for any fees incurred due to parking in prohibited areas.  No oversized vehicles are allowed in parking areas without prior permission from RRR.  Buses and oversized vehicles are prohibited on the mountain except in designated areas. 
Town ordinance prohibits loose dogs on the mountain.  All dogs must be kept on a leash.
Quiet Hours are from 11 p.m. to  8 a.m. on Sugar Mountain.  After one notice, if tenant fails to adhere to this regulation it will result in an immediate eviction and forfeiture of all monies paid

Daily Maid Service: is not provided.  We can, however, arrange extra cleaning services for you at an additional charge. Must have 48 hours advance notice.

Lock Out Policy: During office hours you may pick up an extra key at our office.  After hours, one of our agents will meet you at the office.  There is a $25 charge for this service.

Locked Closets:  Most units have one or more locked closets which are not available to guests.  These doors are checked behind each guest.  Tenant will be responsible for any damage or missing items.  Criminal charges could result.

Repairs and Service Calls: Please report any inoperative equipment to our office promptly.  We cannot guarantee appliances, TV’s, heaters, gas logs, cable or internet, etc. and no refund or rate adjustments will be made for any mechanical failure including power outages.  We do not refund for malfunctioning hot tubs. We will, however, make every effort to have repairs done quickly or reasonably remedy the problem.

Telephones: Most units have telephones.  Some are set up for 911 services only.  Please charge all long distance calls to your credit card, calling card, or home phone.  There will be an additional $10.00 service charge on any calls charged to the unit phone number.  Local prefixes 898, 733, 737, 387 and 964 only.  All others are long distance including Foscoe, Boone and Blowing Rock.

Pets:  Absolutely NO pets are allowed unless otherwise permitted by RRR.  You must call for permission.  A pet deposit of $100 per pet is mandatory and is not refundable. Breach of this policy will result in immediate eviction and loss of monies.  No pets are allowed between December 1st and March 15th. 

Smoking: Absolutely no smoking in units.  Failure to adhere will result a fumigation charge and immediate eviction.

Waiver of Liability for Spa, Hot Tub, Jacuzzi, Sauna and Pool: The renter understands that there are special risks involved in the use of above special features.  Renter is aware there are potential dangers these features may present to children and adults that are not carefully supervised, as well as any person using special feature too long or if a person has health risks or is intoxicated or using any kind of drugs or medication, or pregnant.  Renter agrees to waive any claim whatsoever against RRR and owner of property for accidents or injury arising from use of special features.  The renter agrees he/she is responsible and liable for any damages that occur to the special feature through his or his guest’s misuse or negligence.  If a hot tub has to be drained and refilled due to foreign substances in the water, there will be an extra charge to the renter for this service and it will be charged to renter’s account or credit card.

Units listed for Sale: Renter agrees to allow unit to be shown promptly.  24 hour notice will be given.

Property Transfer: In the event the Owner transfers this property prior to occupancy by renter, renter has the right to enforce this agreement if the rental is to end 180 days or less after the transfer of ownership.  If more than the above 180 days, renter has no enforcement rights unless the Grantee agrees to honor this rental; however, renter has a right to a refund of all monies paid.  RRR will promptly notify renter if property is transferred.

Mail: We do not accept mail for renters renting less than one month.  If renting for a month or more mail may be forwarded to our office. Mail will be picked up daily and will be available at our office after 2 p.m. if possible.  RRR is not personally responsible or liable for any lost or damaged mail.

Illegal Acts: Absolutely no acts illegal by law are allowed in RRR units or on premises.  Any such action will result in immediate eviction and forfeiture of all monies paid.  Any excessive cleaning or damage caused by these acts will be charged to the renter.

name: ReserveII 13D
p3SummaryAddress: Sugar Mountain, North Carolina, United States
primaryHost/about:
We are a premier vacation rental management company located in Sugar Mountain, NC near the Blue Ridge Parkway and Grandfather Mountain. Currently we manage over 150 properties varying from Cabins, Mountain Homes, Chalets and Condos.  Once a reservation is made, our reservationists will contact you via email, with a Rental Agreement. All guests must sign and return a Rental Agreement within 7 days to guarantee your reservation.
YOU MUST Check-IN and Check-OUT at 3390 Tynecastle Highway,  Sugar Mountain NC 28604. DO NOT go directly to your rental location.
You will receive a welcome pack containing a Guest Guide, map and Keys to your vacation rental.
ITS SWEETER UP HERE!
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully decorated and spacious condo is located in the Reserve II gated community on Sugar Mountain. With an elevation of 4800 feet you can enjoy unobstructed breathtaking long range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains.

This beautifully decorated and spacious condo is located in the Reserve II gated community on Sugar Mountain. With an elevation of 4800 feet you can enjoy unobstructed breathtaking long range views of the Blue Ridge Mountains. There is a convenient trail across the parking lot from the condo that leads to the ski slopes. The walk is 300 yards or less.  Great for ski access or mountain biking without having to endure parking hassles.  Not only are you a stones throw from all the amenities that Sugar Mountain has to offer, you are only a short drive from Banner Elk, Boone and Blowing Rock which offers the best in dining, shopping, golf and outdoor activities. Relax in the comfortable living room with a stone gas fireplace and large flat screen smart TV. The master bedroom features a king size bed and private bath with Jacuzzi tub and walk in shower.  The guest room features a queen bed with adjoining bath. There is also a queen sleeper sofa. Enjoy cooking in the fully furnished gourmet kitchen with all stainless steel appliances. Wi-Fi is provided.No Smoking  *ONLY TWO(2) PARKING PERMITS PER UNIT. VEHICLES WITHOUT PERMITS WILL BE TOWED AT THE OWNER'S EXPENSE* Absolutely NO Pets.  Max occupancy is 4. 4x4/awd, chains or snow tires needed in winter. No Check-in's Thanksgiving Day or Christmas Day. All guests required to sign rental agreement upon booking.

There is a river less than 5 minutes away, it is very popular, it is kaya for rent, there is a raft trip all around the river and they also fish, there are places to ride horses, less than 1 hour there are places to ski open at the end of September too  They are the so-called grandfather mountains, all less than an hour away and many more activities to have fun and have an unforgettable vacation❤️🙏

N/A

On the second floor there is a billiard table and a large TV, each room has a TV, the internet is cheap and fast, the perfect cabin for people in wheelchairs. We have a spacious bathroom for disabled people and the entrance has a ramp.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion - A Historic Mountain Home
photos/16/caption: Back entrance and staircase
photos/25/caption: Room #4 - The Hopkins Room (Landing)
photos/26/caption: Room #5 - The Mary May Room (Landing)
photos/31/caption: Room #8 - The Colonel May Room (Upstairs)
photos/32/caption: Room #9 - The John Johnston Room (Upstairs)
photos/33/caption: Room #10 - The Nicketti Johnston Room (Upstairs)
photos/34/caption: Upstairs bathroom (Rooms 7-10)
sectionedDescription/description:
John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia senator and judge of Tazewell County, built this lovely historic home in 1859. The residence is conveniently positioned within a short stroll from Tazewell Main Street on a 3.16-acre lot. The Johnston family erected the house to showcase their accomplishments because they were highly renowned in thier native Virginia. The owners of this lovely property for the longest period of time were A.Z. Litz and his wife Etta V. Stauber. Experience history!

The interior of the home is focused on a large central hallway that serves as the main avenue of traffic and the entrance area to the adjacent rooms. Three of the bedrooms are situated on the ground floor, including the The Litz Suite, The Etta V. Room and The Jack May Room. Also, on the ground floor you will find the kitchen, dining room, living room and game room. 

The central hallway flows into a large, wide staircase that provides access to the second floor. On the second floor, lower landing you will find a cozy sitting area and access to three more of the bedrooms: The Mary May Room, The Hopkins Room and The Doctor Johnston Suite. On the second floor, upper landing you will find the remaining four bedrooms:  The Nelle May Room, The Colonel May Room, The John Johnston Room and the Nicketti Johnston Room. The second floor also leads to a spacious upper-level balcony that overlooks the vast front lawn. 

Just outside the front door, you will find the large front porch with rocking chairs perfect for soaking up the outdoors. And to the side there is a rustic fire pit and sitting area so you can catch up with your friends and family….in all, this home is a perfect place to rest, relax and enjoy the mountains of Appalachia.

Rooms:

1) The Litz Suite: The Litz Suite pays homage to A.Z. Litz, in which the mansion as we know it today is named. The cozy bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace, and most importantly a private on suite. The on suite is the main attraction here. Newly renovated with beautiful white tile, large glass shower, sunflower shower head and travertine corner seat, make this room a guest favorite. Located downstairs with easy access to the kitchen, dining room, living room and game room. Perfect for couples or guests that enjoy a little more privacy.

2) The Etta V. Room: Named after A.Z. Litz’s wife, Etta Viola Stauber, the Etta V. Room is positioned downstairs at the front of the house with views of the yard. This bedroom includes a king-sized bed and fireplace. And the front porch, a guest favorite, is just a few steps away. Grab a rocking chair and your favorite drink and enjoy the sounds of nature. Also, being downstairs, you have easy access to the living room, game room, dining room and kitchen.

3) The Jack May Room:  Named after the most prominent owner of the Litz Mansion, Andrew Jackson (“Jack”) May. This room is located downstairs and across the hall from The Etta V. Room. The bedroom includes a king-sized bed and fireplace. Just outside the room door is everyone’s favorite, the front porch. Grab a rocking chair and your favorite drink and enjoy the sounds of nature. Also, being downstairs, you have easy access to the living room, game room, dining room and kitchen.

4) The Hopkins Room: Named after John C. Hopkins who was the second owner of the home during the Civil War. This room is located upstairs in the rear of the mansion, has two sets of bunkbeds and is a perfect retreat for young and old. With three glass walls facing east, the sun fills this room in the morning. Designed to complement the cheerful sun, the white bunkbeds, beautiful white shutters and bright paint remind guests there is so much to look forward to outside.

5) The Mary May Room: A room dedicated to Andrew Jackson (“Jack") May’s first wife Mary Matilda, is located upstairs, on the lower landing and adjacent to The Hopkins Room. This large space features 2 double beds and 2 comfortable sitting areas and even 2 closets. An excellent value for folks travelling together. Beautifully done, spacious and comfortable. Also, easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.

6) The Doctor Johnston Suite: Dr. George Ben Johnston was the son of the original owner and builder of the home, John Johnston. Dr. Johnston was highly respected in the medical community for his surgical expertise and this room is named in his honor. The tucked away upstairs bedroom features two double beds and a private bathroom. Located across the hall from The Mary May Room, this suite is ideal for multiple guests. Full of light, bright and cheery, this room gives guests a pop of color with vintage red bed frames and a soft aqua rug. Also, the room has easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.

7) The Nelle May Room: A room just as stunning as Andrew Jackson May’s second wife (who was 51 years his junior), the Nelle May room is a picturesque part of the mansion and is quickly becoming a guest favorite for it’s good vibes, early morning sunshine, happy wall coloring and vintage white painted bed. This expansive, bright, and cheerful bedroom features a queen-sized bed, fireplace and also has a cozy sitting area. It is a perfect room for folks looking for a recharging environment.

8) The Colonel May Room: The Colonel May room is dedicated to the youngest son of Andrew Jackson and Nelle May. Andrew named his son “Colonel” in hopes to pass along some of the luster and reputation of his own name. This room is fit for a Colonel and styled for one too. With all the furnishings being dark, rich mahogany, and walnut. A favorite talking piece of this room is the beautiful stone capped foot boards. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing.

9) The John Johnston Room: Named for the man that envisioned and constructed the stunning mansion, the John Johnston room is a symbol of elegance and sophistication. Located upstairs at the front of the mansion this bedroom features a king bed and fireplace. It being one of the biggest, most spacious rooms in the house, it has plenty of room for guests. Not just for sleeping, with two oversized chairs and a desk this room is great for longer stays. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing. 

10) The Nicketti Johnston Room: Dedicated to the wife of John Warfield Johnston, the Nicketti Johnston room makes you feel like you are part of history. Located just off the upper landing this expansive bedroom features a king bed and fireplace. The room is one of the biggest in the house; decorated in grand style with dark wood tones and elegant bedding. The large cedar closet and 2 full armchairs give guests who prefer longer stays, the space to lounge and live comfortably.

sectionedDescription/description:
The Timberlake was Built-in 1898 and thoughtfully renovated in 2007,  This home combines history, luxury, and warmth. The Comfortable interiors surround you with a sense of serenity. It is perfect for that magical family getaway that you've been dreaming of. It has all the comforts of home from fine linens, to a fully equipped kitchen. Located just minutes from attractions. 
Hiking, climbing, fishing,  or exploring the New River Gorge National Preserve .

name: Herndon Hideout ATV Trail House

photos/9/caption: Another view of the fire pit
primaryHost/about: I'm a proud mother of two wonderful young men. One attending The United States Naval Academy and the other attends University of Maryland. My husband and I are empty nesters and enjoying our new freedom by traveling, riding our RZR and hosting our home to other riders!
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to our Herndon Hideout ATV Trail House!
We have a beautiful 5 bedroom, 3 bath home with a full kitchen in the middle of the Wild & Wonderful West Virginia Mountains. There is plenty of parking for ATV riders and their trailers along with cameras looking at the parking areas. You can literally park your truck, take your ATV's off of the trailer and not have to put them back on until you leave. 
Trails Nearby: We are in the heart of the Outlaw Trails.  Just seconds from the house you can be on the trails. You can be on the Hatfiled and McCoy's Pinnacle Creek, Indian Ridge, Pocahantas and Warrior Trails within 15 minutes or so. All are within riding distance.   There is a variety of  what type of trails you can find nearby, muddy, rocky, scenic, mountaintop, hill climbs or just smooth and beautiful all around us.  Some popular attractions nearby on the trails are the Train Tressels, Beer Can Alley, Flag Rock, and the View. There are also plenty of options for places to stop and eat or get fuel along the way. We will include recommendations in the Welcome binder we have at the house for you. It will include the phone numbers and addresses. We do recommend that you use a satellite GPS to get around as you will NOT have cell service here.
Check in Time: 3pm (you will have your own code to get in/out, please be sure to send us a 4 digit code for you to use) - it may be possible to check in early on occassion, it just depends on if we have someone leaving that same day or not. Send us a message to find out. 
Check Out Time: 10am FIRM *We must have enough time to thoroughly clean before the next guests arrive.
Please be courteous of our neighbors. Quiet after 10p 
Amentitites:
Full kitchen: We provide all of your basic kitchen essentials: Pots & Pans, Silverware, Plates, Bowls, Coffee cups, Glasses, Coffee maker, Crockpot, Microwave, Stove, Oven, Dishwasher, and Refrigerator. 
Internet: We have High Speed WiFi available for your use. The network info and password is posted in the house and in the Welcome Book inside of the house. *Note we can not help outages. We do provide the service but there are times when weather may affect service or other issues out of our control. If the internet goes does, we recommend rebooting the modem. If that does not work contact us and we will contact the provider. 
TV : We provide (2) TV's in the house. One in the Living room, and one in the Master Bedroom. There is no cable hooked up but you can watch Roku TV, or provide your own Netflix or Hulu info to watch that.
Washer/Dryer: The house does provide a washer and dryer for guest usage. Please use at your own risk. The owners are not responsible for any damage done including fading, tearing, etc.
Bedding/Towels: We provide sheets, blankets, towels, wash clothes, and hand towels for your use. 
Trash Service –Please make sure to place bagged trash only in the trash bin outside. No loose trash please. Trash collection is every Thursday morning. 
Coffee Bar- a Coffee pot is provided along with some coffee items, tea, and hot chocolate (seasonally). Please help yourself.
Stove/Oven/Microwave/Crockpot:  The house does have a Stove/Oven/Microwave. Please clean after use. 
Board Games/Darts – We do have board games and a dart board. Please use at your own risk. 
Fire Place – The fire place is non-functioning. Please DO NOT use the Fire Place in the house.
Fire Pit – The house does a Fire Pit located in the back yard of the house. The fire pit is to be used at your own risk and please use responsibly. Keep the fire small and contained at all times. DO NOT use the fire pit if the area is extremely dry and there is a high fire hazard. Bring your own firewood. 
Outdoor Furniture – The house does have some outdoor chairs and tables for your use. Please be sure to bring them back onto the back porch before you leave.
Grill - We do have a charcoal grill you are welcome to use. You will need to bring your own charcoal. Please be courteous and clean it out after using it.
Security Cameras – We have 4 outdoor security cameras looking at the parking areas, front, and back doors
Power Outages – We are in an area that may have power outages on occasion. This is something beyond our control. 
Please let us know if you notice anything that is missing, broken, or not working so that we are able to correct that ASAP. Also, if you have any recommendations on anything you think we are missing send us a message. We want our guests to have a great time, and want you to come back again, so we love feedback.

We are available online and by phone.

DO NOT use the fire pit if the area is extremely dry and there is a high fire hazard. Bring your own firewood. 
Outdoor Furniture – The house does have some outdoor chairs and tables for your use. Please be sure to bring them back onto the back porch before you leave.
Grill - We do have a charcoal grill you are welcome to use. You will need to bring your own charcoal. Please be courteous and clean it out after using it.
Security Cameras – We have 4 outdoor security cameras looking at the parking areas, front, and back doors
Power Outages – We are in an area that may have power outages on occasion. This is something beyond our control. 
Please let us know if you notice anything that is missing, broken, or not working so that we are able to correct that ASAP. Also, if you have any recommendations on anything you think we are missing send us a message. We want our guests to have a great time, and want you to come back again, so we love feedback.

accessibilityModule/amenities/0/descript: There's a private parking spot at least 11 feet (3.35 meters) wide. Or, there is public parking spot designated for a person with disabilities that has clear signage or markings.
accessibilityModule/amenities/1/descript: The sidewalk or path that leads to the guest entrance is well lit at night.
accessibilityModule/amenities/1/name: Lit path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/amenities/2/descript: The exterior and interior pathways to the guest entrance—like sidewalks, hallways, or elevators—have no steps, stairs, or curbs.
accessibilityModule/amenities/2/name: Step-free path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/amenities/3/descript:
The guest entrance is free of steps and barriers, and the door threshold is less than 2 inches (5 centimeters) high. 

In a hotel or apartment building, the guest entrance is where the guests enter their room. For all other listing types, the guest entrance is the entrance to the property.
accessibilityModule/amenities/4/descript: The guest entryway is at least 32 inches (81 centimeters) wide.
accessibilityModule/amenities/5/descript: The room is on the ground floor or accessible by a lift or ramp, and there are no stairs, steps, or thresholds higher than 2 inches (5 centimeters) between the guest entrance and the room.
accessibilityModule/amenities/6/descript: The entrance or doorway to the room is at least 32 inches wide.
accessibilityModule/amenities/7/descript: There are no steps or obstacles to enter the shower. Thresholds or water guards are less than 1 inch (2.54 centimeters) high.
accessibilityModule/amenities/8/descript: The shower or bath has a chair or bench seat in it that's specifically designed for guests with limited mobility. The seat is either fixed to a wall or freestanding.
accessibilityModule/rootHighlights/1: Lit path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/rootHighlights/2: Step-free path to the guest entrance
accessibilityModule/seeAllSections/2/pho: This photo shows the teak bench that is normally in the shower.  However I ordered one 2 days ago and it will be here anytime.
accessibilityModule/seeAllSummary: This host has reviewed their place for accessibility features. Wide entrances are at least 32" (81cm).
additionalHouseRules:
No unregistered guests

No shoes on the bed or the furniture, if at all possible try to leave your shoes at the door

No rearranging of the furniture unless for setting up of the Inflatable mattress

Guest agrees to pay any and all damages incurred by their stay

Please respect our towels, sheets, comforters

Use the black make-up towels in the bathroom for makeup removal

Do not cut anything on the countertops, there is a cutting board in the sink for that 

Please no eating in the bed

Please don't leave ink pens on the bed or especially the loveseat or recliner. 

While cooking, please use hot pads that are provided, do not sit hot pans on countertop

Books are property of the flat, kindly don't take them home , and please respect the vintage ones. They were acquired for your enjoyment. 

Do not let robes fall into your luggage and later when questioned about it say, "it must have fallen into my luggage". They are there for your enjoyment. If you are interested in purchasing, message me.

sectionedDescription/access: Outside of the flat there are 2 parking spaces solely dedicated  for your use. You then have the sidewalk that winds all the way through the University. It is maintained by the University. For Security, there is the WVU Tech Campus Police and the Beckley Police Department. I have worked closely with both, not only offering to provide a live link to my camera systems, but also taking several other measures to ensure the safety and security of the students, community members, and you!
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located flat, in the WVU Tech University District. Designed for couples,This historic filling station was acquired,gutted and purposely rebuilt for you,the discerning traveler,the parents of the students, or the traveling Doctor or Nurse. Designed in an urban industrial style, he unit is completely smart enabled,handicap accessible and overflowing with amenities that you would only expect from the most well known 5 star resorts. 15% Military Discount.

Welcome to the Carbon Flat. This is a multi-faceted passion project that not only offers housing for the parents of the University students, but is also in an effort to invest in the local community  and help grow much needed infrastructure.  This building was acquired, redesigned, gutted, stripped, and purposely rebuilt FOR you. I applied myself, thoroughly researched the concept of airbnb, developed a plan, and am now implementing that plan for "TOP OF THE LINE EXPERIENCE AND SERVICE",  In which I have provided for more than a decade.  I built and operated an Ultra exclusive boutique beach resort In Southeast Asia. As well as a beach lounge and restaurant that was considered "the living room" of Khao-Lak Beach, Thailand. I have lived and traveled abroad extensively, which I do believe lends to One's ability to recognize, appreciate,  and implement, this level of service. 

From the exterior. I chose to design the building in a very trendy "urban industrial" monochromatic color scheme which uses a lot of one color in different hues. For this project I chose, carbonized grey. Hence the name, The Carbon Flat. I accentuated this dark and sort of  'blah' color with western red cedar, that I stained Mahogany Flame. It is quite dramatic, yet calming. I highlighted certain areas in stone, and others with foliage from local plants.  We installed a wheelchair accessible, concrete ramp, at a 3 degree gradient, to not only allow for a wheelchair, but also make it easier for luggage and minimize someone tripping. 

 On to the inside....

Posh, yet practical. Again, I put thought into every decision, researching what had the best reviews for comfort and functionality, while also balancing  function with form and design. I wanted to bring a little of the out side in, so I used a much more subtle grey, almost blue Pallet. I Then painted the  oak cabinets with the carbonized grey from outside. Additionally I used  western red cedar with the same  Is mahogany flame stain for crown molding. For a focal point, I had a custom mural done on the largest  wall. Its very thought provoking and perfect for the space which by the numbers seems small but with 12 foot high ceilings, makes it feel so much bigger.  I built and installed custom Acacia wood butcher block counter tops, with a Kraus workstation sink That I believe was intended to give a  farmhouse look, but it only lends to this funky design. It has a  built in chopping block and dish drainer. 

The kitchen was stocked with everything that a chef would appreciate. From  beautiful Damascus steel knives, to an Air fryer range that's front controlled and ADA compliant. Coffee and tea lovers? There is a Nespresso Machine that makes the absolute best coffee, stocked with Nespresso's best  coffee offerings as well as from Starbucks and other favorites. . There is a French Press, Bodum Pour over, Krups Noiseless grinder, and several different options for coffee in  fresh bean form in case you wanted to make your travelling companion their first pour over. Double walled glass  cappuccino and espresso mugs, and milk frother.  Individually wrapped tea bags from Twinning's, Taylors of Harrogate, Harford and Sons, and individually wrapped loose leaf tea from all over the world. There is an authentic cast iron Tetsubin  Japanese Tea set that, by the artist, was named after Rikyu (Rentarô Mikuni), a Buddhist priest who believes in the spiritual healing inherent in the traditional Japanese tea ceremony. There’s a Fellow Stagg EKG Digital kettle that’s ranked #1 by baristas and has a beautiful design. The best pour, for your pour-over. And only the best for you. 

Appreciate nice bath towels, or quality sleep? I chose to use  UGG Pacha line Turkish Cotton (and oversized) for all of the bath towels, hand towels, and wash cloths. I  Used UGG for most of the comforters and throws, and there will be several options for the guests when it comes to pillows and sheets, in case you don’t like the crazy high thread count Egyptian cotton ones that will be on the 14 inch hybrid, and fully adjustable bed. Makes it nice if you want to set the head up so you can watch the 75  inch tv,  with amazon prime, local cable, and top it off , a service that gives you every single cable channel from around the world, in different languages, including every single  pay per view event. It also has every single movie that comes out in theaters sometimes while they are still in the theaters. This is a legal service so there are no movies recorded with cellphones. I enjoy high quality Audio but had never bought anything from Klipsch. I wont ever buy anything else again.  You have a Klipsch Three 11 in the flat.   Bose, Sonos, eat your heart out. To sweeten the audio experience, is a fully automatic Audio Technica record player and a nice selection of records from every genre. Just let me know what tickles your fancy and it will be playing for you when you walk through the door. For you business travelers, there is  a wireless printer for your use. 

The lounging furniture are top grain leather , fully reclinable, with adjustable head and footrest, and lumbar also  with built in wireless charging for your phones. I have provided a few reading options including newer books, and a few dating all the way back to the 1850’s. Its really neat to look through them and compare societal differences of then and now and the amazing art done on old school press plates. There are few tastefully chosen board games. A bookcase edition scrabble, and a Luxury Edition Monopoly.  I built  a little area with accompaniments for adult beverages, and a nice Westin orange  juicer, which will always be accompanied by  fresh fruit, in case you would like to get up in the morning and juice some oranges for your “better half”. 

For you adult beverage drinkers there is a nice selection of glass ware. Vintage Paulaner Hefeweizen Glasses, which there are several already in the freezer for you. Huge Bordeaux glasses, glasses for white, lowballs, highballs and if you do partake please let me know in comments when you book that you are "RED" or "WHITE" and there will be such a thing in the gift basket for you.  

Custom built dining table made from Baltic Beechwood and then a triple coat of epoxy. I built this on an electric, noiseless air frame. You can raise and lower this table from 25 inches all the way up to 48 inches . Feel like standing,  great, sitting, even better. Disabled, I built this for you.  I think I blew ADA Compliant Standards out of the water on This  one. 

Last, but not least. The Bathroom. Continuing the décor, I installed  beautiful stone tile flooring, did the walls in a mute industrial concrete waterproof wallpaper. There is a really cool internally lit vanity mirror with a defogger that does not allow it to  get steamed up. My vision to work with local artists and craftsmen to showcase their work was fulfilled in the floating vanity and sink.  99timbers custom designed and built a live edge undermount and backsplash. It matches the beautiful foil-work sink . This sink is wheelchair accessible. There is a walk-in (or roll-in) modern steam shower. I chose grey stack stone and stunning turquoise subway tile, accentuated again by (a water suitable) choice of wood. Teak Floors and Teak Bench. This shower is 60 inches wide and 36 inches deep. It is wheelchair accessible. There is a 10 inch Kohler rain deluge, 8 body jets and an hand wand. Pressure? got pressure for days!!  Hot water you ask, well , I'm sure someone is going to test out that auto defog mirror. Its definitely a steam shower.  There are Turkish Cotton robes behind the bathroom door in multiple sizes for men and women. There is 3 different levels of toiletries based on the length of your stay. Our standard is  L'occitane Mer & Mistral,  If you're staying 3 nights or more you will receive Aprey Purple Water  (Exclusively used by the Ritz Carlton) if you choose to stay 5 nights or more you will receive  Hermès  eau d' orange vert.  Regardless of which level, you will receive shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, and body lotion.  There will also be an individually wrapped bar soap from Marseilles.

The unit is completly "smart" enabled. You can control everything with your voice. Lights, thermostat, doorlock, T.V.,  Alarm System, Vacuum cleanet. You can ask to see the doorbell camera and your vehicle on the 8 in screen in the Kitchen.  There is also another 5 inch screen. Both of these have manual camera shutters, and by protocol are never opened by me. If you choose to use them for video calling, you are doing so on your own accord. The only thing in the flat that is not smart controlled are the 2 chandeliers. There is too much wattage going through them. There is Also a hidden safe for your valuables. 

I hope you are ok with smart technology. There  is a virtual concierge that will greet you by name as you come in the front door and ask if you are formally checking in.  You will be given a menu of options, or you can ask exactly what you want. I have spent a great deal of time, programming information Such as info about the property , info on anything inside the flat and how to use it, restaurants, things to do, places to see, family friendly activities, hiking, shopping, etc...I have worked with many local restaurants and stores securing exclusive discount coupons for you, but you have to use the virtual concierge.  I have attached many pictures and videos,  of things in the flat that explain things better. So if you don't know how to make a pour over, it will teach you. 

I'm not going to list every little detail. I can only GUARANTEE you will not find anything like it locally, or for this price.  IF you do ill honor my guarantee and give you a weekend for free.

 I am also trying to set the bar for a different kind of service and go above and beyond. If you choose to book and will be staying at the flat long enough to need groceries, You can place a click list order and I will happily pick them up and have them stocked at the flat for you.  Local grocery store options are Kroger, Walmart, and Food Lion.

My father, myself, and generations in my family served in The United States Military. I am proud, and grateful  in offering a 15% military discount for Active Duty or former service members.  Please let me know before booking so that I can send you  the special offer. I would also ask that you provide some sort of verification.,  ie,  base card, VA ID, or DD214. You would want to think that no one would lie about serving in the military for a discount, but we all know better. This is actually a Federal crime punishable under The Stolen Valor Act of 2013 (revised from 2005).

Outside of the flat there are 2 parking spaces solely dedicated  for your use. You then have the sidewalk that winds all the way through the University. It is maintained by the University. For Security, there is the WVU Tech Campus Police and the Beckley Police Department. I have worked closely with both, not only offering to provide a live link to my camera systems, but also taking several other measures to ensure the safety and security of the students, community members, and you!

I will be available at a whim, if anything were needed, for any reason.

Located within the WVU Tech University District, You can walk to any area of the University within 5 minutes.  WVU Tech has also allocated and broken ground on a new dormitory literally across the road from the flat . In literally 10 seconds from the front door you can walk to Jimmy's Place, a local bar, that had been open since the 1960's, but shut down because of Covid 19. Fortunately, a local business owner has opened it back up and is serving food.  The carbon flat is located in the University district but the property behind the flat Is completely wooded..an urban landscape. There are two windows with views of this.

IF you are driving by car , there are two parking spaces in front of the airbnb dedicated solely for your use. Other than that the usual options are available, taxi, uber, public transportation. If you are in need of any information, please let me know and iIwill provide you everything.

#The Carbon Flat goes above and beyond some standards that even 5 star resorts don't implement. 
Firstly we care very much about the air that you breath. We implement a system that you can access, by Bluetooth, our air filtration system, and view the statistics and real time data such as when the filter was changed, and the air quality you are breathing. 

#We also take cleaning extremely serious, and have written protocols (S.O.P's) as to using a ozone generator each time a guest departs. We do this  before we even go in to clean. This prevents us from coming into contact with anything while changing the bed, vacuuming, etc. The ozone machine completely, (even cracks and crevices) kills all bacteria, viruses, mold, and any un thinkables. 

#IF you are handicapped and travelling alone, or travelling with someone but still have some restrictions,  I offer my services to help if I am able, in any way, as I had said before, my father was Quadriplegic for 33 years. I helped with EVERYTHING.  I am cpr certified, and combat medical trained from my time in the military. I offer this at no charge. You can contact me personally, if you would like to inquire about this.

This prevents us from coming into contact with anything while changing the bed, vacuuming, etc. The ozone machine completely, (even cracks and crevices) kills all bacteria, viruses, mold, and any un thinkables. 

#IF you are handicapped and travelling alone, or travelling with someone but still have some restrictions,  I offer my services to help if I am able, in any way, as I had said before, my father was Quadriplegic for 33 years. I helped with EVERYTHING.  I am cpr certified, and combat medical trained from my time in the military. I offer this at no charge. You can contact me personally, if you would like to inquire about this.
sectionedDescription/space:
Welcome to the Carbon Flat. This is a multi-faceted passion project that not only offers housing for the parents of the University students, but is also in an effort to invest in the local community  and help grow much needed infrastructure.  This building was acquired, redesigned, gutted, stripped, and purposely rebuilt FOR you. I applied myself, thoroughly researched the concept of airbnb, developed a plan, and am now implementing that plan for "TOP OF THE LINE EXPERIENCE AND SERVICE",  In which I have provided for more than a decade.  I built and operated an Ultra exclusive boutique beach resort In Southeast Asia. As well as a beach lounge and restaurant that was considered "the living room" of Khao-Lak Beach, Thailand. I have lived and traveled abroad extensively, which I do believe lends to One's ability to recognize, appreciate,  and implement, this level of service. 

From the exterior. I chose to design the building in a very trendy "urban industrial" monochromatic color scheme which uses a lot of one color in different hues. For this project I chose, carbonized grey. Hence the name, The Carbon Flat. I accentuated this dark and sort of  'blah' color with western red cedar, that I stained Mahogany Flame. It is quite dramatic, yet calming. I highlighted certain areas in stone, and others with foliage from local plants.  We installed a wheelchair accessible, concrete ramp, at a 3 degree gradient, to not only allow for a wheelchair, but also make it easier for luggage and minimize someone tripping. 

 On to the inside....

Posh, yet practical. Again, I put thought into every decision, researching what had the best reviews for comfort and functionality, while also balancing  function with form and design. I wanted to bring a little of the out side in, so I used a much more subtle grey, almost blue Pallet. I Then painted the  oak cabinets with the carbonized grey from outside. Additionally I used  western red cedar with the same  Is mahogany flame stain for crown molding. For a focal point, I had a custom mural done on the largest  wall. Its very thought provoking and perfect for the space which by the numbers seems small but with 12 foot high ceilings, makes it feel so much bigger.  I built and installed custom Acacia wood butcher block counter tops, with a Kraus workstation sink That I believe was intended to give a  farmhouse look, but it only lends to this funky design. It has a  built in chopping block and dish drainer. 

The kitchen was stocked with everything that a chef would appreciate. From  beautiful Damascus steel knives, to an Air fryer range that's front controlled and ADA compliant. Coffee and tea lovers? There is a Nespresso Machine that makes the absolute best coffee, stocked with Nespresso's best  coffee offerings as well as from Starbucks and other favorites. . There is a French Press, Bodum Pour over, Krups Noiseless grinder, and several different options for coffee in  fresh bean form in case you wanted to make your travelling companion their first pour over. Double walled glass  cappuccino and espresso mugs, and milk frother.  Individually wrapped tea bags from Twinning's, Taylors of Harrogate, Harford and Sons, and individually wrapped loose leaf tea from all over the world. There is an authentic cast iron Tetsubin  Japanese Tea set that, by the artist, was named after Rikyu (Rentarô Mikuni), a Buddhist priest who believes in the spiritual healing inherent in the traditional Japanese tea ceremony. There’s a Fellow Stagg EKG Digital kettle that’s ranked #1 by baristas and has a beautiful design. The best pour, for your pour-over. And only the best for you. 

Appreciate nice bath towels, or quality sleep? I chose to use  UGG Pacha line Turkish Cotton (and oversized) for all of the bath towels, hand towels, and wash cloths. I  Used UGG for most of the comforters and throws, and there will be several options for the guests when it comes to pillows and sheets, in case you don’t like the crazy high thread count Egyptian cotton ones that will be on the 14 inch hybrid, and fully adjustable bed. Makes it nice if you want to set the head up so you can watch the 75  inch tv,  with amazon prime, local cable, and top it off , a service that gives you every single cable channel from around the world, in different languages, including every single  pay per view event. It also has every single movie that comes out in theaters sometimes while they are still in the theaters. This is a legal service so there are no movies recorded with cellphones. I enjoy high quality Audio but had never bought anything from Klipsch. I wont ever buy anything else again.  You have a Klipsch Three 11 in the flat.   Bose, Sonos, eat your heart out. To sweeten the audio experience, is a fully automatic Audio Technica record player and a nice selection of records from every genre. Just let me know what tickles your fancy and it will be playing for you when you walk through the door. For you business travelers, there is  a wireless printer for your use. 

The lounging furniture are top grain leather , fully reclinable, with adjustable head and footrest, and lumbar also  with built in wireless charging for your phones. I have provided a few reading options including newer books, and a few dating all the way back to the 1850’s. Its really neat to look through them and compare societal differences of then and now and the amazing art done on old school press plates. There are few tastefully chosen board games. A bookcase edition scrabble, and a Luxury Edition Monopoly.  I built  a little area with accompaniments for adult beverages, and a nice Westin orange  juicer, which will always be accompanied by  fresh fruit, in case you would like to get up in the morning and juice some oranges for your “better half”. 

For you adult beverage drinkers there is a nice selection of glass ware. Vintage Paulaner Hefeweizen Glasses, which there are several already in the freezer for you. Huge Bordeaux glasses, glasses for white, lowballs, highballs and if you do partake please let me know in comments when you book that you are "RED" or "WHITE" and there will be such a thing in the gift basket for you.  

Custom built dining table made from Baltic Beechwood and then a triple coat of epoxy. I built this on an electric, noiseless air frame. You can raise and lower this table from 25 inches all the way up to 48 inches . Feel like standing,  great, sitting, even better. Disabled, I built this for you.  I think I blew ADA Compliant Standards out of the water on This  one. 

Last, but not least. The Bathroom. Continuing the décor, I installed  beautiful stone tile flooring, did the walls in a mute industrial concrete waterproof wallpaper. There is a really cool internally lit vanity mirror with a defogger that does not allow it to  get steamed up. My vision to work with local artists and craftsmen to showcase their work was fulfilled in the floating vanity and sink.  99timbers custom designed and built a live edge undermount and backsplash. It matches the beautiful foil-work sink . This sink is wheelchair accessible. There is a walk-in (or roll-in) modern steam shower. I chose grey stack stone and stunning turquoise subway tile, accentuated again by (a water suitable) choice of wood. Teak Floors and Teak Bench. This shower is 60 inches wide and 36 inches deep. It is wheelchair accessible. There is a 10 inch Kohler rain deluge, 8 body jets and an hand wand. Pressure? got pressure for days!!  Hot water you ask, well , I'm sure someone is going to test out that auto defog mirror. Its definitely a steam shower.  There are Turkish Cotton robes behind the bathroom door in multiple sizes for men and women. There is 3 different levels of toiletries based on the length of your stay. Our standard is  L'occitane Mer & Mistral,  If you're staying 3 nights or more you will receive Aprey Purple Water  (Exclusively used by the Ritz Carlton) if you choose to stay 5 nights or more you will receive  Hermès  eau d' orange vert.  Regardless of which level, you will receive shampoo, conditioner, shower gel, and body lotion.  There will also be an individually wrapped bar soap from Marseilles.

The unit is completly "smart" enabled. You can control everything with your voice. Lights, thermostat, doorlock, T.V.,  Alarm System, Vacuum cleanet. You can ask to see the doorbell camera and your vehicle on the 8 in screen in the Kitchen.  There is also another 5 inch screen. Both of these have manual camera shutters, and by protocol are never opened by me. If you choose to use them for video calling, you are doing so on your own accord. The only thing in the flat that is not smart controlled are the 2 chandeliers. There is too much wattage going through them. There is Also a hidden safe for your valuables. 

I hope you are ok with smart technology. There  is a virtual concierge that will greet you by name as you come in the front door and ask if you are formally checking in.  You will be given a menu of options, or you can ask exactly what you want. I have spent a great deal of time, programming information Such as info about the property , info on anything inside the flat and how to use it, restaurants, things to do, places to see, family friendly activities, hiking, shopping, etc...I have worked with many local restaurants and stores securing exclusive discount coupons for you, but you have to use the virtual concierge.  I have attached many pictures and videos,  of things in the flat that explain things better. So if you don't know how to make a pour over, it will teach you. 

I'm not going to list every little detail. I can only GUARANTEE you will not find anything like it locally, or for this price.  IF you do ill honor my guarantee and give you a weekend for free.

 I am also trying to set the bar for a different kind of service and go above and beyond. If you choose to book and will be staying at the flat long enough to need groceries, You can place a click list order and I will happily pick them up and have them stocked at the flat for you.  Local grocery store options are Kroger, Walmart, and Food Lion.

My father, myself, and generations in my family served in The United States Military. I am proud, and grateful  in offering a 15% military discount for Active Duty or former service members.  Please let me know before booking so that I can send you  the special offer. I would also ask that you provide some sort of verification.,  ie,  base card, VA ID, or DD214. You would want to think that no one would lie about serving in the military for a discount, but we all know better. This is actually a Federal crime punishable under The Stolen Valor Act of 2013 (revised from 2005).
sectionedDescription/summary: Enjoy a stylish experience at this centrally-located flat, in the WVU Tech University District. Designed for couples,This historic filling station was acquired,gutted and purposely rebuilt for you,the discerning traveler,the parents of the students, or the traveling Doctor or Nurse. Designed in an urban industrial style, he unit is completely smart enabled,handicap accessible and overflowing with amenities that you would only expect from the most well known 5 star resorts. 15% Military Discount.
sectionedDescription/transit: IF you are driving by car , there are two parking spaces in front of the airbnb dedicated solely for your use. Other than that the usual options are available, taxi, uber, public transportation. If you are in need of any information, please let me know and iIwill provide you everything.

sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Adventures (formerly Bramwell ATV Resort) offers a comfortable stay in Appalachian paradise. Our 6 riverfront rentals are a minute from the Hatfield-McCoy trails. If fishing's more your thing the Bluestone River is right out back. White-water rafting on the world-renowned Gauley or New River, zip-lining, hiking, biking or horseback riding at Pipestem Resort State Park...whatever fun mountain stuff you're into, you'll find it nearby.

The Sowers House is a riverfront house with a full kitchen, 3 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, dining room, living room, and individually controlled air conditioning.  The maximum capacity is 10 guests.  Sleeping accommodations include 1 queen bed, 1 full bed and 3 bunk beds. (A pull-out couch in the living room may be used to increase occupancy from 10 guests to 12.)  The kitchen is equipped with full-size refrigerator, oven/stove, dishes, pots, pans, cooking and eating utensils, coffee pot and microwave oven. WiFi is included, as well as onsite parking for trailers, trucks, and ATVs at no additional cost to our guests.

Holiday weekends during high season (April-October) require a three-night minimum stay. Off-season dates (November-March) require a two-night minimum stay.  If you're interested in kayaking the Bluestone River, please speak with owner to make arrangements.

sectionedDescription/description:
Property includes Four Luxury Chalets, nestled together, on the property of Pipestem Spa and Event Center. Pipestem Resort State Park is directly across the street.  Luxury spa services and many chalet amenities are available (please book those online).  

Well behaved small pets allowed with prior approval. Pet fee is $35 fee Per Pet, Per Day, to be paid to host upon arrival. If host is not notified of animals being present, the guest may be asked to leave immediately.

Cozy, two story, three bedroom chalet, fully equipped kitchen, with all linens provided. Relaxing front porch with comfortable chairs, charcoal BBQ grill, fire pit, flat screen TV with premium channels and w/d.

Guests have full access.

Contactless check-in. Guest will be sent an email with personal door code and Wi-Fi access one day before arrival.  Guest may arrive at any time after 4 PM, and check out is 10 AM. 

Massage, facial, hair and nail appointments for spa services must be booked in advance!


Guests may order Fruit and Cheese Trays, Champagne in Chalet, Romantic Couple's Massage with Foaming Milk Bubble Bath, King and Queen Packages, or Surprise Birthday Package (cake and balloons) in advance by contacting the host directly.

sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the entire Cabin in addition to the property the surrounds it. (The small sheds/garages on property are not part of the rental they are for house keeping and maintenance use only)
sectionedDescription/description:
Elk Creek Trail House #400 is an ideal location for HatField Mcoy trail riders and/or Motorcyclist exploring the southern West Virginia Hills. Located only 5 miles from the Hatfield Mcoy Buffalo mountain trail head #14. It is legal to ride the road to the trail head on UTV/ATV . There is a quick mart on the way where you can get gas, trail permits and snacks. ONLY 10 miles from route 119 on the famous Devils den Motorcycle routes which offers over 1000 miles of incredible Motorcycle riding.

Perfect for Trail riders, Motorcyclists or families just wanting to get away for a bit!
This spacious Cabin sits on 25 acres and offers plenty of parking on a stone drive way and features a flat concrete carport that is great for in between ride maintenance. This Cabin features a very large patio with a large BBQ grille. ( you will need to bring your own propane tank)There is a stream that runs through the front yard an a couple very nice overlooks on the property. The views are gorgeous. Located towards the end of a dead end road  with very little traffic.  Property has a large firepit and chairs to surround it. We have an additional 2 bedroom/1 bath private cabin  as a additional rental possibility at $150 per night just a short walk next door for larger groups that would require both. This is a separate rental not included.

You will have access to the entire Cabin in addition to the property the surrounds it. (The small sheds/garages on property are not part of the rental they are for house keeping and maintenance use only)

Available by text from 7am till 9pm
We have access to local support should anything need to be done quickly.

Nice quiet neighborhood surround by incredibly nice people

ATV, UTV and dirt bikes are all allowed to drive on the secondary roads (not highways or interstates) but you can go pretty much everywhere. helmets are required . obey normal traffic laws speeds and safety

Shopping center with Walmart, Lowes , and tractor supply just 30 min away.
Phone calls will have to be done over WIFI at the house

photos/0/caption: Living Room — Twin Bed can be set up in this space if requested when booking

primaryHost/about: I am a pharmacist from rural Appalachian Virginia. Married with 2 adult children with whom I enjoy traveling the world whenever possible.
sectionedDescription/access: The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.
sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom apartment in Cedar Bluff Virginia town limits. Sleeps 4-5. Friendly community. Tranquil setting in a rural town with a creek flowing nearby. 5 min to Richlands. 10 min from the local hospital, Clinch Valley Medical Center. 20 min to Tazewell. 15 min to the Dragon's Back. 75 min to Bristol Motor Speedway. Multiple 4-wheeler trails nearby. Local trout streams 30 minutes in any direction. Washer/Dryer access. Free coffee, and WiFi. Private 2nd-floor entrance via outdoor stairs.

Grocery stores and pharmacies are conveniently located only 6 minutes away. Only 1 mile from the Blue Tornadoes Football field. If you happen to be a football fan you can find the whole town at Richlands High School on Friday nights during the fall.

The entire upstairs apartment with access to a shared laundry room.

Available by phone. We live locally so are available in the event of an emergency.

Enjoy gorgeous foliage and a breathtaking view at Cedar Bluff Overlook. It is about a 30-minute hike on a marked trail. Enjoy scenic drives through the Clinch Mountains, East River Mountains, and the Appalachian Mountains all around the area.
The Cedar Bluff Heritage Festival occurs annually on the third Saturday of September. You will find antique dealers and food vendors among many other activities. The festival attracts thousands of visitors and hundreds of vendors each year.  OKTOBREWFEST is a festival that is held on beautiful historic Main St. Tazewell, VA the first Saturday of October and was created to promote the craft beer industry in southwest VA and the surrounding area. It is the Premier Craft Beer Festival of the Heart of Appalachia.  There are several local restaurants of note, Cuz’s restaurant has been named the best in off-the-beaten-track restaurant categories. Bearded Moose is a frequented local barbecue restaurant loved by locals, and you can enjoy a sweet treat at Sugarfoot Bakery only 6 minutes away. Painted Peak Brewing Company is approximately 25 minutes away from the apartment where you can sample local brews. Multiple hiking trails and 4 wheeler trails are options for your entertainment. Kayaking and canoeing are available at local lakes and rivers. Enjoy Crab Orchard Museum located about 15 minutes away to learn more about the history in our area.
The apartment is located approximately 30 min from the Appalachian College of Pharmacy and approximately 13 minutes from Southwest Community College. Raven Theater is a historic site located about 10 minutes away. Limited show-times and hours, but when they are open it is a special stop for soda fountain ice cream.  Broadway Cinemas is the local contemporary theater located about 6 minutes away.

The town of Cedar Bluff has sidewalks with lights and you can enjoy a leisurely afternoon stroll. 4 County Transit offers public transportation. Town route fare is 25¢ per boarding.
Work express fare is 50¢ per boarding.
College routes are public routes and open to anyone who wants to ride. Fare for public riders is $1.00 per boarding.
College route fare is FREE for college students and staff/faculty who present college ID, seniors at least 60 years old, and children 5 or younger who are accompanied by an adult.
At your request, the bus can stop at other locations that are along its route. This is a route deviation service. 
Please call at least 48 hours in advance with your requests. 
Check out their website for additional information.

sectionedDescription/access: Whole cabin
sectionedDescription/description:
This cozy little cabin is the closest lodge to Braveheart and Rockhouse Trailheads. Located on the Guyandotte river, park your rig and ride your ATV’s anywhere.
Located in a quiet, peaceful community, you will see kids riding their bicycles, duck and geese in the backyard and a puppy or two needing a belly rub! Great folks to welcome you to Hatfield Mcoy trails! Try us once, you’ll be back!

Whole cabin

We are available 24/7 and always close by. As little or as much interaction as you wish!

Less than 1 mile to Rockhouse Trailhead and Braveheart Trailhead. Town of Man, food, nightlife, grocery store, Hardee’s, Wendy’s, Fuel, Dollar General, Ice cream and more!

Park your trailer and ride your machines anywhere!!!

sectionedDescription/description:
We invite you to kick back and enjoy a taste of the country life while visiting beautiful Appalacia.  One hundred year old farm house that is newly renovated on 16 acres of Appalachian hardwood forest and pasture land and situated just 2.5 miles from the Hatfield and McCoy Trail System and 30 minutes to Winterplace.  Located centrally between the cities Bluefield and Princeton, while being conveniently located two miles from Bluewell and just six miles from historic Bramwell, WV.

Beautiful 16 acres for wooded landscape cover with chicory plants which Bluefield was named after.

sectionedDescription/access:
As a guest, you will have access to the entire house, with the exception of the main bedroom.  We believe in providing our guests with privacy and comfort, and the main bedroom is designated as private for the homeowner and tour guide.  Rest assured, you will still have access to all the other rooms and amenities available in the house.  You can relax in the living room, cook delicious meals in the kitchen, enjoy meals in the dining area.  We want to ensure that your stay is both enjoyable and respectful of everyone's privacy.  If you have any specific needs or requests, please let us know, and we will do our best to accommodate them.  

Thank you for choosing Dirtman's Digs," we hope you have a fantastic experience with us!
sectionedDescription/description:
Explore with an "On Site" Expert Tour Guide, the Hatfield McCoy Trails, in the Serene Appalachian Mountains!  Ample Parking, Delightful breakfast, Reliable Cell Service, High-Speed Internet, Spacious Group Accommodations, Cozy Living Room.  Enjoy the Advantages of a Prime Location near Town w Restaurants, Access to ATV Wash & Gas Stations.  An ultimate package of Perks! Ideal for Couples, Group of Buddies, Families with ATV Enthusiastic Kids.  Bring your own ATV or Inquire about Rental Options.

Welcome To "Dirtman's Digs" - A  Guided Hatfield McCoy Tour w Lodging and Breakfast!  (Ask your tour guide, Brent, how he got the nickname)

Looking for an exhilarating ATV Adventure with your buddies, family, or significant other?  Look no further!  Our accommodation is perfect for groups of friends looking to conquer the ATV trails and have a memorable stay! 

Your "On Site" Tour Guide will ensure that you have an unforgettable experience exploring the Hatfield McCoy Trails.  

Our fully furnished home provides ample space for your group, ensuring a comfortable and enjoyable stay after a day of riding.  You have the option to bring your own ATV or rent a Can Am X3 (2 or 4 seats) to ride directly from the property to the trails.  

To start your mornings off right,  we offer a light breakfast to fuel your adventure.  You can count on reliable cell service and high-speed internet to stay connected and share your epic experience with the world.  

After a thrilling day on the trails,  kick back in our cozy living room, after taking hot showers, and relive the adrenaline-pumping moments.  We offer plenty of parking for your vehicles and trailers, making it convenient for you to load and unload your ATVs.  

If you've worked up and appetite, there are restaurants and bars nearby where you can refuel with delicious meals.  Buffalo Trail Restaurant & Bar, is 1 mile away, with a toasty firepit and outdoor patio.  Amenities like TVs in the living room, back porch grills, a spacious kitchen, with a large seating area, all provides a central gathering space for guests to share meals,  play games, engage in conversations, and keep your entertainment going.  Offering TVs in the bedrooms, provides guests with the option of enjoying some private entertainment and relaxation in the comfort of their own rooms.  We prioritize your comfort with new beds and fresh clean linens. Your host is also on site if you need recommendations or Comic Relief, He loves to Entertain! 

Our location offers easy access to the Hatfield McCoy trails, allowing you to ride right from our doorstep.  Enjoy the convenience of riding your ATV directly from our property,  without the need to move your truck.

Overall, having a tour guide to help navigate the Hatfield McCoy trails, can make the experience more enjoyable, and hassle free for our guests.   Allowing you to focus on experiencing the journey, without worrying about getting lost or getting stuck.  Having winches available and a well prepared plan, can provide a sense of security for guests, and address any potential predicaments that may arise during the tour.  Our guided tour package, allows you to leave the map reading to us, and enjoy a stress-free adventure that won't break your budget, in the comfort of our home away from home!

So, gather your buddies and get ready for an unforgettable  ATV adventure.

As a guest, you will have access to the entire house, with the exception of the main bedroom.  We believe in providing our guests with privacy and comfort, and the main bedroom is designated as private for the homeowner and tour guide.  Rest assured, you will still have access to all the other rooms and amenities available in the house.  You can relax in the living room, cook delicious meals in the kitchen, enjoy meals in the dining area.  We want to ensure that your stay is both enjoyable and respectful of everyone's privacy.  If you have any specific needs or requests, please let us know, and we will do our best to accommodate them.  

Thank you for choosing Dirtman's Digs," we hope you have a fantastic experience with us!

By staying on-site and cooking breakfast, you'll have the utmost flexibility and convenience, allowing you to start the day exactly as you wish, before embarking on an unforgettable trail riding adventure.  Please let us know if you prefer minimal interaction after the tour, or if you enjoy getting to know your host, who is happy to answer questions and get to know you.

The Airbnb house being located in town with all essential amenities nearby (such as Dollar Store, grocery store, tire store, ATV repair store, restaurants, gas, about everything you’ll need) can save time and effort during your stay.  Another perk is reduced wear and tear on your truck and trailers.  Avoiding the cost of towing them up the mountain long distances, adds to the ease and enjoyment of your stay.

Please specify how many trucks and trailers you will be bringing, so that I can provide appropriate parking spaces to accommodate you.  
When you arrive: Park on the gravel in front of the house, there is additional parking in the rear of the house, unload, you're welcome to enter the house, and drive your side by side or ATV anywhere you want to go in WV.

Your trail riding experience is customizable, and there is no strict time frame to follow.  As your guide, my goal is to create a personalized adventure that aligns with your riding preferences and showcases the places you'd like to see.  

Please let me know what kind of trail riding you enjoy, whether its scenic trails, challenging terrains, or a mix of both.  Additionally, if there are specific landmarks, viewpoints, or trails you'd like to visit during your rides, please share them with me.

*Our Nightly Rate is for up to 10 Guests, $100 Fee for each additional Guest*

rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Experience the beauty and culture of Southwest Virginia and enjoy the serenity of mountain life in beautiful Burkes Garden. This picturesque farming community sits in the highest valley in Virginia designated a Rural Historic District. Nestled beside the Parsonage Guest House, our cottage called "the Little House" is a vintage 50's cottage but with all the modern conveniences. With one queen and one  double bed it is perfect for 3 to 4 people or a couple's retreat.

The entire house is rented to one party at a time.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: The entire house is rented to one party at a time.
