sectionedDescription/access: When you pull onto the property at Mont Calm the guesthouse has a gravel driveway that circles around to the house.  If you face the front of the main house, the guest house is on the left.
sectionedDescription/description:
Mont Calm is a Historic Landmark on the National Register, built by Governor David Campbell in 1827.  The guesthouse sits on a quiet 12 acres in the center of Abingdon.  The driveway meets the Virginia Creeper Trail head and all of Downtown is a short walk!

Mont Calm is truly a unique property with an abundance of History.  Many characters of note have graced this property over the years including a president.  Since 1827 The Town of Abingdon has grown up around it, but with a wooded perimeter on 12 acres you would never know it.

When you pull onto the property at Mont Calm the guesthouse has a gravel driveway that circles around to the house.  If you face the front of the main house, the guest house is on the left.

Please let us know if there is anything we can do to make your stay perfect.  We are happy to help in any way we can.  Suggestions on places to go, things to do, where to eat, etc.

The Guest House at Mont Calm is located in the center of Abingdon, Virginia.  You will be walking distance from The Virginia Creeper Trail, Grocery Store, Restaurants, Banking, UPS Store, and all of Downtown Abingdon

Walk, Ride a bike, or Drive.  Abingdon is small and we like it that way:)
sectionedDescription/houseRules: No smoking in the house.  Be respectful of the property.  Pets should stay off of the furniture at all times;)

primaryHost/about: We provide rentals in the historic district of Abingdon, so that guests can feel apart of our wonderful community. We enjoy traveling to other destinations and staying in similar properties. We hope that you will find our lovingly restored properties a joy!
sectionedDescription/access: Guests  will have access to the entire property. Parking is on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Brook/Creekside Is a charming and spacious five-bedroom property in the historic area of Abingdon. The house will sleep maximum of 10  five bedrooms and is in a perfect location for exploring town. The property is situated on a beautiful acre lot with the Old Town Creek running through the back yard.  Hop on the sidewalk To enjoy  shopping, dining and activities. Enjoy the wonderful outdoor space with two fire pits and outside dining area.

The main part of the house includes three bedrooms (2 queens and 4 twins) which will sleep up to 8; 2 full baths, a fully equipped kitchen and spacious living and dining areas as well as a separate den/tv room . A separate lower level a with private entrance includes two bedrooms ( 1 queen and 1 full)  with one and a half baths, kitchen, living/dining area.  The outdoor spaces are perfect for gathering and include a patio, spacious deck porch with dining area and outdoor fire pit area by the creek. Please note there is no interior staircase between the main house and  the downstairs. You access the space from the upper back porch to lower patio.

Guests  will have access to the entire property. Parking is on the property.

We are always available for questions and easy to reach if there is a problem. We are more than willing to help with planning your trip to Abingdon and suggesting all things you should do and say as well ask right dining and shopping We are always available for questions and easy to reach if there is a problem. We are more than willing to help with planning your trip to Abingdon and suggesting all things you should do and see as well as wonderful  dining and shopping suggestions.

This property is located in the perfect area for exploring town. Sidewalks connect you to anywhere you want to go. We are located on Abingdon’s oldest residential street which runs parallel to Main Street   and is  close to many fine restaurants, great shopping and our local brewery. The trail head for the Creeper trail is a 10 minute bike ride from the house.

All points of interest in Abingdon are easily reached by walking or biking.

Guests will also receive complimentary  pastries and juice for their first morning as well as coffee and tea to enjoy during their stay. Catering is available from area chefs and can be arranged through us.

name: MemeTori Cozy Vacation House
sectionedDescription/description:
Loving 2 story home built in 1910! Sitting above the street has steps to access the home but it allows for a great view overlooking Hinton and the New River.Perfect for adventure seekers, fisherman, hunters or just relaxing.Minutes from kayaking, rafting, and hiking! Newly remodeled, washer and dryer, WIFI, and has two fireplaces.We love our home in this old town.WinterPlace ski resort 19 miles.5 miles distance from Bluestone damn, New River, and Pipestem State Park.9 miles Sandstone waterfalls.

WinterPlace ski resort 19 miles. Few minutes to kayaking and rafting!!! 5 miles distance from Bluestone damn, New River, and Pipestem State Park. 9 miles Sandstone waterfalls. 25 miles Grandview National Park. 43 miles from caverns.

name: Winterplace Condo E201
primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring and fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort. This condo is located on the second floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests.
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Extra-large deck to enjoy the views from.
~ DETAILS ~
~ Sleeps: up to 10  (for stays under 10 days) 
~ Master Bedroom: 1 Queen Size Bed with attached bath 
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed
~ Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (Bunk)
~ Living Room: 1 Double Size Futon and a couch with recliners on opposite ends
~ Cable TV in Living Room and all three bed rooms
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen
~ Ski Rack
~ Small Dryer in the condo
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details. 
~ Good views of Winterplace Ski Resort
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation.
The living room consist of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains.
Everything you need to create great family memories!
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the sliding glass door. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.

~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of. There are several state and national parks near by, like Little Beaver State Park and Grandview National Park. We are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

name: Historic, fully equipped 2-bedroom apartment
sectionedDescription/description:
We are a family orientated facility, proud to offer quality large two-bedroom apartments featuring spacious private bathrooms, entertainment space, full kitchens. Bramwell, “Home of the Millionaires” is not to be missed!
We are ATV friendly and parking is available for trucks and trailers. The original Pocahontas Trailhead is just down the road. Pocahontas connects you to Pinnacle Creek and Warrior trail systems as well as outlaw trails.
This apartment has 1 king, 1 queen, & 1 full sleeper sofa.

additionalHouseRules: I ask guests to avoid any scented (fragranced)  body lotions,  colognes, shampoos etc  in the house. Other guests may also be staying here who have allergies and sensitivities. And for housekeeping, it can take multiple washings to remove some scents.  I do offer fragrance-free shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soap, or  laundry soap as amenities that you are welcome to use!   GOATS: Please check with me before feeding them or opening gates. CHECKOUT: If your stay is on a Saturday, I request a 9 a.m. Sunday checkout, but any other day it's 10 a.m. as listed.Thank you!

primaryHost/about:
Part of what made us want to be an Airbnb hosts is the wonderful hospitality we've known in our own travels.  As native Appalachians, my husband and I have a deep love for this region and its people and the tradition of hospitality.  We are both artists of sorts--I'm a freelance writer/reporter and he is a rock 'n roll keyboard player and works in the local school system. And we manage a herd of dairy goats, mostly LaMancha breed. All with names and personalities. Our place is about 15-20  minutes off off I-77. We're close to the notable "Back of the Dragon" motorcycle routes. And very close to some beautiful backroad bicycle routes. The scenery is beautiful all seasons of the year but especially the fall. We hope you'll visit!

 As for the goats, they are "the greatest entertainers and the greatest time wasters" as my dad used to say. He was a vet and built the house as a home and office. So it has a sort of historic/museum feel in certain sections. 

We don't guarantee food as part of our Airbnb listing,  but I love to cook and if I'm cooking, you're welcome to join us if you don't have other plans. 

Last but not least, we  love to know a little about our guests beforehand so PLEASE make sure you fill out the "Describe Yourself" questions under the Airbnb profile section to speed along the booking process.

Safe travels!
sectionedDescription/access: Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)
sectionedDescription/description:
This is the best sleeping room in the house. Hot water radiator heat keeps the room warm in the winter and concrete floors keep it comfortably cool in the summer. There's access to a full bath with tub and shower but you must walk up a flight of stairs. I also try to keep the house as free from allergens/fragrances as possible for guests who have sensitivities (noted in House Rules below).

The wi-fi is very poor in the bedroom but great in the parlor room just down the hall.

Spaces that guests share with host: the piano/parlor room -- a great place to sit down and read books by local authors, play the upright grand piano or access wi-fi.  The kitchen and dining area are available too, as shared space. The back porch is yours to enjoy, and it's right next to the goats. (Let me know ahead of time if you're interested in any hikes on the premises and if the weather is right, someone will try to be available to show you some beautiful views.)

I'm in and out of the spaces with shared access but your bed and bath are always private. I like to socialize and interact with guests but I'm also happy to leave you to your own privacy.

There's a great little biking road about 1/4 mile from my home that lots of bikers love to ride. About 5 miles away is a great mountain bike trail at the Blfd WV city park. For more serious bikers, there's the Burkes Garden trail. 
For hikers, Lincolnshire Park, about 13 miles away in Tazewell, has features so beautiful you will think you're in the The Hobbit's  "Shire." 
For other things to do and places to eat, see my Guidebook section of Guest Resources.

The Town of Bluefield, Va. operates Graham Transit. Graham Transit runs three deviated fixed routes throughout the area each day. I am a 5 minute walk from the closest bus route stop.  Bus route schedules are listed on the Town of Bluefield, Va. official website.

Please have the the Airbnb "describe yourself" profile questions filled out (type traveler you are, etc) before you request to book. Also, the local (county) occupancy tax is included in the room price.

name: Wayne's Outlaw Retreat
sectionedDescription/access: We have plenty of parking on both sides of the house and in the backyard.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our home is located in the ATV friendly town of Mullens, with easy access to the  Pinnacle Creek trail which connects to Indian Ridge and Pocahontas with  plenty of Outlaw trails in between.  We are a family of riders, so we have made our place the perfect retreat for a families and riders alike.

Our place is very open, spacious, comfortable and most importantly clean. We have fast WIFI, a fully equipped kitchen, a stocked laundry room, a charcoal grill with seating outside, a fire ring, two smart TVs, and a jacuzzi tub in the master.

We have plenty of parking on both sides of the house and in the backyard.

Guest can always reach me by email at sebouch23@gmail.com

Quaint, quiet neighborhood.

We have plenty of parking at the home, ATV friendly town can ride to trails, gas, restaurants, groceries, and more.

p3SummaryAddress: Meadow Creek, West Virginia, United States

primaryHost/about: Welcome to Richmond's Meadow Creek Hideaway.  My husband & I have owned our small vacation rental business for 15 years.  We own a full size cottage on the riverfront along with a separate garage Apartment.  Both are open year round.  From April to October, we have three cedar sided cabins also available for rental.  All of our properties are located in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, Summers County, West Virginia.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Our Cabin has free parking, a large wooden deck with a propane grill, a fire pit out back and firewood too.
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to Cabin #4, our fun sized hunting themed cabin.  Our cabin is 120 sf, roughly the size of a standard bedroom.  It has a loft with a full size futon mattress, a roll-up pillow top mat, (perfect for a child to sleep on), a futon sofa/bed, kitchenette, bath with shower, and a large deck.  The Cabin is fully furnished, has ac/heating, satellite tv, Wifi, and both a fire pit and wood. This cabin is open seasonally April through October yearly.

Our fun sized Cabin #4is located in the New River Gorge National Park & Preserve, three miles off I-64 at Meadow Creek.  We are a short drive to historic Hinton, WV, Lewisburg, White Sulphur Springs, and Fayetteville, WV.  

We are 4/10s of a mile from public access to the New River and to the Meadow Creek stream.

Our Cabin has free parking, a large wooden deck with a propane grill, a fire pit out back and firewood too.

My husband and I live in Meadow Creek and can be available as needed.

Our Cabins are located in the New River Gorge National Park at Meadow Creek.  We are an easy access to I-64.  Nearby attractions include the New, Greenbrier and Bluestone Rivers, Sandstone Visitors Center, Bluestone Lake, Pipestem State Park, Bluestone State Park, historic Hinton, WV, Lewisburg, White Sulphur Springs and Fayetteville, WV, and Winterplace Ski Resort.

Personal transportation.

Our Cabin is fully furnished with all linens, a coffee pot, microwave, toaster oven, dish ware, satellite tv and ac.

As Meadow Creek is a small railroad community, trains travel through Meadow Creek on no certain schedule.  You will hear the trains as well as their whistle.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
We hope you enjoy our fun sized cabin and simply ask that you clean-up after yourself by placing trash in the trash can provided, wash dishes, and place laundry in the hamper provided.  If you bring a dog, please clean-up after your dog and should you opt to leave your animal alone, please leave them in a crate in order to deter damage to our cabins.  
*Smoking is allowed in outside areas where sand buckets are placed for cigarette butts.
sectionedDescription/interaction: My husband and I live in Meadow Creek and can be available as needed.

sectionedDescription/description:
This newly renovated house is located just minutes between the very popular Hatfield McCoy Trail heads for Buffalo Mountain and Devil Anse. The Dollar General grocery store is also located within 1 mile for all of your grocery needs.  This entire house offers 3 bedrooms with 5 beds, full kitchen, living room, washer and dryer, bathroom, fire pit, ping pong table, outdoor grill, and free parking with room for a large trailer.  Additional amenities include WiFi, TV, and a spacious backyard.

You will love staying at our property!  There is plenty of parking on both sides of the house.

We are almost always available by phone or text to help our guests.  We also live right across the street and we live right across the street from the house.  We love interacting with our guests!

Murphy Branch is a wonderful neighborhood.  We have a Dollar General Store approximately 1/2 mile up the road.

Our town is ATV friendly as long as helmets are worn.  There is parking on both sides of the house.

primaryHost/about: Husband & Wife with two sons and two dogs, who live on a farm in the mountains of rural WV.  We love enjoying the relaxing peace of farm life!
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to the cottage house and acreage around that home outdoor fire ring with firewood available, as well as charcoal grill and miles of trails. Two ponds on the property for feeding fish and catch and release fishing. Apple picking during Sept and October with two apple trees in the yard, and numerous trees on the property!
sectionedDescription/description:
Come enjoy quiet seclusion on a 140 acre farm located 5 miles from Winterplace ski resort and Weathered Grounds Brewery in Ghent WV! Self check-in on a private half mile long road. Feed the fish with two ponds full of trout,  blue gill, coy, bass and catfish.  Hike or mountain bike on logging trails throughout the property while stopping to pick blackberries or apples. Then come drink hot chocolate next to the fireplace, or have a glass of wine while watching the sunset on the covered porch!

The space is the entire 3 bedroom cottage.  This cottage house sleeps 8 people comfortably.  There are also two friendly German Shepherds at our home on the property inside our home.

Guests have access to the cottage house and acreage around that home outdoor fire ring with firewood available, as well as charcoal grill and miles of trails. Two ponds on the property for feeding fish and catch and release fishing. Apple picking during Sept and October with two apple trees in the yard, and numerous trees on the property!

Hosts live in separate residence on property.

Odd WV is a rural town, off of the Ghent exit, between Beckley and Princeton WV. This secluded farm property  is 25 mins from Beckley and Princeton, and 40 mins from Fayetteville.  Fayetteville is the home of white water rafting, rock climbing, Outdoor Mountain Music Festivals, as well as, many local farm to table restaurants, independent coffee shops and breweries .   Our farm is also a hour from Summersville, Lewisburg and White Sulfur Springs, home of the Greenbriar.  It is also 1 hour from Blacksburg VA.

On the property mountain biking and hiking are good options for exploring.  Miles of old logging trails are available for this. 
From  the months of  Oct- March 4 wheel drive or AWD vehicles are necessary for accessing the property due to the large amount of snow that falls here.

Entire 140 acres are fenced in, so miles of hiking and you will not go off of the farm unless you cross over a fence line.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Must have 4 wheel drive vehicle if you book with us during Oct-March
Must follow checkout procedure requirements.
No swimming in ponds or climbing in treehouse.

sectionedDescription/access: Guests will have access to the entire cabin (excepting a crawl space) and land around the cabin. It also has landline for domestic calls and emergencies.
sectionedDescription/description:
Up on the Laurel’s Dongola Cabin is a secluded, compact 384 square foot cabin designed to be a place for recreating, writing, relaxing and star-gazing. It sits on the south side of Iron Mountain in the Jefferson National Forest’s Mount Rogers National Recreation Area and takes in the scenic views of Whitetop Mountain and Mount Rogers. Its proximity to sites and towns of middle Appalachia, along with its fresh water, fresh air and relaxed pace make our cabin a lovely spot to visit.

Dongola Cabin is ten miles south of Interstate-81 and the town of Chilhowie, Virginia. Atlanta, Charlotte, Roanoke, Richmond, Knoxville, and Washington DC are each between two and six hours drive. Our accommodation includes high speed internet, full kitchen and laundry facilities.  Please note, the nightly rate includes a 5% occupancy tax for Smyth County.  

**We aim to make the cabin as safe as possible for your visiting pleasure.  We disinfect the cabin after each guest and we do not allow back-to-back bookings in order to decrease the possibility of community transmission.**

Guests will have access to the entire cabin (excepting a crawl space) and land around the cabin. It also has landline for domestic calls and emergencies.

We are available by telephone/email/text message for any guests queries or emergencies.

Nearby, several trail heads intersect, including the well-known Appalachian and Virginia Creeper Trails (others include the Iron Mountain Trail, the Skulls Gap Trail, the Buzzard Rock Trail, the Bear Tree Gap Trail, the Straight Mountain Trail, the Straight Branch Trail, and the Pine Mountain Trail). Hundreds of wild blueberry bushes yield end-of-summer fruit on Whitetop and Pine Mountains. Steep mountain valleys and hollows display the colors of Spring and Autumn foliage. The Whitetop Laurel Creek, a notable wild trout stream, stretches for twelve miles down the valley floor and provides year-round fishing as well as five miles of fully accessible recreation facilities with wildlife viewing platforms in the Creek Junction area.

Scenic and historic routes surround Dongola Cabin, including the famous Route 58 ('The Crooked Road'), Grayson Highlands State Park and Parkway, the balds at Elk Garden, and the highest elevated road in Virginia towards the peak of Whitetop Mountain. From Dongola Cabin, outdoor enthusiasts can rent bicycles and lazily (or not) ride 15 miles down the Virginia Creeper Trail to the town of Damascus, take a daylong horseback ride into Pine Mountain and Mount Rogers, or just take in the vista from Dongola Cabin's spacious front porch and vintage gliding swing.

The nearest grocery store is about 30 minutes away in Chilhowie. The cabin will have basic pantry items and a few provisions for emergencies, but guests should be sure to shop for groceries before their arrival. Also, check out: the Konnarock Store and the Whitetop Store which are nearby; the Barter Theatre, and Bella's Pizza in Abingdon; the Damascus Brewery in Damascus.

sectionedDescription/access: Entrance access is private to guest through the front. Guest environment includes the spacious bedroom, private bath which extends to the Adirondack chairs in the front yard which are a great place to put your feet up with a good book.
sectionedDescription/description:
Find Serenity in Abingdon...
This quite location so close to town offers quick assess, convenience and nature at its best.

Beautiful private home has park like setting in quaint Abingdon Va. This private home has artsy and eclectic with old world charm and character. A large spacious room awaits you diverse travelers.

Entrance access is private to guest through the front. Guest environment includes the spacious bedroom, private bath which extends to the Adirondack chairs in the front yard which are a great place to put your feet up with a good book.

We are there for our guest in every way.  
Please feel free to contact me via text or phone for any questions for needs that you may have. The caretaker is also available by phone only.

*We are conveniently located to exits 17, 14, and 13 of interstate 81. 

*Main Street Abingdon is a 5-7 minute drive. Creeper trail starts there.  

*The Holston lake boat ramp is about 7 minutes away.  

*Bristol is a quick 12 minutes.

Our neighborhood is a fresh, peaceful and quiet environment. Friendly but loosely populated where  nature abounds. Most mornings you awaken to birds singing and interacting with one another. As an avid birder, I can hear the sounds of golden finches, siskins, chickadee, crows, geese, jays, cardinals just to name a few in throughout the day. While you are welcome to enjoy the front yard and witness beautiful sunrises, sunsets, bunnies scampering and occasionally deer running, it’s a wonderful place to recharge your batteries and regain your balance.

Car or horse is the best transportation unless you can ride a bike up and down the mountains well. Strong legs recommended....

EXTRA attention for sanitizing is crucial. It is imperative these days to promote a safe and germ free environment. We strive for a germ free home. Hand sanitizer, gloves and Lysol are available. 

Bedrooms and bathrooms are thoroughly cleaned and sanitized with antibacterial products. All sheets and towels are sanitized in hot water and antibacterials. 

Our goal is to promote a comfortable germ free environment for your safety and ultimate relaxation.

To maintain a cleaner and healthy indoor environment; please leave your shoes at the shoe tray  inside near the front door.
House shoes are required to ensure a more germ free environment and your comfort. Also please wear mask in the common areas.

Our home is about positivity and comfort.  Come unwind relax and enjoy all that Abingdon has to offer.

name: Mountain Trails ATV SXS Cabin #2 Off-Road Lodging
sectionedDescription/access: DOOR ENTRY CODE: The house has a lock on the entry door with a numeric keypad. Your entry code will be active from 4PM on your arrival date through 10AM on your departure date. Your door code will be provided in your reminder notice that will be emailed to you upon your final payment
sectionedDescription/description:
WELCOME TO MOUNTAIN TRAILS OFF-ROAD LODGING WV

We are a small campground but have several campsites that are ideal for either tent camping or toy hauler/RV camping. Our standard cabin is equipped with AC/heat and full size fridge.

We cater to ATV, SXS, and off road riders who come to the Southern West Virginia area to ride the trails here. Situated close to HMT and outlaw trails. You can ride from camp with no need to trailer your machines.

DOOR ENTRY CODE: The house has a lock on the entry door with a numeric keypad. Your entry code will be active from 4PM on your arrival date through 10AM on your departure date. Your door code will be provided in your reminder notice that will be emailed to you upon your final payment

By renting this house you agree to the following terms and conditions:

REMINDER NOTICE: You are responsible for printing and bringing the reminder notice that we will email to you when your final payment is received. The reminder notice will have the physical address of the community for your GPS, gate access instructions, the door entry code as well as some other important information. If you have not received this reminder notice with your final payment confirmation you must let us know prior to your arrival date.

CHECK-IN is at 10:00 AM or after.

CHECK OUT is at 6:00 PM or earlier.
You must check out by 6:00 PM; otherwise, any delays to the check-out give us a charge by the cleaning company is USD $100 per fraction and/or entire hour delayed on your check-out and this charge will be passed on to you via Resolution Center. We reserve the right to remove any luggage and other personal belongings from the house.

OWNER: Owner shall provide all utilities, furnishings, towels, linens and starter bathroom supplies. Owner is not responsible for any utility or cable/internet interruptions during the guests stay but will make every attempt to have the utility/cable company restore their services as soon as possible.

GUEST: Guest agrees to leave unit in the same condition as found. Furniture must be in the same location as when you arrived. Dishes, pots and pans must be properly cleaned as to not have any baked on food, all trash (water bottles, boxes, bags etc) must be picked up and put out for the trash during your stay and upon departure. Any damage to the unit will be your responsibility. You are responsible for making sure the cabin/home is properly secured at all times. Owner assumes no liability for property loss or damage, nor liability for accidents or injury.

**Service calls deemed non-emergencies where a staff member made it out to the property and a non-emergency service was provided after hours will incur a $75 fee. Note that our ability to respond to unforeseen circumstances may vary on a third party provider.**

The house will be inspected before your arrival and immediately after your departure.

sectionedDescription/notes:
By renting this house you agree to the following terms and conditions:

REMINDER NOTICE: You are responsible for printing and bringing the reminder notice that we will email to you when your final payment is received. The reminder notice will have the physical address of the community for your GPS, gate access instructions, the door entry code as well as some other important information. If you have not received this reminder notice with your final payment confirmation you must let us know prior to your arrival date.

CHECK-IN is at 10:00 AM or after.

CHECK OUT is at 6:00 PM or earlier.
You must check out by 6:00 PM; otherwise, any delays to the check-out give us a charge by the cleaning company is USD $100 per fraction and/or entire hour delayed on your check-out and this charge will be passed on to you via Resolution Center. We reserve the right to remove any luggage and other personal belongings from the house.

OWNER: Owner shall provide all utilities, furnishings, towels, linens and starter bathroom supplies. Owner is not responsible for any utility or cable/internet interruptions during the guests stay but will make every attempt to have the utility/cable company restore their services as soon as possible.

GUEST: Guest agrees to leave unit in the same condition as found. Furniture must be in the same location as when you arrived. Dishes, pots and pans must be properly cleaned as to not have any baked on food, all trash (water bottles, boxes, bags etc) must be picked up and put out for the trash during your stay and upon departure. Any damage to the unit will be your responsibility. You are responsible for making sure the cabin/home is properly secured at all times. Owner assumes no liability for property loss or damage, nor liability for accidents or injury.

The house will be inspected before your arrival and immediately after your departure.
sectionedDescription/summary:
WELCOME TO MOUNTAIN TRAILS OFF-ROAD LODGING WV

We are a small campground but have several campsites that are ideal for either tent camping or toy hauler/RV camping. Our standard cabin is equipped with AC/heat and full size fridge.

We cater to ATV, SXS, and off road riders who come to the Southern West Virginia area to ride the trails here. Situated close to HMT and outlaw trails. You can ride from camp with no need to trailer your machines.

primaryHost/about: My families connection with this mountain goes back 40 years and we are so excited to share its breathtaking beauty with you!
sectionedDescription/access: The cabin is easily accessible by most cars  and we offer parking right outside of the cabin.  Our cabins offer the closest parking and access to the Channels.
sectionedDescription/description:
Retreat to the serenity of this newly renovated, sustainable getaway and enjoy the natural beauty of the area. Lucky Bear is a rustic cabin that rests on a scenic hiking trail on Brumley Mountain. A welcome and calming paradise for those who love nature, you will fall in love with its charm and open floor plan. With each stay fresh towels and linens are furnished.

Before you make your Reservation 
MAKE SURE YOUR GUEST COUNT IS CORRECT.           

Welcome to your stay at the Channels Retreat . This is a perfect place for hikers or a relaxing getaway.

Situated  along The Brumley Mountain Trail and bordering the Channels State Forest, This picturesque 4 acre meadow is home to a newly remodeled off grid, solar-powered studio cabin featuring a queen bed ,full bath and with additional loft featuring 1 full size bed.

The loft area has low clearance sloped ceilings but can still comfortably sleep adults.

Well appointed kitchen is fully stocked with all the necessities you need to cook your meals such as pots, pans and silverware. It features a gas stove with oven. 

Water is provided via well with filtration system that includes UV light for excellent purification. 

Cabin is heated by a gas log stove unit.

Outside of the cabin, there is a huge covered front porch and a dining table and 2 rockers to relax in, just off the porch, a picnic table and a gas grill.

While the cabin's address is listed as being in Saltville VA, the property is actually located in Washington County and is closer to the Abingdon VA area on Hayter's Gap Road 
Rt. 80.

For more information go to channelsretreat .com

The cabin is easily accessible by most cars  and we offer parking right outside of the cabin.  Our cabins offer the closest parking and access to the Channels.

We look forward to having you and are available should you have any questions during your stay. Feel free to contact me at any time with any questions or concerns that you may have.
Please reach out to me at least an hour before your arrival so that I can give you your key code, and answer any questions you may have.

Sit under the stars by night and under the magnificent canopy of shade trees by day.

Clinch Mountain is home to beautiful plant life and undergrowth, while a variety of deciduous trees form a towering canopy above.

 It is truly a birdwatcher and botanist paradise. 

Location is right on the trail leading to Channels  and is the last privately owned parcel upon entering channels state forest And natural preserve
﻿
The Great Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountain's summit and form one of Virginia's most fascinating ecosystems. It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels, which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate. Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a firetower on Middle Knob's summit, this hike forms one of southwest Virginia's most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

The hike is a hidden gem in southwest Virginia and you will find nothing else in Virginia quite like it. 
For the more adventurous hiker, the hike can continue on to Hidden Valley Lake (14 mile hike).

The road that leads to the cabin is off of the route 80 trailhead. At the Russell Washington county line. The Gravel road leading to the cabins is Shared with the hiking trail leading to the Channels

Step right outside of the front door at The Channels Retreat cabins and you will be greeted to the trail That travels to the great Channels of Virginia. The trail crosses over the front of the property

The Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountain's summit and form one of Virginia's most fascinating  ecosystems.

It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels, which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate and often hold snow cover long after temperatures have risen above freezing. Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a fire tower on Middle Knob's summit, this hike forms one of southwest Virginia's most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

STANDARD CHECK IN TIME 3PM .
CHECK OUT TIME 11AM.

sectionedDescription/description:
Step back in time with this original 1890s Appalachian solar powered off grid cabin. 

The cabin has been renovated with all the modern conveniences: solar-powered and includes hot water, gas stove, full bathroom w/ shower, refrigerator, sleeper sofa folds out to queen size bed. With each stay fresh towels and linens are furnished.

Kitchen, hot/cold kitchen sink,  K cup friendly coffee machine and more!
Covered front porch with bench and 2 rockers. Off the porch is a picnic table and gas grill.

Before you make your reservation
MAKE SURE YOUR GUEST COUNT IS CORRECT.

Loft Queen size bed sleeps 2
Living room has sofa sleeper

The loft area has low clearance sloped ceilings but can still comfortably sleep adults.

Water is provided via well with filtration system that includes UV light for excellent purification. 
Well appointed kitchen is fully stocked with all the necessities you need to cook your meals such as pots, pans and silverware. It features a gas stove with oven. 

While the cabin's address is listed as being in Saltville VA, the property is actually located in Washington County and is closer to the Abingdon VA area on Hayters Gap Road ,Rt 80.

Standard check-in time is 3 PM.
Standard check out time 11 am.

More info on channelsretreat .com

Free parking at the cabin, The cabin is easily accessible by most cars and we offer parking right outside of the cabin.  Our cabins offer the closest parking and access to the Channels.

We look forward to having you and are available should you have any questions during your stay. Feel free to contact me at any time with any questions or concerns that you may have.
Please reach out to me at least an hour before your arrival so that I can give you your keycode and answer any questions you may have regarding your stay.

Sit under the stars by night and under the magnificent canopy of shade trees by day.                          

Clinch Mountain is home to beautiful plant life and undergrowth, while a variety of deciduous trees form a towering canopy above.

It is truly a birdwatcher and botanist paradise.

Location is right on the trail leading to the Channel’s and is the last privately owned parcel upon entering channels state forest and natural preserve.

The great Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountains summit and form one of Virginia’s most fascinating ecosystems. It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels , which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate .Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a fire tower on Middle Knob’s summit ,this hike forms one of southwest Virginia’s most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

The hike is a hidden gem in southwest Virginia and you will find nothing else in Virginia quite like it . For the more adventurous hiker, the hike can continue on to Hidden Valley Lake ( 14 mile hike).

The road that leads to the cabin is off of the route 80 trailhead at the Russell / Washington county line. The gravel road leading to the cabin is shared with the hiking trail leading to the channels.

The Channels are a series of deep sandstone crevices worn into sandstone outcrops on the mountain's summit and form one of Virginia's most fascinating ecosystems. 

It is possible to easily walk within the maze-like channels, which harbor an almost cave-like microclimate and often hold snow cover long after temperatures have risen above freezing. Coupled with outstanding views from the top of these outcrops and a fire tower on Middle Knob's summit, this hike forms one of southwest Virginia's most scenic and popular hiking destinations.

name: Conveniently located Apartment - Pipestem /Concord
primaryHost/about:
Hello - I own and operate Prime Capital Properties, which offers homes and apartments near Concord University in Athens, West Virginia.  During the Summer, we have several empty apartments that we provide a safe place and a bed for a reasonable price, and you do the rest!  
Wherever you stay, we are just a few blocks away at any time.  I'm a world traveler myself and try to use my passport at least once a year!
sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the entire efficiency apartment.
sectionedDescription/description:
This small 340 Square Foot apartment will do great for your sleeping arrangements.  There's no TV, so get out and explore Wild and Wonderful West Virginia!  Located in Athens WV, Home of Concord University, and just a short drive to Pipestem, Bluestone lake, and historic Hinton WV.  One twin and one full bed are provided, both were changed in 2019.  CANNOT be occupied by more than 2 persons.  Remodeled 2010, new carpet 2018.  Features fridge, stove, microwave, full bathtub with shower.

Due to local regulations, this unit may not be occupied by more than 2 persons.  If you are coming for an event at the local university in Athens, walk out the back door to the adjoining university property.  This unit is located in an apartment building with 3 other occupied apartments with quiet people, and respect for our other guests is mandatory.  Short drive to Princeton, Pipestem and many other attractions.

You will have access to the entire efficiency apartment.

Please text me if you have any questions!

Feel free to walk around the neighborhood.  Adjacent to the US Post Office just a few minute walk, a small park contains a sign marking the "Athens Concord Trails", these include a mixture of on and off campus trails mapped out around the local area.  In town, we have CVS as our chain pharmacy, Dollar General as the local chain store, and Ginos as the chain restaurant.  Moe's is a local restaurant next door to the gas station with great reviews and a full menu of many types of food, and lots of comfort food options.

You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.

You may park on the street directly in front of the building.  When you enter the front door, the apartment is directly to the right.

Located in Athens WV, Home of Concord University, and just a short drive to Pipestem, Bluestone lake, and historic Hinton WV.  One twin and one full bed are provided, both were changed in 2019.  CANNOT be occupied by more than 2 persons.  Remodeled 2010, new carpet 2018.  Features fridge, stove, microwave, full bathtub with shower.

name: Brenners on B
photos/2/caption: Driveway in back of Madison Street
primaryHost/about: My husband John and I live in Abingdon VA very close to the Virginia Creeper Trail.  We love bicycling and when driving usually take our bikes with us on vacation.  We have been married 40 years and are still having fun.  Our 3 sons are out of the house.  We love hosting long distance bike riders through a site called Warm Showers and are excited to list our  AirBnb.  My husband and I are retired.
sectionedDescription/access: Living room, kitchen (welcome to use the frig) and the front porch.  This is a shared space with a shared entrance.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our house is a 2016 two story bungalow located in the heart of Abingdon VA within walking distance to the Barter Theatre, Virginia Creeper Trail and local restaurants.  The upstairs bedroom/suite has a queen bed and full pull-out sofa and Youtube TV/Netflix/Hulu .  A mini frig is in the hallway outside your room. The private bathroom is located across the hall with tub/shower with heated floors and fully equipped with towels, soap and hairdryer etc.  Feel free to enjoy our front porch.

The paved driveway is in the back of the house off of Madison Street and is steep. If you bring your bicycles, we have space to store them.  We also host long distance bicycle riders through a site called Warmshowers.  If we happen to have a biker, they will downstairs. There is an active train a block from our house.

Living room, kitchen (welcome to use the frig) and the front porch.  This is a shared space with a shared entrance.

We are happy to interact with our guests but also respect you’re privacy.

We are in an older neighborhood in Abingdon that is going through gentrification.  The Barter Theatre is about a 15 minute walk (.06 Mi.) and Wolf Hills Brewery is about a 15 minute walk (.07 Mi.) from our home.  There is an active train  2 blocks from our house.

It is easy to walk downtown, to local restaurants and to the Virginia Creeper Trail.  There is a bicycle shop/shuttle a few blocks away.

Bedroom is upstairs.   Driveway in the back off of Madison Street and is steep.

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
No matter what brings you to town, this homey vacation rental in Beckley is the perfect place to call home. This 1-bathroom studio gives you easy access to WVU’s campus so you can visit the kids or tour the campus before school starts. When you’re not in downtown Beckley, take advantage of the natural beauty of West Virginia at New River Gorge National Park. And of course, your day wouldn’t be complete without a soak in the private hot tub or a movie snuggled up in front of the fire.

In-Unit Laundry | Fireplace  

Whether you’re visiting loved ones at WVU, working at a nearby hospital, or leaf-peeping at Backcock State Park, this cozy studio in Beckley is the perfect home base. 

Studio: Queen Bed, Twin Bed | Additional Sleeping: Pack ‘n Play 

INDOOR LIVING: Smart TVs w/ cable, board games, wood-burning fireplace, living area 
OUTDOOR LIVING: Covered patio, private hot tub, rocking chairs 
KITCHEN: Well-equipped w/ cooking basics, dishware & flatware, microwave, high chair, dining area 
GENERAL: Free WiFi, keyless entry, complimentary toiletries, linens & towels, in-unit washer & dryer, central heating & air conditioning, laundry detergent, hair dryer, trash bags & paper towels, iron & ironing board
FAQ: Homeowner on-site, stairs required for access, 2 exterior security cameras   
PARKING: Driveway (2 vehicles)

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

OPT OUTSIDE: Word Park (3.0 miles), New River Gorge National Park and Preserve (10.4 miles), Little Beaver State Park (16.9 miles), Main Overlook (20.6 miles), Babcock State Park (39.3 miles), Bluestone National Scenic River (41.4 miles) 
HIKES: Ship Rock (7.5 miles), Little Laurel Trailhead (13.6 miles), Upper Glade Creek Trailhead (17.4 miles), Polls Plateau Trailhead (21.5 miles), Big Branch Trail (40.2 miles) 
THINGS TO SEE & DO: Downtown Beckley (3.2 miles), Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine (3.2 miles), Youth Museum of Southern WV (3.2 miles), Wildwood House Museum (4.5 miles), Alfred Beckley Mill (6.7 miles) 
AIRPORTS: Raleigh County Memorial Airport (10 miles), Yeager Airport (59.3 miles)

name: Riverfront Trail House.
primaryHost/about: My husband and I have lived in the coalfields of southern WV our entire lives.  We enjoy traveling, but love where we live and all it has to offer.  We  spend our free time on our rivers and streams kayaking and fishing, mountain biking and hiking on our trails at Chief Logan State Park and riding the trails of the Hatfield McCoy system on our motorcycles or ATV.  Logan is an outdoorsmans dream! We look forward to sharing our bit of our WV with you.
sectionedDescription/description:
Centrally located near the Bearwallow and Rockhouse trail systems in Logan WV.  Our renovated 2 bedroom, 2 bath house sleeps up to 10 people.   Enjoy the convenience of unloading your machines and not having to trailer them for trail access. Our property provides spacious parking for multiple vehicles, haulers and ATV's.   Enjoy our WV mountains from the trails or from our beautiful deck overlooking the Guyandotte river.   If you are looking for convenience at a great price, look no further.

The house has  3 common areas (living room, den and sunroom).   There are plenty of sleeping options including two bedrooms (bedroom 1 - queen and bedroom 2 - 2 full beds), a full size futon with a twin bunk in the den and a full size sleeper sofa in the living room. 

Our property includes a great outdoor space.  Cook dinner on our full size propane grill and dine on our beautiful deck overlooking the Guyandotte river. River access for fishing and kayaking is nearby. 

Enjoy the conveniences of home with our high speed internet/wifi, two smart tv's (58" living room and 55" den), washer and dryer, dishwasher and keyless entry.  

Spacious driveway parking and extra lot for additional vehicles, haulers and ATV's.  
 
Conveniently located in the heart of the Hatfield McCoy trail system.  Less than 2 miles from two separate trail heads of the Bearwallow trails.  

Walk or ride your ATV to local restaurants and shopping.  We are located next to Morrison's Drive Inn.  Morrison's Drive Inn restaurant has been serving food since 1947.  

Logan is an ATV friendly town.  Ride your machine on our county roads, exploring all our town has to offer.

We live close to our Airbnb rental cottage and will be available by cell (text or call) to assist our guests with any question/need that may arise during their stay.  We want to assist our guests with having the best getaway as possible.

Our 2 bedroom (sleeps 10) home is conveniently located near trailheads, restaurants and gas stations.  The Bearwallow trail system is accessible at two locations, both within two miles of our home.  Morrison’s drive Inn is only steps away, offering the best hotdogs, onion rings and shakes since 1947.  There are two Mexican restaurants and a Pizza Hut within a mile of the house.  Two gas stations are also nearby.

Our trail house has direct access to the Hatfield McCoy trail system.  No need to haul your trailer to local trailheads.  We are conveniently located on the Bearwallow trail system.  We have additional parking across the alley, directly in front of our home.

Guests must park in our designated parking areas.  The area in front of the house (driveway) and the river lot (graveled area) are available for our guests.  Do not park on the property adjacent to our river lot.  

Ensure all doors and windows are locked as you exit our home.

sectionedDescription/description:
Hi.  We offer COZY rooms with a BEAUTIFUL view of GREAT Smoky mountains surrounding our property.  KIND and FRIENDLY hosts ready to WELCOME all your needs.

THANK YOU

We are providing a room with two beds or one bed as guests need, in a hotel setting, close to the interstate, providing an easy stopover for our guests traveling along the I-81 and I-77 corridors.  A mexican restaurant, a local barbeque place, and an American diner are nearby for dining options.  A vineyard, an animal park, and New River Trails nearby and a short drive to the Blue Ridge Parkway and Big Walker Lookout for nature lovers.

Guests will need their car.

our pet fee is $15 per night
Smoking rooms available for $20 more (based on availability).
Smoking in a non smoking room will incur a $150 incidental fee.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Sui
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #6 - The Doctor Johnston Suite

Dr. George Ben Johnston was the son of the original owner and builder of the home, John Johnston. Dr. Johnston was highly respected in the medical community for his surgical expertise and this room is named in his honor. The tucked away upstairs bedroom features two double beds and a private bathroom. Located across the hall from The Mary May Room, this suite is ideal for multiple guests. Full of light, bright and cheery, this room gives guests a pop of color with vintage red bed frames and a soft aqua rug. Also, the room has easy access to the rear staircase leading to the kitchen and most importantly the coffee maker.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #3 - The Jack May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #3 - The Jack May Room (Shared Bathroom)

Named after the most prominent owner of the Litz Mansion, Andrew Jackson (“Jack”) May. This room is located downstairs and across the hall from The Etta V. Room. The bedroom includes a king-sized bed and fireplace. Just outside the room door is everyone’s favorite, the front porch. Grab a rocking chair and your favorite drink and enjoy the sounds of nature. Also, being downstairs, you have easy access to the living room, game room, dining room and kitchen.

name: "The Riverview Lofts" Experience river life.
photos/0/caption: This gorgeous view greets you each morning from your 8'x18' covered balcony.  Relax while reading a favorite book or get rejuvenated for your next adventure. It is also a favorite "office space" for extended stay guests who travel and work remotely.
photos/2/caption: In addition to tableware we provide pans, skillets, mixing bowl, strainer, measuring cups and spoons, cutting board and steak and paring  knives.  There is also a  toaster, can opener and Keurig.
photos/4/caption: We have recently upgraded our kitchen area with apartment size frigerator with separate freezer.  Photo soon to follow.
photos/5/caption: Electric stove and extra workspace on wheels.
photos/6/caption: Dining table and chairs with a view if the river and plenty of natural light.
photos/7/caption: Put your feet up and relax while watching  your favorite TV show or you may just want to enjoy a nap.
photos/8/caption: Brochures of local attractions, restaurants and fun activities.
photos/9/caption: Comfortable bedding with fresh linens, extra pillows and blankets.
photos/10/caption: This mini split unit  allows you to set the air conditioning or heat to your preference.
photos/11/caption: Our bathroom is clean and well lighted. Stocked with fresh linens, hair dryer, and shampoo/conditioner.
photos/14/caption: There is ample space in the closet to hang garments and additional shelving to store other items out of the way.  You will find a portable fan, luggage rack, first aid kit, and emergency light here also.
photos/15/caption: We provide an iron and  ironing board, extra hangers, luggage rack and  basket for used towels.
photos/16/caption: Aww, time to relax.  Is there any sound more relaxing than water. Whether a trickling brook, the ocean waves or our peaceful New River.
photos/18/caption: Comfortable seating on the balcony. Also table and chairs for dining.
photos/19/caption: Our guests enjoy every minute spent on their spacious 8' x 18' private balcony.  Start your day with breakfast and coffee  outdoors.
photos/20/caption: Always a favorite spot. Working remotely? Make this your office space!
photos/21/caption: I never tire of this view! Wild life lovers will enjoy watching geese, ducks and the occasional herring. You may see one of our nesting bald eagles.
photos/22/caption: Enjoy the river view rain or shine on the covered balcony.
photos/23/caption: Awesome view from the balcony.  There are several Businesses that rent rafts and kayaks just down the road.
photos/24/caption: Hinton is home to 3 rivers. Enjoy white water rafting or a lazy river float.
photos/25/caption: Sandstone Falls just 15 minutes away. Summers County is also home to two beautiful state parks.  Bluestone and Pipestem. Attractions include 18 hole golf course, pools, splash pad, mini golf, zip line, horseback riding, nature trails and more!
photos/26/caption: The mill at Greenville. It is a beautiful drive on back roads. Also close by is the Cheese "n" More store in Gap Mills. You can buy anything from jellies and spices to delicious sandwiches. Come
photos/27/caption: Beautiful views around every turn! Wonderful and wild West Virginia!
photos/28/caption: A guest at The Lofts snapped this picture with his iPhone!  A cold but beautiful night on the balcony!
photos/30/caption: Great view of fall foliage along the reservoir on the way to Beckley.
photos/31/caption: The month of May in Grandview State Park.  Gorgeous Rhododendrons!
photos/32/caption: The New River Gorge Bridge, completed in 1977.
photos/34/caption:
One of the  17 covered bridges you can still find in West Virginia. 

Local covered bridges:

Indian Mills
Laurel Creek
photos/36/caption: Sandstone Falls, a 15 minute  beautiful drive along the river.  Well maintained by the state a boardwalk makes access easy.  Wonderful photo opportunity.
sectionedDescription/access: Plenty of privacy as there are no shared spaces. Our apartments are the perfect size for 1 or 2 guests.  Those who work remotely love working on the balcony or in cooler months you can still enjoy the view from inside with plenty of natural light.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located on the New River, this apartment boasts an 8'x18' private balcony.  A great place to unwind or enjoy your morning coffee. The apartment is an open floor plan with a full bath.  Electric heat, air conditioning and off street parking. We are just across the river from the town of Hinton where you can purchase anything you need.  There are several fast food restaurants nearby  in addition to unique eateries. We are within 30 minutes of two beautiful state parks and and great fishing.

When you read our reviews you will see most guests just can't get enough porh time enjoying the tranquil atmosphere.   Some enjoy that first cup of coffee in the morning and others like to unwind there after taking in all that our area offers.  The Lofts are a perfect "home base" for dozens of sites and things to do that our area offers. Two state parks with pools, zip line, golf and more within 30 minutes. Fish on the riverbank, rent a canoe or raft and  float the river.  Shop  downtown or venture to Lewisburg for a day of antiquing and there are two caverns to visit in the Lewisburg area. Catch a show at the Ritz theater or on a summer night load up on snacks and head to one of our outdoor  drive in theatres.  This is just a short list of what awaits.

Plenty of privacy as there are no shared spaces. Our apartments are the perfect size for 1 or 2 guests.  Those who work remotely love working on the balcony or in cooler months you can still enjoy the view from inside with plenty of natural light.

We have strived to anticipate our guests' needs.  If any concerns arise, we are just a phone call or text away.

Hinton is nestled in a valley in the  beautiful Appalachian mountains.   A great weekend getaway or we welcome longer stays with significant discounts.  If you work remotley we have fast and reliable internet.  You can spend your weekends enjoying countless activities and sites.

Amtrac comes into the Hinton station.

Enjoy the friendly small town atmosphere. We have several great local eateries and some popular fast food restaurants too.  If you choose to dine in, you can find anything you need to prepare your meal at Kroger or Save-a-Lot, just across the river.

sectionedDescription/description: Highwater Inn is conveniently located in Mullens just a little over one mile from The Hatfield-McCoy trail system and the newly constructed Coal Fields Expressway.  The inn accommodates up to 10 guests and provides free Wifi, a kitchen, three showers, two decks, and an outdoor area with a picnic table, chairs, and fire pit .  Parking is plentiful for several vehicles, ATVs, and trailers with gas available just a few hundred yards away.  Multiple restaurants are just a short ride or walk away.

name: Luxury Suite Downtown Abingdon VA
primaryHost/about: Adventuring through life. We use Airbnb for most of our trips, traveling with our kids or on getaways. Always choosing happiness and now enjoying hosting our own place to pass on the beauty of this community.
sectionedDescription/access:
Your Suite is located on the 2nd level of this 4 story building, along with a few additional suites available to rent.
Think Boutique Hotel vibes with a more custom and comfortable feel! We have designed these spaces to make you feel transported. Not only will you have a comfortable and private space to stay while visiting, you will enjoy the beauty of the design, history of the space, and the quaint and peaceful vibe of the area.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is a large private suite in the heart of downtown Abingdon Virginia. 

Located within 2 blocks of the Creeper Trail and right on Courthouse hill. There is no better location for your visit to Abingdon! 

Enjoy this Luxury Suite with unique amenities such as walk in shower, king size bed, original brick walls, and stained glass windows.

Wake up overlooking Main St. in this historic and beautiful town, while enjoying all the luxuries of modern amenities.

Built in 1894 and taking a total of 10 years to complete, The Greenway Trigg building is a wealth of charm and history.
Come spend time immersing yourself in the quaint history of Abingdon, VA.

What better way to do that than to stay in a 100+ year old building?! 
The Greenway Trigg building underwent a massive update in 2022 and is ready for bookings, new life, and new and modern retail spaces. 

This listing has had a complete make over! Previous reviews will specify things that are not applicable to the new space! Please be aware of that!

Enjoy the new retail spaces on the main level of the building, and the many pieces of art available for sale in the foyers of the grand old building.

Don't forget to peruse SONDER home + travel where you can find amenities used in your Suite available to purchase and take home with you.

Your Suite is located on the 2nd level of this 4 story building, along with a few additional suites available to rent.
Think Boutique Hotel vibes with a more custom and comfortable feel! We have designed these spaces to make you feel transported. Not only will you have a comfortable and private space to stay while visiting, you will enjoy the beauty of the design, history of the space, and the quaint and peaceful vibe of the area.

We are always available via message on the Airbnb app. Please do not call unless it is an emergency.

There is no better location to immerse yourself in the experience of Abingdon than right here in The Greenway Trigg building. 
Located within walking distance of The Barter Theatre, The Virginia Creeper Trail, The Tavern, White Birch Juice, The girl and the raven coffee shop, Wolf Hills Brewery and many many more attractions!

Bikes can be rented from the bike shop right around the corner. Walking is easy in all areas of downtown.

If you are bringing a dog- we ask that all pets are kept off the furniture. THIS IS A MUST. We are happy to have your pet stay, and are able to by requiring an additional pet fee. If we find that there is a pet and we were not notified previously, a $250 fee will be added to the booking total.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Upon check out please leave dirty linens and towels in a pile by the bed. 
Take all personal items out of fridge and freezer.
sectionedDescription/interaction: We are always available via message on the Airbnb app. Please do not call unless it is an emergency.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie:
There is no better location to immerse yourself in the experience of Abingdon than right here in The Greenway Trigg building. 
Located within walking distance of The Barter Theatre, The Virginia Creeper Trail, The Tavern, White Birch Juice, The girl and the raven coffee shop, Wolf Hills Brewery and many many more attractions!
sectionedDescription/notes: If you are bringing a dog- we ask that all pets are kept off the furniture. THIS IS A MUST. We are happy to have your pet stay, and are able to by requiring an additional pet fee. If we find that there is a pet and we were not notified previously, a $250 fee will be added to the booking total.
sectionedDescription/space:
Built in 1894 and taking a total of 10 years to complete, The Greenway Trigg building is a wealth of charm and history.
Come spend time immersing yourself in the quaint history of Abingdon, VA.

What better way to do that than to stay in a 100+ year old building?! 
The Greenway Trigg building underwent a massive update in 2022 and is ready for bookings, new life, and new and modern retail spaces. 

This listing has had a complete make over! Previous reviews will specify things that are not applicable to the new space! Please be aware of that!

Enjoy the new retail spaces on the main level of the building, and the many pieces of art available for sale in the foyers of the grand old building.

Don't forget to peruse SONDER home + travel where you can find amenities used in your Suite available to purchase and take home with you.
sectionedDescription/summary:
This is a large private suite in the heart of downtown Abingdon Virginia. 

Located within 2 blocks of the Creeper Trail and right on Courthouse hill. There is no better location for your visit to Abingdon! 

Enjoy this Luxury Suite with unique amenities such as walk in shower, king size bed, original brick walls, and stained glass windows.

Wake up overlooking Main St. in this historic and beautiful town, while enjoying all the luxuries of modern amenities.
sectionedDescription/transit: Bikes can be rented from the bike shop right around the corner. Walking is easy in all areas of downtown.

name: Matewan Riders Retreat New Remodel , Garage , Cozy
sectionedDescription/access:
We have parking in the front and back of the property and across the street .
We own the post office and lot beside of it where you can park . If parking across street please park In front of the empty lot parallel to the street .
sectionedDescription/description:
Looking to ride the trails , escape into the hills with us. We are Located one mile from the Historic town of Matewan , also known as the Battle of Matewan and the Matewan Massacre. Devil Anse trail 21 trailhead is located directly in front of the town . Outlaw trails are in our backyard,cross the bridge in matewan and you can access these trails .Newly remodeled and  detached Garage for SXS or ATV parking . Enjoy the Best Pizza in all of West Virginia located around the corner and they deliver!

We have two queen beds and two twin beds. We also have futons available with extra pillows and comforters. We have one full bath , and one half bath . 
Two seperate TV spaces , with access to your favorite shows and movies .
Enclosed Porch for all your riding gear ! 
Grill and Fire Pit for outdoor entertainment .

We have parking in the front and back of the property and across the street .
We own the post office and lot beside of it where you can park . If parking across street please park In front of the empty lot parallel to the street .

additionalHouseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "Hangar 22"
photos/12/caption: Shower with ceiling mounted shower head
photos/19/caption: Kitchen , full refrigerator and mini stove.
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, refrigerator and stove. 

There is also a second and a third rental near this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "The Iron Horse" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Please be aware there is a temporary drainage system installed at the front of the concrete pad, this may be a trip hazard, please watch your step.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi. 

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

Hangar 22 is built in memory of Sergeant Shawn Hess.  Sgt. Hess was killed in the line of duty while working as a Deputy Sheriff for Tazewell County Sheriffs Office..  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his friends and family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.


RECENTLY WE HAD TO INSTALL A NEW DRAINAGE SYSTEM AT THE ENTRANCE TO THE CABIN.UNTIL THE GROUND SETTLES,THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT LIP ON THE EDGE OF THE CONCRETE PAD ENTRANCE. THIS WILL REQUIRE YOU TO TAKE A SMALL STEP UP, CREATING A TRIPPING HAZARD. PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS STEP UP. IT WILL BE MARKED WITH FLUORESCENT PAINT.PLEASE BE MINDFUL OF THIS AND BE CAREFUL.
