additionalHouseRules:
•	No smoking allowed in rooms, hallways, or patios. There will be an additional $100 smoke cleaning charge added to your bill, in the event smoking has taken place on the property.
•	Additional cleaning charges apply for excessive cleaning due to mud or garbage left by guest upon departure. 
•	NO excessive noise allowed at any time. 
•	DO NOT litter on premise.
•	Please reset thermostat upon departure; 72 degrees in the summer and 68 degrees in the winter.
•	Linens, towels, and toiletries will not be changed during your stay. There is a laundry mat located at The Heritage Apartments-3690 Coal Heritage Rd.
•	Destruction, theft, or damage of property will result in legal action and payment will be due immediately.
•	If Wi-Fi goes out please contact (304)-589-5789
•	Guests are responsible for personal property.
•	Only permitted guests allowed on property.
•	Check out is at 11:00 A.M. Please request for late checkout availability *additional charges will apply*.
•	Permitted pets only with $100 nonrefundable pet fee. If your pet causes destruction to property, this will incur additional fees and/or legal action.
•	Trash dumpster is located outside, remove all trash upon departure and place in dumpster on property.
•	Wash all used dishes, dry, and put away prior to departure.
•	Strip all used bed linens, towels, etc. and place in tub for cleaners. 
•	Be mindful of neighbors as some do live here year-round.
•	Management office is open Monday-Friday 9:00 a.m.-5:00 p.m. for any major questions or concerns. 
-$100 cleaning fee per stay.
-Weekly & Monthly stays available. 
-2 night minimum required.

name: Spurrier Unit 1 (2 Bedroom 1 Bath Pets Allowed)
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautifully updated 2 full-bed 1-bath apartment features a complete kitchen with all the necessities, free Wi-Fi, and a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each. Walking distance to shopping & restaurants. Includes two queen bed, towels & washcloths for 4 guests, and a charcoal grill on the covered balcony. Central heat & air. Pets allowed with additional per-pet fee. You will be just a short ride to all the Hatfield/McCoy trail systems.

***FULLY FURNISHED EXECUTIVE RENTAL***

ALL UTILITIES AND WI-FI INCLUDED!

2 Bedroom Apartment *Bluewell Area*

GPS Address: 219 Spurrier Rd., Bluefield, WV 24701

Everything you need in one place!
Are you looking for a nightly rental that’s just as comfortable as your own home?
If so, you have found the right place!

Spurrier Apt. 1
This rental has a full bed in both of the two bedrooms. Towels and washcloths are included for four guests.

It was just remodeled with brand new paint throughout, a new central heating and air HVAC unit, new bedding, new flooring, and leather dual-reclining sofa in the living room. This rental includes a complete kitchen with all of the necessities, from pots and pans down to silverware, and a full-size stove & refrigerator, and charcoal grill for your use on your private, covered, back patio! We have supplied everything down to the hangers to hang your clothes on inside of full-sized closets with dressers in both bedrooms. There is a smart TV in the living room and both of the bedrooms, with a DVD player included at each to watch your favorite Red Box movies on.

It is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants such as Dollar General, Gino’s Pizza, to a local favorite ‘Lynn’s Drive-In Restaurant’, a gas station, Advanced Auto, and even a laundromat. Razor and ATV riding is legal on all streets in this town. You can park your truck and trailer in the parking lot and ride straight to the trails. Great cell service, FREE WIFI, and it is only a short ride to all of the trail systems.

Side Note: You will have to go up steps to get to this two-bedroom apartment style nightly rental.

Contactless check-in and check-out is a must. You are emailed your door code and once inside you have an extra security door lock.
• 3:00PM check-in / 11:00AM check-out

Units are only available for out-of-town guests or corporate and business professionals looking for a temporary place to stay in the area.

Contactless check in and check out is a must. You are emailed your door code the day of check in and once inside you have an extra security door lock.

	3PM check-in & 11AM check-out. Early check-in and late check-out may
        be available for an additional fee.
	2-night minimum stay required which will include all of the luxuries you have in your own home.
	PETS WELCOMED! $100 non-refundable pet fee will be required though due to the extensive deep cleaning conducted after a pet has visited.

sectionedDescription/access: The property is fenced in however there is a private entrance with deck, for the space. The entrance is located outside of the fenced in area. The area is safe so I will leave the door open and the key on the table. There is no protocol for checking in, so you may access the space when you arrive. Parking is in front of the steps leading up to the space. Please don't park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much.
sectionedDescription/description:
Full bath, Queen bed, flat screen TV (dish), free wi-fi. Private entrance. Very safe area. We are located between Abingdon Va. and St. Paul Va. on highway 58.

This rental is in a separate part of our home and offers total privacy. The bed is a queen size so space will only accommodate two adults comfortably. There is one full bath and a small kitchen. The home sits on an acre of property and joins several vacant acres in behind.

The property is fenced in however there is a private entrance with deck, for the space. The entrance is located outside of the fenced in area. The area is safe so I will leave the door open and the key on the table. There is no protocol for checking in, so you may access the space when you arrive. Parking is in front of the steps leading up to the space. Please don't park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much.

We are always available to our guests to answer questions about the area or to resolve any issues that might occur with the space. You will be provided with our cell and house phone numbers in the event that you need anything, otherwise you will have total privacy.

Quite neighborhood with two miles of walking trails, through the woods, on our property.
In St. Paul, Va. just about 7 miles away is the Sugar Hills ATV and hiking trails, and the newly remodeled "Western Front" with a nice Restaurant. Sugar Hill Brewery is also a great place to eat and experience local beer. 
The Hidden Valley Lake Area offers hiking, boating and fishing, and is just a few miles away. Fifteen- twenty miles away is The Channels, a majestic sandstone formation that is over 400-million years old. Great Hike !  The "Devils Bath Tub" is not to far away and a must see. The Pinnacle Natural Area Reserve is also very close and quite spectacular. The town of Abingdon (18 miles away) is a great little town with some excellent restaurants,  Wolf Hills Brewing Company, The Creeper Trail, The Barter Theater (state theater of Virginia!), biking and walking trails, festivals, and much more.

Please check location of the property before booking. 
Thanks

For guests that will be using the space for extended time periods, we laundry the bed linens, towels and wash cloths once per week.  We do not clean the space or wash the linens with synthetic perfumed products.   We ask that you do not use room deodorizers, incense or scented candles in the space.  We also ask that you use colognes and perfumes sparingly.  We strive to use all natural products for cleaning, laundering and sanitizing to provide for the comfort and safety of our guests and our cleaning crew. Thanks so much for you cooperation.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: No parties, smoking is prohibited inside, no pets allowed and no burning of scented candles or incense. Please use minimal amounts of colognes, aftershave and perfumes.  Please do not park in front of garage doors. Thanks so much for your cooperation.
sectionedDescription/interaction: We are always available to our guests to answer questions about the area or to resolve any issues that might occur with the space. You will be provided with our cell and house phone numbers in the event that you need anything, otherwise you will have total privacy.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie:
Quite neighborhood with two miles of walking trails, through the woods, on our property.
In St. Paul, Va. just about 7 miles away is the Sugar Hills ATV and hiking trails, and the newly remodeled "Western Front" with a nice Restaurant. Sugar Hill Brewery is also a great place to eat and experience local beer. 
The Hidden Valley Lake Area offers hiking, boating and fishing, and is just a few miles away. Fifteen- twenty miles away is The Channels, a majestic sandstone formation that is over 400-million years old. Great Hike !  The "Devils Bath Tub" is not to far away and a must see. The Pinnacle Natural Area Reserve is also very close and quite spectacular. The town of Abingdon (18 miles away) is a great little town with some excellent restaurants,  Wolf Hills Brewing Company, The Creeper Trail, The Barter Theater (state theater of Virginia!), biking and walking trails, festivals, and much more.
sectionedDescription/notes: For guests that will be using the space for extended time periods, we laundry the bed linens, towels and wash cloths once per week.  We do not clean the space or wash the linens with synthetic perfumed products.   We ask that you do not use room deodorizers, incense or scented candles in the space.  We also ask that you use colognes and perfumes sparingly.  We strive to use all natural products for cleaning, laundering and sanitizing to provide for the comfort and safety of our guests and our cleaning crew. Thanks so much for you cooperation.
sectionedDescription/space: This rental is in a separate part of our home and offers total privacy. The bed is a queen size so space will only accommodate two adults comfortably. There is one full bath and a small kitchen. The home sits on an acre of property and joins several vacant acres in behind.
sectionedDescription/summary: Full bath, Queen bed, flat screen TV (dish), free wi-fi. Private entrance. Very safe area. We are located between Abingdon Va. and St. Paul Va. on highway 58.
sectionedDescription/transit:
Please check location of the property before booking. 
Thanks

name: The Dragon's Den - Upstairs Private Room 2
primaryHost/about: I am a motor head for as long as I can remember and enjoy spending time in Tazewell so much I decided to build my own AirBnB and share my passion with others.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to their assigned room, the bathroom on that floor and all public spaces in the house.
sectionedDescription/description:
Minutes from downtown shopping and dining and easy access to the infamous Back of the Dragon. Only one hour to Winterplace Ski Resort.  Also an hour drive to the famous Hatfield McCoy trails!Each room has a private programmable lock. Each room will have towels, shampoo and soap for two. Newly paved driveway with room for cars and bikes

Enjoy The Back of the Dragon in a whole new way with the Vanderhall Venice GT!  An open air roadster experience like no other available from The Dragon's Den! Available on Riders Share.

cozy 2nd floor room with closet. Queen size bed, 40" smart TV, nightstand and dresser. access to shared kitchen, living and bathrooms. Relax on one of the two porches and enjoy the mountain views. Deer roaming is a regular occurrence as well!

Guests have access to their assigned room, the bathroom on that floor and all public spaces in the house.

I am available 24/7 by phone if anything is needed. I am also available for recommendations on request.

Tazewell is known for a lot of things but public transportation may not be one of them. Everything you need is less than 10 minutes drive away including shopping, dining and activities.

cameras monitor the driveway and front porch.

name: Bear Cabin -Hatfield & McCoy Trails
sectionedDescription/description:
Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages are non-smoking, sleep up to 4 people and provide all the comforts of home. We are located near the Hatfield & McCoy trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. Cottages and cabins include Heat / AC mini splits, Free Wi-Fi, mini kitchen, Keurig coffee maker, refrigerator, three-quarter bath, 32” TV with Netflix/Directv, fresh linens, bath towels & housekeeping service. Outdoor fire pit and charcoal grill. Privacy fence on the premises.

Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, charcoal grill and pinic table. There is also a second rental available,  " Papa's Den-Hatifield & McCoy Trails", on Airbnb as well that sleeps 3 people. These cabins are located on the same property. There is plenty of parking for trailers and ATVs / SXS and easy access to Hatfield and Mccoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails.

Drive directly to the Hatifield and McCoy trailheads on your SXS. 
Large Parking lot at the cabins.

We pride ourselves on your fun and crazy adventure while staying at Trail Bandits Cabins. Please help us keep it just as fun for our community and our fellow campers. Please read over our rental terms and conditions.

As always, remember to UNLEASH YOUR ADVENTURE!

Our Policy

Cabin rental incidental deposits are non-refundable if your reservation is cancelled with less than 30 days remaining before your arrival date.  Deposits for holiday/holiday weekends are not refundable under any conditions if cancelled.

Reschedule requests will be only be accepted if there are 30 days or longer remaining before your scheduled arrival date.  These requests are subject to availability. * Inclement weather cancellations will not be accepted.

Failure to adhere to your reservation with no communication will forfeit your deposit and you will be charged the remaining balance of your stay.

Cabin Terms and Conditions

Check-in time is 3pm on your arrival date, and check out time is 11am on your departure date. 

Guests will be charged a one time $50 cleaning fee at the time of reservation.

Cabins are non-smoking.  Guests will be charged a one time $250 cleaning fee if smoking is detected inside the cabins and you will forfeit your deposit.

The maximum capacity per standard cabin is 3 adults.  The maximum capacity for our larger cabin is 4 adults.   Violators will be evicted, and no refund will be issued.  Small children will be exempt from this rule. 

Playing on loft ladders is prohibited. Face the ladder when going up or down. Do not carry objects in your hands while on the ladder.

Park ONLY in the designated parking areas which is in front of your cabin or across the road in the grass area.  

Alcohol is permitted.  Disorderly conduct is not allowed.

*No atv or any off road vehicles are allowed in any of the rivers.

Please honor the posted speed limit in our atv community.  

The reserving guests will be responsible for any damages to your cabin or premises. 

Please do not place, burn or leave trash in your fire pit. Outside charcoal grills need to be cleaned prior to the departure of your stay.

We ask that all guest respect your fellow campers and community. 

Quiet the noise after 10:00pm for respect of the community and other campers.

No excessive riding in the cabin areas or driveways.   No driving or parking your ATV on the grass where the charcoal grills and picnic tables are located.

There are outdoor surveillance cameras around the campground for the protection of your items.

Ready to Reserve!

You must reserve with an incidental deposit of $250. Incidental deposits are refundable upon checkout as long as there are no damages or additional charges made. If additional charges or damages occur during your stay, you will receive the incidental deposit back less the cost of damages or additional charges. Cabins cannot be reserved and will not be held without a deposit.

All rentals require a 2-night minimum.

Pet Friendly – We love Pets!

Trail Bandits Cabins offers pet friendly cabins. 

Pets that are non-aggressive are allowed with a $20 per pet surcharge per night.  No more than 1 pet is allowed per cabin unless approved by host for more.

All pets must be registered at check-in. If not registered and found on the premises, you will be evicted and deposit forfeited.

Excessive barking that is a disturbance to other campers will not be allowed.  

**Pets must be crated if left alone.

Pets should be on a leash at all times while outside. Please clean up any waste left by your pet.

Reserving guest is responsible for any damages caused by pets. If any damages occur, incidental deposit will be forfeited.

Pets must be 40 pounds or less due to insurance restrictions and campground policy procedures.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Check in at 3pm and Check-out at 11am

name: Peaceful country home minutes to downtown Abingdon
photos/0/caption: Left couch opens into a queen sofa bed
photos/6/caption: Living room TV,  Amazon Prime active with access to other streaming services of your own
photos/10/caption: Bedroom TV,  Amazon Prime active with access to other streaming services of your own
photos/19/caption: 12 steps to back deck and kitchen entrance
photos/20/caption: On the grid and powered by solar
photos/21/caption: The front porch offers a shady spot for much of the day. You can also use this entrance, which does not require steps, though it is uphill from the back of the house.
photos/23/caption: Enjoy a peaceful sunrise plus a great view of our dark night sky
photos/24/caption: One of the neighbors in late winter/early spring
photos/25/caption: Floor Plan
photos/26/caption: The gravel road. Vantage point is just above the paved county road. My driveway is immediately after the last cypress tree on the right. The gravel portion below my driveway is about 100' long.
photos/27/caption: The gravel road. Vantage point is where my driveway meets the road.  At the bottom of the gravel road, going left to right, is the paved county road.  The gravel portion below the driveway is about 100' long.
photos/28/caption: Back deck stairs leading up to your entryway.
primaryHost/about: I spend as much time as I can outdoors, have hiked most of the trails in the area and am always on the lookout for a great kayak launch spot. When indoors I enjoy playing guitar/songwriting and released my debut album "Tale of Love and Loss" in 2020.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
Access is via keyless lock with a code that will work on both the front and back doors. You will receive this code the day before check in.
The upstairs and basement are dedicated to host storage, but you'll have the place to yourselves.  The house sits about 25 yards up a gravel road which is suitable for all vehicles and there is plenty of parking space behind the house.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a quiet country setting just 10 minutes from downtown Abingdon and the Virginia Creeper Trail, 20 minutes to the Appalachian Trail, 30 minutes to downtown Bristol.  Enjoy pastoral views while you relax on the back deck, which runs the length of the house.  The unit includes the entire main floor of the home with bedroom, bath, living room, full kitchen and laundry room.  If you love the outdoors this is a great base for exploring this beautiful corner of the world.

The house location offers the best of a country setting with easy access to town, shopping, theater and restaurants.  If you want to do some cooking, you'll find a fully outfitted kitchen or consult our dining guide for a selection of local restaurants.

Access is via keyless lock with a code that will work on both the front and back doors. You will receive this code the day before check in.
The upstairs and basement are dedicated to host storage, but you'll have the place to yourselves.  The house sits about 25 yards up a gravel road which is suitable for all vehicles and there is plenty of parking space behind the house.

I am not at the home but am reachable and nearby in case of any issues.

The house is located a very short distance up a gravel road.  Visitors may park where they wish behind the house or under the on-site carport.

This is the same home that can be reserved under listing 53669707.  The listing you are on sleeps up to four (1 bedroom, 1 sofa bed, 1 full bath) while the other listing sleeps up to eight (2 bedrooms, 2 sofa beds, 2 full baths).  Either way, the property is only rented to one set of guests at a time.

name: Welcoming place for Hatfield & McCoy Trail Riders.
photos/0/caption: If you prefer a firmer bed, this room is for you.
primaryHost/about: Live in Florida when not in WV. Dog owner of 1 Terrier named Leo.
sectionedDescription/access: Concrete pavement for parking your vehicle. There is no public transportation so you will need a private vehicle to get around. Your smartphone's GPS won't work in the general area. Nearest restaurants and shops are about 15 minutes away. This hideaway is in the general area of the Hatfield and McCoy Trails.
sectionedDescription/description:
Cozy country home with large wrap around porch. Wake up sit and swing on front porch while having your morning coffee. Enjoy the sound of the creek flowing by house. Free Wi-Fi, cable and smart TV for all your streaming needs. Turn on the Wi-Fi calling feature on your cell phone while at a cellphone coverage area to make and receive calls during your stay. Close to outlaw trails at Hell Creek, 4 miles from Delbarton and Buffalo Trail heads.

Clean, friendly and safe. I have 2 rooms on here so if both rooms are booked you may have to share public spaces. However, you will have your own room and bath. Access to washer and dryer, as well as kitchen for long-staying guests. Please no sleeping on living room furniture

Concrete pavement for parking your vehicle. There is no public transportation so you will need a private vehicle to get around. Your smartphone's GPS won't work in the general area. Nearest restaurants and shops are about 15 minutes away. This hideaway is in the general area of the Hatfield and McCoy Trails.

I like to give guests their privacy but available if needed. Sometimes I may be out of town and my Aunt will be available next door if needed

This is a quiet and remote area. Restaurants and shops are about 15min away.

You will need a car no public transportation. Your smartphone's GPS won't work so follow these directions.

Directions:

Coming from Charleston side (North) on US-119, make a left on WV-65 towards Delbarton. Drive for about 3 miles until you see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the left. Make a left at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is. 

Coming from Williamson/ side (South) on US-119, make a right instead and follow the same direction from WV-65 to Delbarton.

Coming from Delbarton on WV-65, drive until you pass the Coal Mines on the right.  About 1/4 mile, you will see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the right. Turn right at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is.

If you turn it on please turn off when leaving.

sectionedDescription/transit:
You will need a car no public transportation. Your smartphone's GPS won't work so follow these directions.

Directions:

Coming from Charleston side (North) on US-119, make a left on WV-65 towards Delbarton. Drive for about 3 miles until you see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the left. Make a left at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is. 

Coming from Williamson/ side (South) on US-119, make a right instead and follow the same direction from WV-65 to Delbarton.

Coming from Delbarton on WV-65, drive until you pass the Coal Mines on the right.  About 1/4 mile, you will see a 2-storey log house with blue tin roof on the right. Turn right at the bridge on Pearl Hill Rd. Drive straight, don't take the road over the railroad. Make a left on State St. You'll end at the red gate where the house is.

name: Stay @Tin Roof! Clean 3Bed 2Bath near trailheads
photos/16/caption: Master King
photos/25/caption: 3rd Bedroom Queen
primaryHost/about: I am a realtor from coastal NC. I love traveling and do so often!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill
sectionedDescription/description:
The whole group will enjoy easy access to everything from this centrally located place. The Tin Roof is located near the Hatfield McCoy trails where you have multiple trailheads to choose from. No need to load your trailer, ride your ATV directly from this location. Tin Roof is 37 miles from Winterplace for the ski bunnies!  Multiple lakes for a day in the kayak , hiking trails to get in your steps , and several restaurants to enjoy;  all located close by! Two living rooms and plenty of space!

Three trucks and Three trailers ( depending on length) will fit in driveway. All three bedrooms have large beds and room for all your gear! Two living rooms  2 Tv’s and plenty of eating space at the kitchen island or dining table. A full laundry room, front  deck with outdoor eating area, and a fire pit in the backyard for evening relaxing!  For your convenience there is a permanent charcoal grill. The Keurig and crockpot are a few of the extra additions to the kitchen that will make your stay easy!  Basic cable in the living room and smart TV in the den . Brand new mattresses , furniture installed September 2021.  Towels , Hand Towels , washcloths, and all bed linens included.  Fully stocked kitchen with dishes , cups , and cooking utensils.

Entire home , entire paved driveway,  plus additional rock driveway with  fire pit and grill

Fee free to message with any questions or suggestions!

Tin Roof is located in an ATV friendly town where you can drive your ATV to restaurants , gas stations and trailheads.  Located minutes from Various trail heads as well as restaurants. We are also near Bluefield University and a short trip to the VA line . As well as a short drive to a nearby airport.

While public transportation may be sparse, vehicles, ATV’s and hiking are no issues to get around.

This property is adjacent to  a main road HWY 52, and less than a mile from Lorton Lick rd, we also live off a small quiet road. We ask that you respect our neighbors and refrain from parties or disruptive behavior. You can access HWY 52 from our front yard with an atv , please stay to the left of the rock/boulders which mark our property line. Toilet paper , paper towels , shampoo and soap are provided. Coffee , sugar and honey for your first morning will also be available . Laundry detergent, dish detergent, and sponges. Ready for your arrival !

additionalHouseRules:
-Prior to 11:00 on the day of departure, the Tenant will clean up the surrounding property before checkout otherwise check-out cleaning charges to you will result.  
-ACCOMMODATIONS: Tenant is responsible for keeping the unit clean and safe during the entire tenancy. Tenant has an obligation to notify Owner immediately of any safety issues discovered. In addition, Tenant is responsible for any and all damages to the property from all guests and ensuring maximum occupancy is not exceeded during his tenancy. Due to health department regulations, occupancy in homes served by septic systems is limited to two persons per bedroom, unless otherwise stated. 
-This cabin is designated as smoke free and therefore no smoking is permitted inside the structure.  
-All cabins are equipped for normal housekeeping. Each unit includes an electric coffee pot and toaster as basic kitchen equipment; dishwasher, washer/dryer, central air/heat, and microwave. All beds will have linens and pillows provided.
-Mail, texts, and phone messages can be sent to 304-466-4444 or carolynpricestephens@gmail.com or 624 Tallery Mountain Road, Hinton, WV 25951.
-CHECK-OUTS: All cabins must be vacated by 11:00 on check-out day. We ask that this policy be recognized by all Tenants. An extra day’s rent will be charged for all late check-outs unless advance arrangements have been made for late check out (limited availability and subject to additional fee.  Lessee is responsible for washing dishes, bagging trash, emptying refrigerator, leaving the AC set on 78 degrees (or heat set on 55 degrees in the winter months), securing all doors and windows, and leaving the unit clean, damage-free and in good condition for the next renter. Any extra cleaning or excessive trash removal will be billed to Tenant at a minimum fee of $50.00. Please ensure you’ve packed all your belongings before checking out, as we cannot be responsible for items left. A $15.00 COD fee will apply for any items returned to you following your tenancy. Call our office for arrangements within 7 days after your departure, otherwise left items will be disposed. 
-We do not allow pets unless prior arrangements are made (registered service animals excepted). The Tenant will be responsible for cleaning after the animals inside and outside the cabin. 
-The Tenant, guests and all the occupants of the vacation home agrees to release and indemnify the Owner from and against all claims for damages and/or personal injuries to any person arising out of the use of subject premises, including interior and all exterior areas, including decks, stairs and other common areas that occurred during the tenancy of the premises.  Tenant agrees to be responsible for any repairs necessary due to their negligence.  

Let me know if you need anything.  


Carolyn 
304-466-4444

photos/10/caption: With two twin beds upstairs, there is a half bath

primaryHost/about: My husband is a retired German Language professor and I am still loving my work as a school psychologist.   We travel, read, and grow wonderful flowers in our little piece of the world.    When not on Tallery Mountain, we keep returning to Saint Malo, France.  We love the food, the sea and the history there almost as much as the food, the mountains and the history here.   We are West Virginians, born and raised.  Company is always welcome.
sectionedDescription/description:
On Tallery Mountain in Summers County, WV, it's almost Heaven to just sit on the back porch and watch the sunset.

In the heart of white water rafting, curvy motorcycle roads and golf courses, comfortable quarters are guaranteed after a hike or a day of fishing on the Bluestone or New Rivers.   Within 90 minutes is the Blue Ridge Parkway, New River Bridge, Pipestem, Bluestone, Babcock and Hawks Nest State Parks, The Greenbrier Resort, Tamarack, and historic Lewisburg.

additionalHouseRules:
All reservations are considered confirmed at the time of booking. Please note that the  terms of this Rental Agreement are non-negotiable. This Rental Agreement MUST be agreed upon at time of booking. 
 1. RENTAL. The rental rate for the Rental Property is based on a party of four (4) persons. Guest acknowledges that additional persons are permitted provided the number of persons does not exceed the maximum occupancy for the Rental Property. Guest further understands that for each additional person, a fee of $10.00 shall be added to the nightly rental rate provided each additional guest is registered prior to check-in as set forth herein. 

2. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES. Guest may check-in at any time after 3:00 p.m. on Guest's Arrival Date, and the Guest shall check-out no later than 10:00 a.m. on the Guest's Departure Date. A minimum fee of $25.00 per hour may be charged to the renter’s card for checkout after 10:00 AM unless previous arrangements have been made through this office.

3. REFUNDS. Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest departs before the end of the Reservation or in the event Guest arrives late or does not arrive for the Reservation. Guest further hereby agrees and acknowledges that there will be no refund nor relocation in the event Guest is disappointed with the Rental Property. Furthermore, there shall be no refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS, including but not limited to, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, and/or central heat and air. Furthermore, Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest is required to vacate the Rental Property due to a violation of local, state or federal law or the policies of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Refunds will only be issued at the discretion of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.

4. DAMAGES. Guest shall be solely responsible for any property damage, accident or injury to any person or loss sustained by any person, including loss of money, jewelry and other items of personal property, arising out of or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided by KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and/or the owner of the Rental Property. Guest shall inspect and be familiar with proper use and application of such items prior to using them. Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and/or the owner of the Rental Property harmless from any and all claims including those of third parties, arising out of, or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided therein. 

5. AGENCY DISCLOSURE. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS serves as the agent of the owner of the Rental Property. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall represent and act at all times in the best interests of the owner of the Rental Property. Furthermore, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS reserves the right for random inspections to insure that all policies and procedures are followed. All information provided by KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS regarding the Rental Property has been provided by the owner of the Rental Property and is believed to be accurate, but cannot be guaranteed. Guest acknowledges that the owner of the Rental Property may remove the Rental Property from the rental program with KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Guest further understands that availability of the Rental Property cannot be guaranteed, and KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS may find it necessary to move Guest to a comparable rental property.

6. VISITORS. A Visitor of the Guest(s) may occupy the property on a temporary basis only. Visitors may not occupy the property beyond 10:00 pm or stay overnight without being registered with KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Each rental property has a maximum occupancy and at NO time should said property be occupied by more than allowed number of guest stated. No house parties, weddings or other events are allowed. Should evidence of misuse or violation of occupancy be discovered at any time, the Guest(s) of record will be charged accordingly or immediately evicted without refund. 
 
7. USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY. Guest shall occupy and use the Rental Property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the Rental Property. The use of fireworks is strictly prohibited, and any violators of this provision shall be asked to vacate the Rental Property immediately.  Camp fires are permitted only in the designated fire pit and may only be used after 4 pm.  Camp fire must be attended at all times.

8. PETS.  Pets are NOT allowed in the rental property.  If evidence of a pet is found in the rental property, such as, but not limited to, feces/urine or fleas, a minimum of $50, together with the costs and expenses of additional cleaning services necessary to remove odors and/or stains shall be charged to the renter’s card. 

9. TELEVISIONS. A television equipped with Roku has been provided at KNOTTY POPLAR CABINS.  There will be no option of ordering pay- per-view movies and/or events. In the event Guest orders a pay-per-view movie and/or event, Guest shall be assessed for the cost of the movie(s) and/or event(s), together with a service charge of $10.00. Satellite signal and reception and cable reception is not always reliable, especially during extreme weather, and cannot be guaranteed. 

10. INTERNET. Internet service is provided at all rental properties; however, the speed of the service is not guaranteed. The password for said service will be given to you at time of check-in or by calling the office. Please note that all internet services are not secured. Should guest be found illegally using, downloading, copying, and/or distributing copyrighted material over the network then guest shall be subject to any and all actions imposed by service provider for copyright infringement cost. 

11. FURNITURE. Please do not move any of the cabin furniture (including outdoor furniture) as this may scratch the floor causing damages. If the furniture or floors are damaged during your stay you will be held responsible and charged accordingly. 

12. HEATING AND AIR.  Knotty Poplar Cabins contains electric heat which is controlled by a thermostat in the winter months.  Central air and /or window unit air conditioners will be provided in the property during the summer months.

13. LOST AND FOUND. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall not be responsible for any personal belongings that are lost, stolen, or left behind by Guest or any member of Guest's party. Any personal items found in or around the Rental Property shall be held for thirty (30) days. After the thirty (30) days, any unclaimed items will be discarded or donated unless the owner of the item contacts KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and claims the item. The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS immediately. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up daily by an employee of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.

name: Elk Ridge Cabin ~ Direct Spearhead trail access!
photos/25/caption: Driveway leading to Elk Ridge cabin
photos/26/caption: Private connector trail leading to Spearhead trail # 21
sectionedDescription/access: Guests will have the entire house to themselves.
sectionedDescription/description:
Elk Ridge Cabin is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  A 5-minute ATV ride on our private trail gives you access to miles of the Spearhead Trail System (Coal Canyon).  Elk Ridge offers plenty of room for your family or group and is the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.

Elk Ridge offers 4 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. You will enjoy your own space with plenty of room and privacy. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, eating and cooking utensils, a slow-cooker, and a drip coffee maker.  Bed linens are provided, but please bring your own towels.

Guests will have the entire house to themselves.

Elk Ridge Cabin is located between Grundy, VA and Southern Gap, where the Coal Canyon trail head is located. Various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located in the Grundy town center within 7 miles of the cabin location.  Elk Ridge is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  River tubing trips are available on the Russell Fork River.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade located in Elkhorn City, KY offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.

Parking:  The driveway to the cabin is a maintained, gravel road with a turn at the top of the hill.  A 4-wheel drive vehicle is best.  There is plenty of parking on location; however if additional parking is needed for extra large trailers, parking is available just below the property at our residence.

4. DAMAGES. Guest shall be solely responsible for any property damage, accident or injury to any person or loss sustained by any person, including loss of money, jewelry and other items of personal property, arising out of or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided by KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and/or the owner of the Rental Property. Guest shall inspect and be familiar with proper use and application of such items prior to using them. Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and/or the owner of the Rental Property harmless from any and all claims including those of third parties, arising out of, or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided therein. 

5. AGENCY DISCLOSURE. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS serves as the agent of the owner of the Rental Property. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall represent and act at all times in the best interests of the owner of the Rental Property. Furthermore, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS reserves the right for random inspections to insure that all policies and procedures are followed. All information provided by KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS regarding the Rental Property has been provided by the owner of the Rental Property and is believed to be accurate, but cannot be guaranteed. Guest acknowledges that the owner of the Rental Property may remove the Rental Property from the rental program with KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Guest further understands that availability of the Rental Property cannot be guaranteed, and KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS may find it necessary to move Guest to a comparable rental property.

6. VISITORS. A Visitor of the Guest(s) may occupy the property on a temporary basis only. Visitors may not occupy the property beyond 10:00 pm or stay overnight without being registered with KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. Each rental property has a maximum occupancy and at NO time should said property be occupied by more than allowed number of guest stated. No house parties, weddings or other events are allowed. Should evidence of misuse or violation of occupancy be discovered at any time, the Guest(s) of record will be charged accordingly or immediately evicted without refund. 
 
7. USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY. Guest shall occupy and use the Rental Property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the Rental Property. The use of fireworks is strictly prohibited, and any violators of this provision shall be asked to vacate the Rental Property immediately.  Camp fires are permitted only in the designated fire pit and may only be used after 4 pm.  Camp fire must be attended at all times.

8. PETS.  Pets are NOT allowed in the rental property.  If evidence of a pet is found in the rental property, such as, but not limited to, feces/urine or fleas, a minimum of $50, together with the costs and expenses of additional cleaning services necessary to remove odors and/or stains shall be charged to the renter’s card. 

9. TELEVISIONS. A television equipped with Roku has been provided at KNOTTY POPLAR CABINS.  There will be no option of ordering pay- per-view movies and/or events. In the event Guest orders a pay-per-view movie and/or event, Guest shall be assessed for the cost of the movie(s) and/or event(s), together with a service charge of $10.00. Satellite signal and reception and cable reception is not always reliable, especially during extreme weather, and cannot be guaranteed. 

10. INTERNET. Internet service is provided at all rental properties; however, the speed of the service is not guaranteed. The password for said service will be given to you at time of check-in or by calling the office. Please note that all internet services are not secured. Should guest be found illegally using, downloading, copying, and/or distributing copyrighted material over the network then guest shall be subject to any and all actions imposed by service provider for copyright infringement cost. 

11. FURNITURE. Please do not move any of the cabin furniture (including outdoor furniture) as this may scratch the floor causing damages. If the furniture or floors are damaged during your stay you will be held responsible and charged accordingly. 

12. HEATING AND AIR.  Knotty Poplar Cabins contains electric heat which is controlled by a thermostat in the winter months.  Central air and /or window unit air conditioners will be provided in the property during the summer months.

13. LOST AND FOUND. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall not be responsible for any personal belongings that are lost, stolen, or left behind by Guest or any member of Guest's party. Any personal items found in or around the Rental Property shall be held for thirty (30) days. After the thirty (30) days, any unclaimed items will be discarded or donated unless the owner of the item contacts KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS and claims the item. The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS immediately. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up daily by an employee of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.
sectionedDescription/name: Elk Ridge Cabin ~ Direct Spearhead trail access!
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Elk Ridge Cabin is located between Grundy, VA and Southern Gap, where the Coal Canyon trail head is located. Various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located in the Grundy town center within 7 miles of the cabin location.  Elk Ridge is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  River tubing trips are available on the Russell Fork River.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade located in Elkhorn City, KY offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.
sectionedDescription/notes: Parking:  The driveway to the cabin is a maintained, gravel road with a turn at the top of the hill.  A 4-wheel drive vehicle is best.  There is plenty of parking on location; however if additional parking is needed for extra large trailers, parking is available just below the property at our residence.
sectionedDescription/space: Elk Ridge offers 4 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. You will enjoy your own space with plenty of room and privacy. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, eating and cooking utensils, a slow-cooker, and a drip coffee maker.  Bed linens are provided, but please bring your own towels.
sectionedDescription/summary: Elk Ridge Cabin is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  A 5-minute ATV ride on our private trail gives you access to miles of the Spearhead Trail System (Coal Canyon).  Elk Ridge offers plenty of room for your family or group and is the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.

name: Long Neck Lair Alpaca Farm
photos/1/caption: Enjoy the view from our patio.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy relaxing on our patio, or get to know our alpacas.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy a relaxing stay on our alpaca farm, Long Neck Lair, overlooking the picturesque Appalachian Trail.  We offer a comfortable private room in our home for business travel or vacation/getaway travel.  We share opportunities for our guests to interact with and learn about our alpacas. Convenient location off of I 81 at exit 54 on Route 11 N between Marion, Virginia and Wytheville, Virginia.

First floor room in our home has a private entrance and private bathroom. In room amenities include comfortable queen sofa bed, television, mini refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer.

Enjoy relaxing on our patio, or get to know our alpacas.

We are excited to share our farm with our guests! We are available to answer questions and share southern hospitality.

Long Neck Lair is in a rural setting, yet conveniently located to the towns of Marion, VA and Wytheville, VA. Marion is a ten minute drive away and is home to Hungry Mother State Park and Lincoln Theatre. Wytheville is a fifteen minute drive away and offers museums, entertainment, and history. Both towns have restaurants and shopping.  There are two restaurants within walking distance of our farm.

Our farm, Long Neck Lair, is located on Route 11 North approximately 1/2 mile off of I 81 at exit 54. Access to the Appalachian Trail is 3/10 of a mile from our farm.Please check the Mountain Lynx Transit website for information on limited transportation in our area.

Please contact us for same day availability.
Our farm is home to alpacas, chickens, dogs, and cats. Please take note, if you have allergies.
(Room rate includes 10.3% state and local taxes.)

Bramwell Hill Manor is ATV friendly house over looking the town of Bramwell WV and is  located 1/4 mile from the Hatfield McCoy's Pocahontas ATV Trailhead and 4 miles from the Original Pocahontas Trail on Virginia's Spearhead trail system. The house is furnished with towels and liens. The kitchen has everything you need for cooking or use the BBQ grill on the covered patio. The house has WIFI and cable TV. 

Over 4 guests is an additional $25.00 per guest per night.

I will available in case you need something or have questions..

You can drive your ATV to the trailheads on the highway from the house.

additionalHouseRules:
1. No parties or events may be held at the Loft or on the property. 
2. No overnight guests other than those registered and approved when making the reservation online. If you are expecting visitors for a short period of time during your stay, please let your hosts know.
3. No pets are permitted without prior permission and with an additional pet charge of $25 per pet (maximum one large dog or two small dogs). Sorry, no cats are permitted ever. We have four (friendly) dogs so we will need to coordinate yard usage to avoid any possible problems. Please clean up after your pet! Pets may not be left unattended for more than 2 hours and must be in a kennel/travel carrier. If you need assistance finding a dog-sitter please contact your hosts ahead of time.
4. Trash cans and bags are provided in the Loft (under the sink in the kitchen and bathroom). If the cans get full during your stay, please take the trash out and put in one of the trash cans in, or by, the driveway. No need to take out the trash at the end of your stay.
5. No hair dying or coloring is permitted in the Loft.
6. We do not have child safety features; children are welcome if you accept liability and are comfortable knowing we have no child proofing along with many stairs.
7. Minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied, in person AT ALL TIMES, by an adult over 21. You must be 21 to book a reservation at the Loft.
8. The antler hooks by the door will not hold heavy loads. Please only hang light jackets and clothing on them.
9. Please clean your boots/shoes as well as you can before entering the building and use the boot tray upstairs by the door for your boots and shoes.
10. Please do not block neighbor’s driveways, including the apartment’s next door. We will do what we can to help you with parking (including our driveway and street parking in front of our house). Please let us know if you’re traveling with a trailer so we can help you plan for parking.
11. If you would like to sit outside, you are welcome to use the camp chairs at the bottom of the stairs. If it is raining or too sunny, feel free to sit under the carport by the house. If we are parked there, just send us a message during daytime hours (9 a.m. to 9 p.m.) and we’ll move our car: we want you to enjoy your stay! You can also sit in the backyard but be aware that our dogs will occasionally need to be let out. If you are using the yard and/or grill, we will check with you before letting out the dogs. When sitting outside after 9 p.m. please try to keep the noise down so as not to disturb the residents and neighbors.
12. Do not go out on the roof. While it looks like a great place to hang out, it’s not safe for people and walking on the shingles are likely to cause damage.
13. Without exception, no smoking, vaping or marijuana usage inside the Loft. Please don’t think it can be covered up, it cannot. We have to extensively clean to remove the contaminant before other guests can arrive. Neutralizing this contaminant inside requires a $100 minimum service fee. Feel free to step outside in the back yard and quietly enjoy a tobacco smoke or vape; you'll just need to police your butts.
14. Before you leave, please wash any dishes that you used. Clean dishes can be left in the drainer to dry and we’ll put them away.
15. No need to strip the bed or pile up used towels and washcloths upon departure but during your stay, please hang wet towels and washcloths on the towel racks, shower curtain rod or side of the bathtub.
16. Please lock the door at the bottom of the steps whenever you leave the premises, including your departure.

name: Foggy Mountain Loft near Hatfield & McCoy Trails
photos/0/caption: Newly remodeled space is comfortable and welcoming.
photos/1/caption: Foggy Mountain Loft is an "L" shaped studio apartment, newly remodeled with added features to make your stay comfortable.
photos/2/caption: A small refrigerator/freezer (with bottled water waiting for you). The couch folds down to a small bed, if you're traveling with a third person.
photos/3/caption: If you forget your teddy, you can use ours; he's waiting in the room for you!
photos/4/caption: A comfortable full-size bed awaits you!
photos/5/caption: There's a Roku TV for you to log in to your favorite app to enjoy your down time. It will rotate so you can watch from bed or the couch.
photos/6/caption: A comfortable place for two to eat, and the table expands to add a folding chair if you have a third.
photos/7/caption: A microwave, coffee maker, water heater and toaster are available for your use.
photos/8/caption: A few snacks will be available to hold you over until meal time!
photos/9/caption: A full-size tub/shower is part of the full bathroom.
photos/10/caption: We'll have a few essentials available if you forget anything.
photos/11/caption: You'll find a place to hang your jacket and park your boots in the corner as you enter. There is central heating and a window air conditioner to keep you comfortable.
photos/12/caption: Write a note home or make a list of what to do on your trip (but leave the pen for the next guest!).
photos/13/caption: A fenced-in yard for your dog to play in
photos/14/caption: A fenced-in yard for your dog to play in
photos/15/caption: Easy entry through the gate by the garage
photos/16/caption: You'll know you're there when you see the welcome sign!
photos/17/caption: You'll enter through this door, around the corner from the "Welcome" sign.
photos/18/caption: There are several steps up to the loft, which is above our detached garage.
photos/19/caption: Many mornings you'll see the foggy mountain from the loft
primaryHost/about: I'm a retired Army chaplain who likes to travel and is now offering our guest house behind our retirement home for you to enjoy.
sectionedDescription/access: Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.
sectionedDescription/description:
Great place near Hatfield & McCoy trailheads! The Foggy Mountain Loft has the feel of a mountain hideaway but in town, close to where you want to play & eat. There's a private entrance to this simple guest loft above the garage behind our home. You'll find a basic kitchenette, full bathroom, Roku TV and WiFi. At over 50 years old, the Loft shows its age with multiple layers of paint and years of cosmetic repairs, but it has been recently renovated to create a safe, clean & comfortable space.

The Foggy Mountain Loft is a single L-shaped room which has a double bed, futon couch, and a full bathroom with bathtub and shower. You can use our Adirondack chairs to spend time outside or stay in and watch your streaming apps on the Roku TV. There isn't a stove or oven in the Loft but there is a microwave, coffee maker, hot water kettle, toaster, air fryer and electric skillet for simple food preparation, and a grill in the garage you can use upon request.  There are also many great restaurants in Logan just a few minutes away.

Foggy Mountain Loft is on a residential street near town with free on-street parking. If you're towing a trailer, we'll try to save the spaces in front of the house for you with prior arrangement or you can use our driveway. You'll have a private entrance to the Loft at the end of the driveway with access through a digital keypad deadbolt lock.

We're available during your stay for assistance or to answer questions but you'll have as much privacy as you're looking for.

There are many places to eat in Logan and a lot of things to do:

Chief Logan State Park: 5.6 miles
Chief Logan Recreation Center: 8.2 miles
Dunks Body Shop (Gym): 12.5 miles
H & M Bearwallow Trail connector: 1 mile
H & M Bearwallow Trailhead: 4.1 miles
H & M Rockhouse Trailhead: 13.8 miles
H & M Buffalo Mountain Trailhead: 28 miles
H & M Devil Anse Trailhead: 34.6 miles

Gas station (which usually has the cheapest gas in Logan) is just about a mile away (just past the coffee house and bakery...)!

On street parking is easy to find near Foggy Mountain Loft. If you're raveling with a trailer you'll be able to find a spot within a couple blocks of the Loft. With prior arrangement, guests traveling with a trailer can have the parking spaces in front of  our house saved by us until their arrival or can park in the driveway (pulling truck into carport, there's room for a trailer with one ATV).

This is a 2nd floor loft with a narrow staircase, so you'll need to keep an eye on small children and keep in mind your own ability to climb stairs.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
1. No parties or events may be held at the Loft or on the property. 
2. No overnight guests other than those registered and approved when making the reservation online. If you are expecting visitors for a short period of time during your stay, please let your hosts know.
3. No pets are permitted without prior permission and with an additional pet charge of $25 per pet (maximum one large dog or two small dogs). Sorry, no cats are permitted ever. We have four (friendly) dogs so we will need to coordinate yard usage to avoid any possible problems. Please clean up after your pet! Pets may not be left unattended for more than 2 hours and must be in a kennel/travel carrier. If you need assistance finding a dog-sitter please contact your hosts ahead of time.
4. Trash cans and bags are provided in the Loft (under the sink in the kitchen and bathroom). If the cans get full during your stay, please take the trash out and put in one of the trash cans in, or by, the driveway. No need to take out the trash at the end of your stay.
5. No hair dying or coloring is permitted in the Loft.
6. We do not have child safety features; children are welcome if you accept liability and are comfortable knowing we have no child proofing along with many stairs.
7. Minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied, in person AT ALL TIMES, by an adult over 21. You must be 21 to book a reservation at the Loft.
8. The antler hooks by the door will not hold heavy loads. Please only hang light jackets and clothing on them.
9. Please clean your boots/shoes as well as you can before entering the building and use the boot tray upstairs by the door for your boots and shoes.
10. Please do not block neighbor’s driveways, including the apartment’s next door. We will do what we can to help you with parking (including our driveway and street parking in front of our house). Please let us know if you’re traveling with a trailer so we can help you plan for parking.
11. If you would like to sit outside, you are welcome to use the camp chairs at the bottom of the stairs. If it is raining or too sunny, feel free to sit under the carport by the house. If we are parked there, just send us a message during daytime hours (9 a.m. to 9 p.m.) and we’ll move our car: we want you to enjoy your stay! You can also sit in the backyard but be aware that our dogs will occasionally need to be let out. If you are using the yard and/or grill, we will check with you before letting out the dogs. When sitting outside after 9 p.m. please try to keep the noise down so as not to disturb the residents and neighbors.
12. Do not go out on the roof. While it looks like a great place to hang out, it’s not safe for people and walking on the shingles are likely to cause damage.
13. Without exception, no smoking, vaping or marijuana usage inside the Loft. Please don’t think it can be covered up, it cannot. We have to extensively clean to remove the contaminant before other guests can arrive. Neutralizing this contaminant inside requires a $100 minimum service fee. Feel free to step outside in the back yard and quietly enjoy a tobacco smoke or vape; you'll just need to police your butts.
14. Before you leave, please wash any dishes that you used. Clean dishes can be left in the drainer to dry and we’ll put them away.
15. No need to strip the bed or pile up used towels and washcloths upon departure but during your stay, please hang wet towels and washcloths on the towel racks, shower curtain rod or side of the bathtub.
16. Please lock the door at the bottom of the steps whenever you leave the premises, including your departure.

name: Lucy's Mountain View
primaryHost/about: My husband and I are travel enthusiasts with a passion for exploring new places and trying new foods. We value the learning and personal growth that come with travel, and love sharing our experiences with others. That's why my husband and I decided to create Escape Vacation Rentals, where we can share our personal spaces with others from all over. We believe that travel has the power to broaden our horizons and connect us with people and places we might never have encountered otherwise. We hope you enjoy our little spaces as much as we do!!!
sectionedDescription/description: NESTLED IN THE HEART OF THE APPLALACHIA, THIS COZY CABIN IS THE PERFECT GET AWAY. IT SITS OVERLOOKING THE CLINCH MOUNTAIN, AND HAS A WONDERFUL VIEW OF THE VALLEY BELOW. ONLY 10 MIN FROM TOWN & 20 MIN TO CLINCH VALLEY MEDICAL CENTER. YOU WILL STILL ENJOY ALL THE AMENITIES YOU NEED. OUR CABIN IS PERFECT FOR YOUR NEXT ADVENTURE!  ATV'S WELCOME-PLEANTY OF PARKING!! 25 MIN TO THE NEW JAWBONE TRAILHEAD!

Front of the house. Entrance to Campside Cottage is to the right (upstairs). Entrance to The Lake House is to the left—at the back of the house. Separate parking for each unit. 
No access between units. 
Quiet hours are 10:00 pm-8:00 am.
photos/14/caption: Campside Cottage is the upstairs unit. Downstairs is The Lake House—a 2 bedroom/1 bath Airbnb rental.
photos/15/caption: The lockbox code will be sent to you, and you have to put in the code again to close it.
photos/16/caption: Fire pit and seating for Campside Cottage.

photos/25/caption: Scenic Overlook-4.5 miles from Campside Cottage.
photos/32/caption: Downtown Marion-America’s Coolest Hometown!
primaryHost/about: Welcome! We are glad to host you during your stay at Hungry Mother State Park!
sectionedDescription/access:
Access to the lake trail is located directly across from the property. The Clyburn trail is adjacent to the property. 

In addition to the hiking and biking trails of Hungry Mother Park, there is a beach area (with concessions), a gift shop (inside the park and at Camp Burson), playground areas, canoe, paddle boat, kayak, and paddle board rentals.
sectionedDescription/description:
Campside Cottage--a vacation retreat located across from Camp Burson at the entrance of Hungry Mother State Park in Marion, Virginia.  Relax around the campfire,  hike or bike the many trails.  Lounge on the beach with a good book, or cast your line to catch a big one!  Enjoy the beautiful views of the Appalachian mountains while paddleboarding or kayaking Hungry Mother Lake.  Don't forget to go shopping or sample the restaurants of America's Coolest Hometown!  Enjoy your stay!

Campside Cottage is a clean, newly- renovated modern farmhouse style retreat. It is an upstairs unit with a separate entrance (the downstairs is also a vacation rental with a separate entrance located at the opposite end of the house). There is a very large backyard (field) that kids can play in, and the driveway is perfect for bike riding. There is plenty of parking and you can enjoy the flicker of campfires from the campground across the road while having your own large, private area to yourself. There is a fire pit and outdoor seating area, plus a grill (both gas and charcoal provided) for outdoor cooking. The Campside Cottage is perfect for the couple looking to get away for a few days, or for the young family with small children.  Parents and guests of Emory & Henry Health Sciences students--we are located 2 miles from the Marion campus and would love to host you when you visit!

Access to the lake trail is located directly across from the property. The Clyburn trail is adjacent to the property. 

In addition to the hiking and biking trails of Hungry Mother Park, there is a beach area (with concessions), a gift shop (inside the park and at Camp Burson), playground areas, canoe, paddle boat, kayak, and paddle board rentals.

Guests will have complete privacy with self check-in. A lockbox allows flexibility for guests’ arrival times. A code will be sent to you prior to check-in. There is a list of instructions located within the cottage regarding check-out. Host phone numbers are located inside the rental. 

Message me on the Airbnb app or text/call me if there are any issues or anything that you need help with. I will respond promptly in order to ensure that you to have the best stay possible!!!

Check out the online Guidebook!

Campside Cottage is located at the entrance to Hungry Mother State Park, directly across from Camp Burson campground. Situated on 3.5 acres, there is plenty of privacy. Also, located on the property is the downstairs of this unit (also a vacation rental) as well as two additional vacation rentals (The Berry Cabin and Dreamer’s Lodge). Our property (@ the lake) ends at the fence at the back of the 3.5 acres. Beyond this fence is our neighbors…please respect their privacy! :)

Plenty of parking on site. The neighborhood is very quiet and very safe.

Downtown Marion has many excellent restaurants (Mi Puerto, Macados, Wooden Pickle, Moondog, Sisters’ Cafe & Gifts, Sur 81 to name a few, as well as many fast-food chains) and shopping (Blue Ridge Outfitters, Marion Outdoors, Army/Navy Store, Just Believe Boutique, The Daisy Boutique, Willbeez Country Store and Deli, The Toy Box and others). 

Take in a movie, or a game of putt-putt at Park Place Drive-In. Grab an ice-cream at Park Place or some fudge at Willbeez Country Store and Deli. Enjoy a cup of coffee or some pastry at Better Coffee Co. or Starbucks. 


Marion’s own Lincoln Theatre, one of the last remaining Mayan Revival style theaters in the world, provides a variety of performing arts events. 

And just a short drive away…Barter Theatre, Wohlfahrt Haus Dinner Theatre, Grayson Highlands Park, The Virginia Creeper Trail, Bristol Raceway, Pinnacle Shopping Center, The Back of the Dragon, the Appalachian Trail.
