name: Rustic Log Cabin with Spectacular Views
photos/6/caption: Big Ridge Retreat - a perfect family getaway. Sept 2020
photos/16/caption: Upstairs Bedroom
sectionedDescription/access: The whole property is available to you other than an owners shed and closet which are kept locked.
sectionedDescription/description:
Escape summer's heat in this rustic log cabin and enjoy its modern amenities and dramatic views Situated close to Jefferson National Forest with its hiking trails, New River Campground for canoeing or tubing, Grayson Highlands State Park and the VA Creeper Bike Trail, the cabin provides a base for scenic trips to numerous festivals, antique shops and outdoor recreational opportunities. Alternatively, you can rock on the front porch and absorb the ever-changing and spectacular views.

The log cabin features a 2-story vaulted ceiling, dramatic fireplace and rough-hewn plank walls and ceiling in the living room. Local vintage antiques decorate the living room walls.

The cabin sleeps 10, but there are 2 extra bunks and a pull-out couch if needed.

Surrounded by pine forests and fields, you might see some deer and wild turkeys and hear owls. You are guaranteed to hear a chorus of birds and the swish of the wind through pine trees in the morning. Bring your hiking shoes and some good books to enjoy in this tranquil, beautiful setting.

Temperatures at the cabin's 4,000 feet elevation are typically about 10 degrees cooler than in lower-elevation Independence, VA, just 8 miles away. And Independence typically has 10-degree lower temperatures than lower-elevation Piedmont locations such as Charlotte, NC, some 124 miles to the south. Independence has a large grocery store, restaurants, park with swimming pool and tennis courts, and antiqueing if you decide to go exploring.

The whole property is available to you other than an owners shed and closet which are kept locked.

We're available to help you 24/7 although we are not local. Who to call in various cases is in the FAQ we send once you have been confirmed as a booking

Temperatures at the cabin's 4,000 feet elevation are typically about 10 degrees cooler than in lower-elevation Independence, VA, just 8 miles away. And Independence typically has 10-degree lower temperatures than lower-elevation Piedmont locations such as Charlotte, NC, some 124 miles to the south. Independence has a large grocery store, restaurants, park with swimming pool and tennis courts, and antiquing if you decide to go exploring.

Four-wheel drive recommended. Sports car access might be problematical.

Our guests are best at describing the experience:

•	The cabin is special. It’s located in a beautiful area of Virginia that provides solitude in nature while also being 15 minutes from a nice grocery store. We appreciated the well-stocked kitchen with nice cookware and kitchen tools. We spent a day on the property enjoying the view, walking through the fields to find even more splendid views, and having a cozy fire in the comfortable cabin. The next two days we rode the Virginia Creeper trail and hiked with wild ponies in Grayson Highlands State Park. Anne was responsive to all inquiries and provided all the information we needed for our trip. - April 2022
•	100 percent awesomeness!!! We loved the cabin and property kitchen was well supplied. Being from Florida we had a beautiful fire burning almost all week. Great family time. We hope to return one day - April 2021
•	Views are unreal as are the chipmunks, dear, cows, turkeys, hawks and many, many rabbits. The weather was amazing, no bugs or skeeter's.  Who would think you would need a fire in July. - July 2020
•	What a beautiful and peaceful property it was so relaxing and the children loved taking walks, swinging on the tire swing, running around in the yard, sitting on the big rock, making some wars at night and exploring the Woods thank you for sharing.
•	What amazing views, the fresh mountain air and the picturesque cabin were the perfect escape for our family.  Our kids’ favorite part was the tire swing and we all enjoyed fires in the fireplace and in the fire pit. 

Explore the area from the cabin's central base: 
o Jefferson National Forest (9 mi from cabin)
o Grayson Highlands State Park (13 mi)
o Grayson Recreation Park (9 mi) swimming, tennis courts, hiking
o Peach Bottom Falls (9 mi)
o Blue Ridge Parkway (25 mi)
o Shatley Springs Restaurant (31 mi)
o Hillsville Flea Market (36 mi)
o Virginia Creeper Bike Trail (42 mi)
o Library, churches, museum and gift shop in Independence (8 mi)

Enjoy festivities and activities in Independence:
o Farmer's Market (Wednesday 4-6 pm; Friday 9 am -1 pm; early May thru early October)
o Concerts in the historic Old Courthouse on some weekends in summer
o Jam Sessions featuring bluegrass music Wed 6 - 9 pm on Old Courthouse lawn
o July 4th Parade and Fireworks display includes craft and food tents, music
o Potty Princess Pageant and Fall Mountain Foliage Festival and Grand Privy Race in October
o Safe Halloween with music, bouncy houses, pony rides, haunted house

. . . and nearby festivities:
o Clogging and Blue Grass Music (Saturday nights at Flat Ridge Community Center)
o Fiddler's Convention in Galax, VA

There is no public transit and we recommend a standard size sedan or larger, preferably with 4 wheel drive as the driveway is quite steep.

Frequently Asked Questions
Q. Anything I need to do to “open” the cabin?
A. 
Air Conditioning: Just open all the windows.
Extra Freezer and Refrigerators: There is 1 short, white freezer and 1 short, white refrigerator on the back porch.
Lawn Swing: Cushions for the front porch swing, chairs and the lawn swing are stored inside a closet in the bedroom closest to the bathroom on the first floor. They can be placed on the swing for your use and in the shed’s overhang to keep dry at other times. The canopy for the lawn swing is under the shed’s overhang if you wish to attach it.
Heat: The thermostat is on the LR wall between the two bedroom doors. If heat is needed, the fuel oil furnace should be used as the primary heating source, as it is much less costly to operate. If electric baseboard heat is needed, individual thermostats are on each electric baseboard heater. If you run out of firewood or if you think the next renter might run out, please let us know.

Q. Anything I need to do while there?
A. Just a couple of items:
-Most importantly, keep the gate to the adjacent property (the one you can see from the house) chained shut, so that any cows grazing in the adjacent field (which is not part of Big Ridge Retreat) will not get out.
-Let us know about things that need fixing, cleaning, don’t work or if you see any evidence of mice or bears. We are not local and need your help in a little quality control.
-Mainly, just relax and enjoy your visit!!!
Q. What about cell phone service at the house?
A. It is marginal to non-existent inside the cabin (at least for AT&T and Verizon). Sometimes you can get some service with Verizon if you stand on the big rock in the front yard. Verizon customers also usually get service down the hill and in nearby Independence, VA.
Q. What about long-distance calls on the cabin’s land line?
A. Local and US long distance calls are free. You are responsible for international calls.
Q. What about Internet service at the cabin?
A. It is there through a dish. The security code is on the router which is on top of the refrigerator.
Q. What about TV service at the cabin?
A. There is a TV in the cabin for use in conjunction with the DVD player. There is no cable service and no TV antenna, so hard to get any channels. There are plenty of games and puzzles to play; many books to read; spectacular stars to watch; and a cozy fireplace for night-time amusement. During the day there is plenty of natural beauty and nature to enjoy while away from the hubbub.
Q. Are there CD’s or DVD’s at the cabin?
A. There are a few CD’s and DVD’s. You may wish to bring a few of your own favorites.
Q. What about hunting on the property or on adjacent properties?
A. Neither hunting nor a gun is permitted on the Big Ridge Retreat property. We believe that all of the adjacent properties are posted for no hunting as well.
Q. What do I need to do when I check out?
A. Just a few simple steps, which should also be posted in the cabin:
1. Please place all trash and recyclables in their respective containers by the shed. Trash should be in tied plastic bags. Secure bungee straps on top of trash containers to keep animals out. Housekeeping will remove the trash.
2. Put your dirty dishes in the dishwasher and run them.
3. Empty and unplug freezer on back porch.
4. Leave towels on the floor and sheets on beds and don’t make up the beds, so we know which ones you used.
5. Please close and lock all windows and doors and close blinds
a. Make sure to slide bolts on kitchen door, back door and upstairs door
b. Latch screen doors on upstairs balcony, back porch and kitchen so they don’t slam against the
6. Leave thermostat on 50 to avoid freezing pipes.
7. As you leave the property, close and lock the gate. Leave the 2 keys in the lockbox by the front gate and rotate the lock combination wheels. Leave the keys to the back decks on the nail at the end of the mantle, where you found them.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
- Not wheelchair accessible 
- Not suitable for elderly or infirm

sectionedDescription/name: Rustic Log Cabin with Spectacular Views
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie:
Temperatures at the cabin's 4,000 feet elevation are typically about 10 degrees cooler than in lower-elevation Independence, VA, just 8 miles away. And Independence typically has 10-degree lower temperatures than lower-elevation Piedmont locations such as Charlotte, NC, some 124 miles to the south. Independence has a large grocery store, restaurants, park with swimming pool and tennis courts, and antiquing if you decide to go exploring.

Four-wheel drive recommended. Sports car access might be problematical.

Our guests are best at describing the experience:

•	The cabin is special. It’s located in a beautiful area of Virginia that provides solitude in nature while also being 15 minutes from a nice grocery store. We appreciated the well-stocked kitchen with nice cookware and kitchen tools. We spent a day on the property enjoying the view, walking through the fields to find even more splendid views, and having a cozy fire in the comfortable cabin. The next two days we rode the Virginia Creeper trail and hiked with wild ponies in Grayson Highlands State Park. Anne was responsive to all inquiries and provided all the information we needed for our trip. - April 2022
•	100 percent awesomeness!!! We loved the cabin and property kitchen was well supplied. Being from Florida we had a beautiful fire burning almost all week. Great family time. We hope to return one day - April 2021
•	Views are unreal as are the chipmunks, dear, cows, turkeys, hawks and many, many rabbits. The weather was amazing, no bugs or skeeter's.  Who would think you would need a fire in July. - July 2020

sectionedDescription/space:
The log cabin features a 2-story vaulted ceiling, dramatic fireplace and rough-hewn plank walls and ceiling in the living room. Local vintage antiques decorate the living room walls.

The cabin sleeps 10, but there are 2 extra bunks and a pull-out couch if needed.

Surrounded by pine forests and fields, you might see some deer and wild turkeys and hear owls. You are guaranteed to hear a chorus of birds and the swish of the wind through pine trees in the morning. Bring your hiking shoes and some good books to enjoy in this tranquil, beautiful setting.

Temperatures at the cabin's 4,000 feet elevation are typically about 10 degrees cooler than in lower-elevation Independence, VA, just 8 miles away. And Independence typically has 10-degree lower temperatures than lower-elevation Piedmont locations such as Charlotte, NC, some 124 miles to the south. Independence has a large grocery store, restaurants, park with swimming pool and tennis courts, and antiqueing if you decide to go exploring.
sectionedDescription/summary: Escape summer's heat in this rustic log cabin and enjoy its modern amenities and dramatic views Situated close to Jefferson National Forest with its hiking trails, New River Campground for canoeing or tubing, Grayson Highlands State Park and the VA Creeper Bike Trail, the cabin provides a base for scenic trips to numerous festivals, antique shops and outdoor recreational opportunities. Alternatively, you can rock on the front porch and absorb the ever-changing and spectacular views.
sectionedDescription/transit: There is no public transit and we recommend a standard size sedan or larger, preferably with 4 wheel drive as the driveway is quite steep.

sectionedDescription/description:
Three bedrooms and a sitting room with futon and extra inflatable mattress.  There are two bathrooms upstairs. This is the perfect location ..... on Main Street, downtown Abingdon.....within walking distance of the Barter Theatre,  Virginia Creeper Trail, restaurants,  Brewery, shops and boutiques, playgrounds, library, health food store, Farmers Market Pavilion, and more.   Local artists have art for sale throughout the house.  Come see us!

Three bedrooms are upstairs, two bathrooms (one in hall and one private off king bedroom),  and sitting room (with futon and extra mattress). Sitting room has TV.  Coffee/tea bar, mini-fridge, and microwave in upstairs hall.

Make yourself at home in library, kitchen, outdoor patio, etc.

Host is always available via phone or text and may or may not be staying in her own private quarters in house.

Beautiful and historic town!

Perfect town for biking and walking. We don't have Uber but do have an Abingdon Transit bus if needed.

primaryHost/about:
I live for adventure and the great outdoors.  I want to share it with people and promote fun and adventure for others.  I will work with whoever to try and maximize each individual experience.  
I myself can't live without music. Hence you'll find a Bluetooth radio and speakers in the kitchen.   I attend many rock concerts each year, but I love all forms of music.  I love to cook, so you'll see my kitchen is set up for a cook.  
My style of travel is one were you would like to forget you have a cell phone!
My life motto since I was in high school is "Body, Mind, and soul"  Stay healthy, be smart, and be a good person!
sectionedDescription/access: You have access to the whole cabin and the trails on the property as well as the trail that goes to my brothers property that can be hiked or used by ATV's.  You also have access to the private community waterfall.
sectionedDescription/description:
18 acre Mountaintop cabin located in Bluefield, VA.  Beautiful views of the Jefferson National Forest.   Located in a gated community called Cove Creek which consists of many  large acre properties and very little development.  Several trails located directly on the property for atv riding and hiking.  The community is atv friendly and also boasts a beautiful creek containing brook trout and picturesque waterfall.  Winterplace , Hatfield Mccoy Trails, and Appalachian trail all only minutes away.

There are many things that make this cabin unique.  First, it's  a  1,200 sq foot 3 bedroom fully equipped cozy cabin property on 18 acres and has breathtaking mountaintop views and private access to our own trails for hiking and ATV'ing.  It's also centrally located to several well known mountain adventure places for White water rafting, Skiiing, ATV'ing, Hiking, and much more.  We moderately priced this so that families, couples, and friend groups alike can take advantage of it.  We have wood logs on the property for the fireplace that can be chopped and usually there is some already there.  While you feel like your in complete solitude at the top of the south side it's nice to know you have easy access to many amenities (grocery stores, restaurants, movie theater, etc) in the city of Bluefield, VA: located just minutes from the bottom of the northside of the mountain.

You have access to the whole cabin and the trails on the property as well as the trail that goes to my brothers property that can be hiked or used by ATV's.  You also have access to the private community waterfall.

We are in florida but have a property manager that is there for housing needs and/or emergencies.  I pride myself of communication and maximizing your experience.  Email or text me for any details anytime.

The cabin is located inside of a gated, sparsely populated community called cove creek.  Guests have access to the Creek which has trout and a beautiful waterfall.  The city of bluefield and Tazewell are mintues away and have many restaurants, grociery stores, and your basic amenities (there's a walmart...lol).  Also within driving distance are great adventure places like the Hatfield Mccoy ATV Trails, Appalachian Trail for hiking, Winter Place ski resort,  AceRaft for white water and many  parks with waterfalls like pipestem and the cascades.  The property itself is 18 acres and has several trails on it for hiking and atv'ing.

If it’s not snowing any car can be used to get up and down the mountain.  However if more then 2-4 inches snow is in the forecast we highly recommend 4 wheel drive.  Also, the driveway can be tough to get up and down if you aren’t use to driving in the mountains.  I can do it in a Prius as long as it’s not snowing but I have experience. Biggest hint is stick to the left side when going up. There is additional parking at the coldesac on top of the driveway if you want to play it safe

*It takes about 15-20 minutes to go up or down the mountain depending on your vehicle, what your towing, and comfortableness in mountain driving.  
*Hatfielld Mccoy trails are about 15-45 minutes from the bottom depending on which trailhead you access.  as of right now you can not access directly by ATV.
*WinterPlace is 39 miles from the bottom of the mountain and takes about 30 minutes.
*5 miles from Appalachian Trail and can actually view the mountain ridge it passes through from the cabin. 
*"The Back og the Dragon" Trail for motorcycles is close but might have to trailer bikes down the mountain depending if you can ride on the gravel roads.

- Accompany children at all times.

- be careful in dry seasons of fires outside.   Put any fire outside completely out with water.   Winds are strong at the top of mountain and can restart your fires that aren’t fully out out and blow embers into dry leaves.   
-  no hunting unless otherwise permitted by owner and properly licensed.
-  no chopping down of live trees or chopping into damaging move trees.   
- lastly, Don't be an idiot.

sectionedDescription/access: Guests have full access to the entire Townhouse property during their stay.  There is a backyard that is shared along with a courtyard in the neighboring property.  There is an outdoor grill shared among all the properties.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Townhouse, managed by the Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square, is located in the newest National Park, the New River Gorge National Park in the beautiful Hinton Historic District.  
This charming property offers 2 bedrooms, one and a half bath, and a spacious downstairs for the whole family.

The Townhouse is one of many properties operated by the Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square and has all the amenities of home.  We can easily accommodate families and business travelers alike.  All of our properties are within walking distance of shopping, museums, and dining.  
The Townouse is a warm and cozy 2 bedroom property.  Both bedrooms and the full bath are located upstairs.  A half bath is located downstairs.  The fully stocked kitchen and dining room are ample space to stretch out during your stay and enjoy time with family.  
Our cleaning staff follows all covid protocols and takes extra steps to ensure the safety of all our guests.

Guests have full access to the entire Townhouse property during their stay.  There is a backyard that is shared along with a courtyard in the neighboring property.  There is an outdoor grill shared among all the properties.

During Covid, we are offering a contactless entry to all properties. 
 The hospitality specialist will text the lockbox code to guests on the day of their arrival.  We can be available when needed for our guests and are always a phone call away.  Should you call after business hours, you will most likely be greeted by our answering service.  If you have a need, simply let them know and they can direct it to the appropriate person on call.

The Guest House Inn is conveniently located in the heart of the downtown Hinton historic district in Summers County WV.  A one time bustling railroad community is now a charming downtown with brick lined streets, eclectic shops, and old architecture all nestled along the banks of the New and Greenbrier rivers.  
The confluence of the Bluestone, New, and Greenbrier rivers form the southern West Virginia gateway of the mighty New River in  Summers County.  Outdoor recreational adventure abounds in and around Hinton.  Summers County is one of only a few counties in West Virginia that offers kayakers, floaters, and fisherman 16 public access sites along the banks of the Greenbrier and the New.  
With the combination of natural beauty and historic charm, Hinton is the hidden jewel of Summers County.

Hinton is 11 miles from Interstate 64 and approximately 45 minutes away from two airports in neighboring counties.  The traffic pattern in town is made up of one way and two way city blocks which is very easy to navigate.  
Amtrak has a designated stop at the Hinton Train Depot that is 4 blocks away from the Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square.  Amtrak does not provide ticketing or baggage services at this station, which is served by the tri-weekly Cardinal (Westbound: Sunday, Wednesday, Friday; Eastbound: Wednesday, Friday, Sunday).

The bedrooms are located up a flight of 18 steps.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Smoking inside the Inn, common areas or your room, will result in a $250 charge for cleaning.
A no-show will be charged for the entire reserved stay.  Well-behaved, small pets are allowed in the Townhouse property only for an additional fee.
sectionedDescription/interaction:
During Covid, we are offering a contactless entry to all properties. 
 The hospitality specialist will text the lockbox code to guests on the day of their arrival.  We can be available when needed for our guests and are always a phone call away.  Should you call after business hours, you will most likely be greeted by our answering service.  If you have a need, simply let them know and they can direct it to the appropriate person on call.

name: Whispering Pines Private Cabin 5 mins off I-77
primaryHost/about: We are a nature loving and hard working family. We came to Bland several years ago for the beauty and private way of living. Walkers Valley is one of the most beautiful places you will ever see. Serenity, peacefulness, and the beauty of the mountains, are all the reasons we moved here.  We invite you, our guests, to come and see for yourself. We promise, if you love the outdoors as much as we do, you will be able to appreciate the beauty of Bland, Va.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enchanted cozy cabin " Whispering Pines " located 5 minutes off I-77 in Bland, Va.  Our cabin is  located on 8 acres of property and full  of various types of wildlife.  Sometimes, you will see bear, deer, wild turkey, and squirrels. We also live on the property, but the cabin is private and  tucked away within the beautiful whispering pines.

. The interior has recently been updated with appliances and decor including farmhouse style. The exterior of the cabin has also been recently renovated. There is a  peaceful fire pit for your family to enjoy.  You will need an All Wheel Drive (AWD) or Four -Wheel Drive vehicle (4x4) in order to drive all the way to the cabin because the incline is a little steep for a 2 wheel drive. There  is a parking lot at the top of this incline for all the Non-AWD and Non-4x4 vehicles.  Please note, you will only have to walk approximately 75 yards down the hill to the cabin. The other Parking lot is at the bottom. Upon request, a pack & play can be provided for your baby or toddler. The cabin is NOT wheelchair accessible and has NO WIFI! Cell service is limited to Verizon, however AT&T will pick up 1 bar and LTE. The cabin has No cable TV; however, there is a 42 inch TV available with multi-selection DVDs for adults and children.  We have also included a selection of books for adults and children. Our property has 2 ponds,  a mid-sized refrigerator, sink, dishes, pots/pans,  silverware, cooking utensils, and a Keurig coffee pot. Enjoy your evening sitting by the firepit or gazebo by the pond. Although, our water source is from freshwater springs, we do advise not to drink, to be on the safe side; however you can boil the water for drinking and cooking. We will provide each guest with one bottle of drinking water.  Whispering Pines cabin is sparkling clean and  very quiet with a peaceful rustic setting.

Guest have full access to the cabin and pond. Children MUST be supervised at all times.

Available by cell phone.

This cabin is nestled in the Blue Ridge mountains surrounded by the Washington Jefferson National Forest. There are many Appalachian trail heads  in Bland county and  many things to do nearby. The closest Appalachian trailhead from the cabin is only 2.1 miles. Fort Chiswell Animal Park(16 miles), Wytheville (11 miles), Dismal Falls Retreat (14 miles), Wolf Creek Indian village and Museum (5.3 miles), Big Walker Lookout (10.6 miles), Dollar General (2.1 miles), Grants supermarket (1.8 miles), and some of the best sandwiches, cheeses, furniture, and Amish hospitality around,  Walkers Valley Market(16 miles).

24 hours before your arrival I will provide you a Key Code for the Lock Box.

additionalHouseRules:
Please do not block the road, If you need additional parking beyond your provided space, park at the bottom of the hill out of the path of the roadway!  This road is also a one-way in and one-way out, as you enter stay to the right, the road loops  around and will bring you back out.


Guests have access to immediate area surrounding the cabins only, please do not venture into the wooded area. Do not cross any fences or enter through any gate, all of these areas are private property not owned by the host. Thank you for respecting these rules. 

Do not mess with the propane heaters, as propane can cause carbon monoxide poisoning. Please do not mess with any adjustments other than adjusting the temperature if needed.

name: Foxtail Orchards - "The Fox Den"
photos/16/caption: A sunset you will never forget! Romantic Getaway!
primaryHost/about: Rental Cabins in the heart of the Appalachian Mountains, located along the historic Rt.16 Back of the Dragon, Tazewell County,VA. Paved road access!
sectionedDescription/access: Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.
sectionedDescription/description:
Our cabin is on Route 16 otherwise known as the Back of The Dragon, near Hungry Mother's State Park, a winery and some great family owned dining. You’ll love our cabin because of the quiet serene  setting, the view, and the ability to completely relax. It located near many outdoor activities such as hiking and fishing.

Firewood by the can be purchased upon request, $25.00 per 1/2 tractor bucket or $50.00 for full bucket. Wood will be delivered to cabin.

This cabin rental comes with your own private picnic area, fire pit, mini bar and charcoal grill, microwave, mini fridge, and hot plate.

There is also a second and a third rental just above this rental available on Airbnb as well, "The Fox Den" and "Hangar 22" is also rented thru Foxtail Orchards, Inc.

Renters have immediate access to the property surrounding their rental.

We are available 24/7 if our guests need assistance. We tend to leave our guests alone unless they need or request us.

Enjoy the sounds and setting of living in the country.

Limited to no cell service depending on service carrier. Verizon customers do have some signal. Any other provider, no service. No WiFi.

This property is surrounded by wildlife, there is no hunting allowed to grow our population in whitetail deer, wild turkeys and the occasional black bear.

ATTENTION MOTORCYCLE RIDERS!!!!!! --- The access road to our cabins and cabin driveways are paved, we still recommend you park at the bottom. If you do decide to take your bike up to the cabin, you do so at your own risk!!!! Thank you and God Bless.

Please do not block any of the paved road with vehicles, trailers or motorcycles. 

All guests are required to sign a liability waiver upon arrival, releasing Foxtail Orchards or and owner of any liability during the rented time. Any persons not guests that is on the property will be deemed as trespassing. Any guests of the said renters on the property are doing so at their own discretion and are the responsibility of the said renter.

The Fox Den is named and themed (decor) after Virginia State Trooper Andrew D. Fox.  Andrew was a native to Tazewell County and a graduate from Tazewell High School.  The cabin was built and decorated in conjunction with his family.  This is only meant to remind visitors to not forget the sacrifice our first responders make keeping us safe, and also teaches you history of Tazewell County, VA.

primaryHost/about: We provide rentals in the historic district of Abingdon, so that guests can feel apart of our wonderful community. We enjoy traveling to other destinations and staying in similar properties. We hope that you will find our lovingly restored properties a joy!
sectionedDescription/access: Consists of an acre yard with beautiful old trees and a creek running through back.  Fire pits by creek .
sectionedDescription/description:
The Brook House is a charming three bedroom house, sleeping up to 8 including children.  We are located in a perfect location for exploring the historic district of Abingdon as well as the surrounding area. Perfect rental for family and friend get-always, retreats and business stays.  2 night min stay. Discounted weekly, monthly rates.  Please note that Airbnb does collect both our local and our state taxes.

The Brook is located In the heart of Abingdon’s oldest residential street. Hop on the sidewalk and you can be anywhere in town easily. The house was built in the early 1900s and is English cottage style.  The property is lovingly furnished  with comfortable furniture, antiques and lovely accessories.  The outside space consists  of an acre yard with beautiful old trees and a creek running through the back yard  with fire pit area.  A wonderful back porch with dining area overlooks the beautiful yard.   If you’re lucky you may see deer coming to drink every evening or a mama duck and her 12 babies floating by.

Note:  The Creekside Hatch is a two bedroom apartment that is also located on the property and shares the parking area.  The Creekside is available to rent jointly with The Brook House for larger groups. The combination rental  will sleep up to 12.Please inquire about this if you were interested in a larger property.

Consists of an acre yard with beautiful old trees and a creek running through back.  Fire pits by creek .

We are available to help with any trip plans and suggestions on dining, shopping and  special events!

The BrookHouse is located on Abingdon’s oldest residential street in the historic area of town. It is a great location for accessing our local brewery, wonderful dining and shopping as well as close to the Creeper Trail and Barter Theatre.

We have a good sidewalk system in front of the house as well as bike paths. We can share a back quick way to get to the creeper trail.

The property sits on an acre lot with the Olde Town Creek running through the backyard. Fire pit area is available as well as a wonderful back porch overlooking the creek.

name: Country Cottage
sectionedDescription/description:
Country Cottage is located in scenic Southwest Virginia, it's a very private property with direct access to the Spearhead Trails Coal Canyon Trail! This cabin is quiet and perfect for nature lovers and riders with quick access to shopping and local restaurants. Sit on the porch and cookout with the outdoor grill and picnic table on property. This property offers privacy and security for your family as well as your vehicles & UTV's. Not only is it perfect for UTV enthusiasts but families as well!

We typically let guests do self check in, sometimes my husband does like to meet the guests if he’s available when they arrive. We are here should any issues occur.

The cabin is close to the town but still secluded, a 24 hour gas station and restaurants are very close by.

The driveway is steep, any guest with a trailer will need a 4 wheel drive. Any large trailer will need to park on the flat right below the driveway. A 4wd is typically preferred but many cars have made it with no trouble. During the winter months of snow/ice should be present, access to the cabin could be difficult but parking and walking up is an option that others have done. We just like to make guests aware before arrival so they use their judgement.

additionalHouseRules:
HOUSE RULES & OCCUPANCY:
The rental is not intended for parties, nor gatherings at any time. Absolutely NO Parties are to be held on the property. The property is meant for nice quiet getaways, it is NOT set up for parties. If there is excessive noise or music, any illegal activity, or evidence of violation of these policies, you may be asked to vacate the premise without any refund and additional charges may be assessed. 
NO Smoking:  Smoking is NOT permitted in our property. Smoking is allowed outside as long as butts and ashes are not left behind. Discard the butts and ashes in the outside garbage or fire pit. Do not throw butts on the ground or bring them into the home. If there is tobacco smell in the home after your departure, you may be required to pay an additional $250 charge for deep cleaning.
Damage Charges:
Any damages, outside of what is deemed as normal wear and tear, are the responsibility of the guest.  Charges for repairs are non-negotiable. 

Pets: We are dog friendly; dogs are allowed upon approval. A non-refundable pet fee of $39 per pet will be charged prior to arrival. You are responsible for walking and cleaning up after your pet. All waste must be picked up and placed in the garbage cans tied securely in trash bags. Pets may not be left unattended in the home unless kenneled. We ask that you do not allow your pets on the furniture or bedding, and that you clean up any pet hair before you depart. Any signs of pet debris inside or outside rental may be required to pay an additional $250 for deep cleaning.

name: The Litz Mansion Room #8 - The Colonel May Room
sectionedDescription/description:
This beautiful historic mansion was constructed in 1859 by John Warfield Johnston, a Virginia Senator, and Judge of Tazewell County. The home is situated on a 3.16-acre lot and is conveniently located within walking distance of the Tazewell Main Street area. The Johnston family was very well known in Virginia for their achievements and built the home to display these accomplishments. 

John, his wife Nicketti and son George lived in the home until it was purchased by John C. Hopkins and wife E

Room #8 - The Colonel May Room (Shared Bathroom)

The Colonel May room is dedicated to the youngest son of Andrew Jackson and Nelle May. Andrew named his son “Colonel” in hopes to pass along some of the luster and reputation of his own name. This room is fit for a Colonel and styled for one too. With all the furnishings being dark, rich mahogany, and walnut. A favorite talking piece of this room is the beautiful stone capped foot boards. And of course, the guests who stay in this room are in love with the upper porch located just a few steps outside the room door, perfect for enjoying and relaxing.

primaryHost/about: We provide rentals in the historic district of Abingdon, so that guests can feel apart of our wonderful community. We enjoy traveling to other destinations and staying in similar properties. We hope that you will find our lovingly restored properties a joy!
sectionedDescription/access: You will enjoy your own private vacation rental on 2 beautiful secluded acres.    Perfect for couples, friend reunions, families!  Writers, artists and those, who want space to breath yet access to outdoor activities and cultural venues.  Enjoy viewing all the wildlife activity in the Meadow.  Our new garden “room with a view” offers a quiet retreat in the middle of the Meadow!   Take a nap in the hammock under the stars or play a game of badminton in the field!
sectionedDescription/description:
A bit of peace & quiet in historic district of town.  This charming three bedroom property  located on a lovely 2 acre Meadow is completely furnished with all you need for a perfect stay.  Outdoor  space w/ firepit/dining area. Perfect location for exploring town. Complimentary pastries/ juice on first morning  w/ coffee/tea selection.  Close to Virginia Creeper Trail, Barter, dining and shopping Max 5 guests

Three bedrooms..1 queen, 2 doubles. One full bath..  Fully equipped eat-in kitchen, living room, laundry room, 2 nice porches, firepit area with outside dining and gathering space.  Privacy, quiet and great location for walking or biking in historic district.  2 acres of privacy in the middle of town.  Lovingly furnished with comfortable furniture, antiques, hand painted touches, local artwork.

You will enjoy your own private vacation rental on 2 beautiful secluded acres.    Perfect for couples, friend reunions, families!  Writers, artists and those, who want space to breath yet access to outdoor activities and cultural venues.  Enjoy viewing all the wildlife activity in the Meadow.  Our new garden “room with a view” offers a quiet retreat in the middle of the Meadow!   Take a nap in the hammock under the stars or play a game of badminton in the field!

We will be glad to help as you plan your trip and give suggestions about dining shopping and cultural experiences.

This 2acre property is in historic area of town...many shops, restaurants and close to Creeper Trail and Barter Theatre.  Walking distance to local brewery.  Beautiful setting!  You'll think you're in the country!

Walk, bike, drive

We do provide complimentary pastries and juice for first morning and supply you with coffee and tea for your stay.  The recreation center is just around the corner and offers indoor and outdoor pools, walking trails, tennis courts, fabulous playground, as well as the fitness center and indoor walking track.  Yoga and other fitness classes are available at the center.

With the breathtaking mountain views, fast wifi, and all the necessary amenities you will surely love your stay.

sectionedDescription/access: The entire island is there for you to explore!
sectionedDescription/description:
A private island or a sandy beach? The cabin on Coney Island, a Guest House property, offers you both!!

The Cabin on Coney Island is one of the properties of The Guest House Inn on Courthouse Square. The cabin offers all amenities on the seclusion of an island.  When you really want to get away from it all, visit the cabin on Coney Island. The island is located at the confluence of the New and Greenbrier Rivers and accessible by watercraft only.

The entire island is there for you to explore!

We are available to help throughout the stay but will not be in person on the island.

A one time bustling railroad community is now a charming downtown with brick lined streets, eclectic shops, and old architecture all nestled along the banks of the New and Greenbrier rivers.  
The confluence of the Bluestone, New, and Greenbrier rivers form the southern West Virginia gateway of the mighty New River in  Summers County.  Outdoor recreational adventure abounds in and around Hinton.  Summers County is one of only a few counties in West Virginia that offers kayakers, floaters, and fisherman 16 public access sites along the banks of the Greenbrier and the New.  
With the combination of natural beauty and historic charm, Hinton is the hidden jewel of Summers County.

This is a true island!  The Cabin on Coney Island is located at the confluence of the Greenbrier and New Rivers. A watercraft is the only way to access the island. Don't have a boat? A local outfitter company, Cantrell's Ultimate Rafting can provide a quick trip to Coney Island.
There are logistics involved with getting to and from the island.  The logistics will differ depending upon if you have your own kayaks or if you are using Cantrell's.  
If you are interested in staying at the island and leaving daily, it can be challenging.  Cantrell's charges a fee each way for shuttle service and may not be available at the times needed.  If customers want to explore the area and do not have their own watercraft and shuttles necessary, we encourage you to consider our other properties in the Hinton Historic District.

The island is a true island at the confluence of the New River and Greenbrier River.  We only have a well-system for water at the cabin.  While the water is safe to drink and shower in, it does have a sulfur smell.  We do provide drinking water for guests.  
A stay on the island is a rustic adventure.  
We clean, sanitize, landscape, clean the beach, weed-eat the path, knock down cobwebs, cut firewood, etc between every guest.  There are things outside of our control such as mosquitos and occasional debris that comes from raising and lowering water levels.  
We do our best to make sure you have an amazing stay !!
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Smoking inside the Cabin will result in a $250 charge for cleaning. 
A $295.00 reservation fee plus applicable sales tax is required to secure lodging.  This is a non-refundable reservation deposit. We reserve the right to cancel any reservation to the Cabin on Coney Island due to weather conditions.
A no-show will be charged for the entire reserved stay.  
You must have your own transportation on and off the island via boat, kayak or canoe. We partner with a local company to help secure transportation to and from the island at an additional cost.
sectionedDescription/interaction: We are available to help throughout the stay but will not be in person on the island.

primaryHost/about: Husband, Dad, Papaw, Pastor, Hunter, Fisherman, Biker, Outdoorsman.  Have lived in the Mountains of WV most of my life.  Been riding and hunting here for 50 years.  This is our twenty three acre family homestead since 1972.  Come enjoy the peace and serenity of Almost Heaven WV.

sectionedDescription/access: No access to attached garage.
sectionedDescription/description:
Quiet, peaceful Horse Farm in the Mountains of West Virginia.

Plenty of open space. Enjoy the mountain air. Close to the new Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail.  Unload and you won’t have to haul your ATV/UTV again until you head home.  Many outlaw trails nearby. Right off Rt16.  

If you like riding curves on  motorcycles or sports cars we’re only 30 minutes from Back of the Dragon Visitors Center. 15 minutes to Berwind Lake. A great place to get away from it all!!

No access to attached garage.

Available for questions by phone text or email.

304-320-3627
Twboyd59@gmail.com

Close access to Hatfield McCoy trail.  Right off Rt 16. Enjoy Berwind Lake nearby.  Rural mountain valley setting.  Quiet peaceful place to unwind, relax, and get back to nature.

Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail is accessible within two miles of the property.  Once you unload you won’t need to haul again until you head home.  If you like curves and ride motorcycles Rt 16 is at the end of the driveway with Back of the dragon only 30 minutes away.

The garage is not included in rental. No smoking or pets allowed. Please remove shoes when inside.  Hi speed WiFi access.  Roku Streaming available.  Please leave money for any purchases.

There is absolutely no illegal drug use allowed of any sort.  If you are caught you will be asked to leave and the police will be called.  Sorry I even have to mention this but it’s the world we live in. One bad apple……….

additionalHouseRules:
All reservations are considered confirmed at the time of booking. Please note that the  terms of this Rental Agreement are non-negotiable. This Rental Agreement MUST be agreed upon at time of booking. 
 1. RENTAL. The rental rate for the Rental Property is based on a party of four (4) persons. Guest acknowledges that additional persons are permitted provided the number of persons does not exceed the maximum occupancy for the Rental Property. Guest further understands that for each additional person, a fee of $10.00 shall be added to the nightly rental rate provided each additional guest is registered prior to check-in as set forth herein. 

2. CHECK-IN/CHECK-OUT TIMES. Guest may check-in at any time after 3:00 p.m. on Guest's Arrival Date, and the Guest shall check-out no later than 10:00 a.m. on the Guest's Departure Date. A minimum fee of $25.00 per hour may be charged to the renter’s card for checkout after 10:00 AM unless previous arrangements have been made through this office.

3. REFUNDS. Guest hereby agrees and acknowledges that Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest departs before the end of the Reservation or in the event Guest arrives late or does not arrive for the Reservation. Guest further hereby agrees and acknowledges that there will be no refund nor relocation in the event Guest is disappointed with the Rental Property. Furthermore, there shall be no refund or compensation for the occurrence of any and all events out of the control of DAISY'S CABINS, including but not limited to, weather conditions, power outages, water outages, mechanical failure of appliances and electronics, and/or central heat and air. Furthermore, Guest shall not be entitled to a refund in the event Guest is required to vacate the Rental Property due to a violation of local, state or federal law or the policies of DAISY'S CABINS. Refunds will only be issued at the discretion of DAISY'S CABINS.

4. DAMAGES. Guest shall be solely responsible for any property damage, accident or injury to any person or loss sustained by any person, including loss of money, jewelry and other items of personal property, arising out of or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided by DAISY'S CABINS and/or the owner of the Rental Property. Guest shall inspect and be familiar with proper use and application of such items prior to using them. Guest hereby agrees to indemnify and hold DAISY'S CABINS and/or the owner of the Rental Property harmless from any and all claims including those of third parties, arising out of, or in any way related to Guest's use of the Rental Property or the items of personal property provided therein. 

5. AGENCY DISCLOSURE.  DAISY'S CABINS serves as the agent of the owner of the Rental Property. DAISY'S CABINS shall represent and act at all times in the best interests of the owner of the Rental Property. Furthermore, DAISY'S CABINS reserves the right for random inspections to insure that all policies and procedures are followed. All information provided by DAISY'S CABINS regarding the Rental Property has been provided by the owner of the Rental Property and is believed to be accurate, but cannot be guaranteed. Guest acknowledges that the owner of the Rental Property may remove the Rental Property from the rental program with DAISY'S CABINS. Guest further understands that availability of the Rental Property cannot be guaranteed, and DAISY'S CABINS may find it necessary to move Guest to a comparable rental property.

6. VISITORS. A Visitor of the Guest(s) may occupy the property on a temporary basis only. Visitors may not occupy the property beyond 10:00 pm or stay overnight without being registered with DAISY'S CABINS. Each rental property has a maximum occupancy and at NO time should said property be occupied by more than allowed number of guest stated. No house parties, weddings or other events are allowed. Should evidence of misuse or violation of occupancy be discovered at any time, the Guest(s) of record will be charged accordingly or immediately evicted without refund. 
 
7. USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY. Guest shall occupy and use the Rental Property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the Rental Property. The use of fireworks is strictly prohibited, and any violators of this provision shall be asked to vacate the Rental Property immediately.  Camp fires are permitted only in the designated fire pit and may only be used after 4 pm.  Camp fire must be attended at all times.

8. PETS.  Pets are NOT allowed in the rental property.  If evidence of a pet is found in the rental property, such as, but not limited to, feces/urine or fleas, a minimum of $50, together with the costs and expenses of additional cleaning services necessary to remove odors and/or stains shall be charged to the renter’s card. 

9. TELEVISIONS. A television equipped with Roku has been provided at DAISY'S CABINS.  There will be no option of ordering pay- per-view movies and/or events. In the event Guest orders a pay-per-view movie and/or event, Guest shall be assessed for the cost of the movie(s) and/or event(s), together with a service charge of $10.00. Satellite signal and reception and cable reception is not always reliable, especially during extreme weather, and cannot be guaranteed. 

10. INTERNET. Internet service is provided at all rental properties; however, the speed of the service is not guaranteed. The password for said service will be given to you at time of check-in or by calling the office. Please note that all internet services are not secured. Should guest be found illegally using, downloading, copying, and/or distributing copyrighted material over the network then guest shall be subject to any and all actions imposed by service provider for copyright infringement cost. 

11. FURNITURE. Please do not move any of the cabin furniture (including outdoor furniture) as this may scratch the floor causing damages. If the furniture or floors are damaged during your stay you will be held responsible and charged accordingly. 

12. HEATING AND AIR.  DAISY'S CABINS contains electric heat which is controlled by a thermostat in the winter months.  Central air and /or window unit air conditioners will be provided in the property during the summer months.

13. LOST AND FOUND. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall not be responsible for any personal belongings that are lost, stolen, or left behind by Guest or any member of Guest's party. Any personal items found in or around the Rental Property shall be held for thirty (30) days. After the thirty (30) days, any unclaimed items will be discarded or donated unless the owner of the item contacts DAISY'S CABINS and claims the item. The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. DAISY'S CABINS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that DAISY'S CABINS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, DAISY'S CABINS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact DAISY'S CABINS immediately. DAISY'S CABINS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or DAISY'S CABINS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to DAISY'S CABINS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, DAISY'S CABINS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up every other day of Guest's stay by an employee of DAISY'S CABINS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the DAISY'S CABINS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the DAISY'S CABINS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of DAISY'S CABINS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.

rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests will have the entire house to themselves.
sectionedDescription/description:
Hoot Owl Hideaway is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  You will be able to access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail at the end of the driveway!  It's the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.  A newly stocked catfish pond is also located on the property, so don’t forget your fishing poles!

Hoot Owl Hideaway offers 2 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  You will enjoy your own space with plenty of parking for your ATV trailers.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, utensils, and both coffee maker and Keurig.  Bed linens and dish towels are provided, but please bring your own bath towels.

Guests will have the entire house to themselves.

Hoot Owl Hideaway is 1/2 mile from the Grundy town limits, where various restaurants, a gas station, Walmart, and movie theatre are all located.  Additionally, it is a short drive to Elkhorn City, KY, where the Pine Mountain trails are accessible.

You will be able to leave Hoot Owl Hideaway's driveway and access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail.  You also have the convenience of ATV access to the Grundy town center(about a 5 minute ride), where various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located.  Hoot Owl Hideaway is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  Kayak tours are available in the local area through Levisa Adventures.  Additionally, river tubing is available on the Russell Fork River in the town of Elkhorn City, KY.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.

Visitors may not occupy the property beyond 10:00 pm or stay overnight without being registered with DAISY'S CABINS. Each rental property has a maximum occupancy and at NO time should said property be occupied by more than allowed number of guest stated. No house parties, weddings or other events are allowed. Should evidence of misuse or violation of occupancy be discovered at any time, the Guest(s) of record will be charged accordingly or immediately evicted without refund. 
 
7. USE OF RENTAL PROPERTY. Guest shall occupy and use the Rental Property in a manner that shall not disturb or offend neighbors of the Rental Property. The use of fireworks is strictly prohibited, and any violators of this provision shall be asked to vacate the Rental Property immediately.  Camp fires are permitted only in the designated fire pit and may only be used after 4 pm.  Camp fire must be attended at all times.

8. PETS.  Pets are NOT allowed in the rental property.  If evidence of a pet is found in the rental property, such as, but not limited to, feces/urine or fleas, a minimum of $50, together with the costs and expenses of additional cleaning services necessary to remove odors and/or stains shall be charged to the renter’s card. 

9. TELEVISIONS. A television equipped with Roku has been provided at DAISY'S CABINS.  There will be no option of ordering pay- per-view movies and/or events. In the event Guest orders a pay-per-view movie and/or event, Guest shall be assessed for the cost of the movie(s) and/or event(s), together with a service charge of $10.00. Satellite signal and reception and cable reception is not always reliable, especially during extreme weather, and cannot be guaranteed. 

10. INTERNET. Internet service is provided at all rental properties; however, the speed of the service is not guaranteed. The password for said service will be given to you at time of check-in or by calling the office. Please note that all internet services are not secured. Should guest be found illegally using, downloading, copying, and/or distributing copyrighted material over the network then guest shall be subject to any and all actions imposed by service provider for copyright infringement cost. 

11. FURNITURE. Please do not move any of the cabin furniture (including outdoor furniture) as this may scratch the floor causing damages. If the furniture or floors are damaged during your stay you will be held responsible and charged accordingly. 

12. HEATING AND AIR.  DAISY'S CABINS contains electric heat which is controlled by a thermostat in the winter months.  Central air and /or window unit air conditioners will be provided in the property during the summer months.

13. LOST AND FOUND. KNOTTY POPLAR CABIN RENTALS shall not be responsible for any personal belongings that are lost, stolen, or left behind by Guest or any member of Guest's party. Any personal items found in or around the Rental Property shall be held for thirty (30) days. After the thirty (30) days, any unclaimed items will be discarded or donated unless the owner of the item contacts DAISY'S CABINS and claims the item. The item will be returned to said individual at his/her expense. DAISY'S CABINS will not be responsible for any lost items or damage to the items during shipping.

14. REPAIRS. Guest hereby agrees that DAISY'S CABINS or its agents may enter the Rental Property for the purpose of making necessary repairs and/or maintenance in and around the Rental Property. Furthermore, DAISY'S CABINS does not guarantee against mechanical failures that may occur in the heating, air conditioning, television, satellite receivers, cable box, or any other appliances. In the event an appliance or system is inoperative, Guest shall contact DAISY'S CABINS immediately. DAISY'S CABINS shall make every effort to have the repairs done quickly and efficiently, or DAISY'S CABINS shall move Guest to a different rental property, if possible. Guest(s) who have an after-hours emergency at the number which will be provided to you. All non-emergency issues should be reported to DAISY'S CABINS, at the number which will be provided you, during regular business hours. For any medical related emergency, call 911.

15. AGE REQUIREMENT. Guest is at least eighteen (18) years of age and acknowledges that he/she may be asked to provide proof of age at the time the Reservation is made. Guest is responsible for all other guests and visitors of the Rental Property during the Reservation. If Guest is not eighteen (18) years or older, DAISY'S CABINS reserves the right to terminate the Reservation without a refund. 

16. GARBAGE REMOVAL. All garbage must be bagged and removed from inside of the Rental Property. Bagged garbage may be placed in the outside garbage cans and will be picked up every other day of Guest's stay by an employee of DAISY'S CABINS.  Guest acknowledges that leaving garbage outside the designated container(s) may attract unwanted animals. 

17. SMOKING/NON-SMOKING. All properties are non-smoking. Smoking outside is allowed unless otherwise stated. Please be neat in disposing of cigarette butts, do not discard them around the property, driveway or yard. In the event smoking occurs inside the cabin, you shall be assessed a minimum charge of $250.00. 

18. CRITTERS & WILDLIFE. Please remember you are in the mountains. Each unit is professionally treated for pest control on a regular basis. Occasionally a few critters could make their way inside. In these rare instances, no refund will be given. In such a case, notify the office and we will make every effort to solve the problem in a timely manner. Please do your part by keeping windows and doors closed and all food and trash inside or in the appropriate outside receptacles.

19. ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF RISKS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges that there are certain risks of physical injury, property damage, and inherent potential dangers of the activities conducted within (or upon) the DAISY'S CABINS. The undersigned Guest further understands and acknowledges the risks and dangers associated with his/her use of the DAISY'S CABINS premises, facilities, and equipment, and that such use has inherent dangers of personal injury and property damage. The undersigned Guest further accepts sole responsibility for risks and dangers which include, without limitation, the potential for serious bodily injury, permanent disability, paralysis and loss of life, disfigurement, loss of or damage to equipment/property, exposure to extreme conditions, harmful physical conflicts with other guests, animal attack, snake bites, insect bites/stings, allergic reactions, lightning strikes, dangers arising from adverse weather conditions, falling, fires and burns, dangerous road or trail conditions, water hazards, land hazards, equipment failure, defective equipment, inadequate safety measures, criminal activity of other guests, poor lighting, and other undefined not readily foreseeable and presently unknown risks and dangers (“Risks”). Guest expressly assumes the Risks of any and all damage and injury of any kind or type which may result from any source whatsoever during his/her time on the premises of DAISY'S CABINS.

By booking this property, Guest is acknowledging that he/she has read, fully understands, and agrees to all the above.
sectionedDescription/name: Hoot Owl Hideaway ~ Direct Spearhead trail access!
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Hoot Owl Hideaway is 1/2 mile from the Grundy town limits, where various restaurants, a gas station, Walmart, and movie theatre are all located.  Additionally, it is a short drive to Elkhorn City, KY, where the Pine Mountain trails are accessible.
sectionedDescription/notes: You will be able to leave Hoot Owl Hideaway's driveway and access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail.  You also have the convenience of ATV access to the Grundy town center(about a 5 minute ride), where various restaurants, a gas station, and Wal-Mart are located.  Hoot Owl Hideaway is also a short drive from Breaks Interstate Park, Haysi, VA, and Elkhorn City, KY.   The Breaks Interstate Park offers various walking/bike trails, a water park, horseback riding, and zip lining.  Kayak tours are available in the local area through Levisa Adventures.  Additionally, river tubing is available on the Russell Fork River in the town of Elkhorn City, KY.  Time-Out Pizza/arcade offers tube rentals and a shuttle service for this activity.  Haysi and Elkhorn City offer 16 miles of whitewater rafting ranging from Class II to Class V rapids.
sectionedDescription/space: Hoot Owl Hideaway offers 2 bedrooms and 1 bath and has all the essentials for your stay. WIFI is available and the TV is equipped with ROKU.  You will enjoy your own space with plenty of parking for your ATV trailers.  The kitchen is fully equipped with a stove, refrigerator, cook ware, utensils, and both coffee maker and Keurig.  Bed linens and dish towels are provided, but please bring your own bath towels.
sectionedDescription/summary: Hoot Owl Hideaway is situated in scenic Southwest Virginia. It is ideal for ATV enthusiasts looking for a nightly or weekly cabin rental.  You will be able to access Spearhead's Coal Canyon trail at the end of the driveway!  It's the perfect place to return after an adventure filled day of trail-riding.  A newly stocked catfish pond is also located on the property, so don’t forget your fishing poles!

sectionedDescription/description: Beautiful 2 bedroom, 2 bath log cabin located in a beautiful wooded setting just south of Beckley, WV.  Includes private hot tub, fireplace, fully equipped kitchen, washer/dryer, cable TV, Wifi, linens provided, charcoal grill and much more.  The cabin is located within 30 minutes or less from some of southern West Virginia's most popular skiing, white water rafting, golfing, ATV riding, and zip lining destinations.

name: Old Rich Valley Cabin
photos/5/caption: Look at the stars while sitting in a spa.  Nothing more relaxing.
photos/9/caption: Full kitchen.  Stove, microwave, dishwasher, pots/pans, crockpot, toaster, blender...
photos/15/caption: Enjoy the sunrise on the porch.
photos/17/caption: Camping chairs can be taken out to use at the fire pit.
photos/18/caption: View from the top of the mountain if you drive in on Hwy 16.
photos/19/caption: Photo taken by one of our guests.
photos/20/caption: The farmer (Will) working near the cabin one beautiful fall evening.

primaryHost/about: Will and Amy. Faith, Family, Farming.
sectionedDescription/access: You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.
sectionedDescription/description:
You will relax and reconnect in this beautiful valley nestled in the Southwest Virginia mountains. Sit on the porch and soak up those mountain views. Relax in the hot tub and count the stars. Reconnect with your spouse as you unplug from the hustle and bustle. Rest, laugh, enjoy! 

The cabin is located on a working family farm. You can purchase beef, pork, and chicken to cook while you’re here or bring a cooler and take some home.

Take a break from life. Get away. Come relax in solitude or with your spouse. Reconnect with nature. Breathe in that fresh air. Observe wildlife and get a taste of life on the farm.

The cabin completely private, but if you’d like to visit with family or friends there is another cabin located on the farm too. Check out our other listing for Valley View Cabin. You cannot see the other cabin, but it is located a couple hundred yards away.

You will have the entire cabin to yourself. You can go for a walk, enjoy the hot tub, grill out, roast marshmallows over the fire pit, or just rock on the front porch and take it easy.

We are available by phone (call or text) if you need anything.  We can offer suggestions of things to do while here (folder of information in the cabin). If we’re around we’d be happy to show you around the farm.

We are about a mile off of Hwy 16 (Back of the Dragon). About 10 miles from Hungry Mother State Park (hiking, fishing, beach swimming area...). We’re 25 minutes from Marion where there is an adorable Main Street with shops and eateries.  We are about 45 minutes from Abingdon (Barter Theatre, antique shopping, dining, winery...).

We are not near any public transportation.

We are about 25 minutes away from town. So, you may want to plan to stop at the grocery store on your way in. There are plenty of great restaurants in Marion. (We have a list of restaurants and activities to do while here.) FYI: Many of the Marion shops/restaurants are CLOSED on Mondays!

On our farm we raise and sell pastured beef, chicken, and pork. If you plan to cook while you are here let us know and you can order some homegrown meat ahead of time and we will have it waiting in your fridge. (Sausage or bacon for breakfast, steaks, hamburger, chicken breast, pork chops...) Bring a cooler so you can take some beef, chicken, and pork back home with you. You can see what's available and order directly through our website www.oldrichvalleyfarm dot com.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Hot tubs are very expensive.  We ask that you read and follow all rules of the hot tub (listed in the cabin) to make sure it doesn’t get damaged.  

This is a working farm. We ask that you are very careful around the animals and stay off of all farm equipment.
