additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

name: Coaldale Condo
photos/4/caption: Large patio firepit, grill, tables chairs.
primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.

This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.
sectionedDescription/interaction: When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.
sectionedDescription/notes: Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/space:
This main floor unit features 2 bedroom, 1 full bath with a  kitchen. It sleeps 4, with 4 twin XL beds and up to 5 with a pull out sofa bed and is fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker and crock pot, hotplate, full size fridge, microwave, basically everything you need. There is plenty of room to park your vehicles and unhook your trailers to be ready to go out on the town after a full day of trail riding. Rent the lock-out unit Miners Den, for larger groups to add 6 more beds and 1 more bath.

Fire pit, grill, picnic table, security cameras and Trailside accommodations right on the Pocahontas trailhead. Ride all four Hatfield McCoy southern trails and Virginia Spearhead trails too all from FWH ! Over 500 Miles of OFF Road Heaven! We offer Trail permits, Trail GPS tablets, T-shirts, firewood and Guide services for applicable Fees.
sectionedDescription/summary: This 2br 1ba unit is located directly across from the Hatfield McCoys Pocahontas Trailhead/Visitor Center at Coaldale WV and offers Direct Trail side access. Ground floor entrance, plenty of parking, great for couples, small groups and Families.
sectionedDescription/transit: Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

name: Opulence ATV Lodge!
sectionedDescription/description: Located at 2264 Cherokee Road, the heart of ATV. Cherokee Road leads to 3 major trails. Indian Ridge Trail head is located approximately 3 minutes from location. Pinnacle Trail connector is located approximately 2 minutes from location. Pocahontas Trail Connecter is located approximately 15 minutes from location.  Outlaw Trails and Stair Steps are approximately 5 minutes from location. 2 mile from Ashland Resort. Enjoy some relaxation by the creek known for trout, fire pit and picnic tables.

name: Papa's Den Cabin -Hatfield & McCoy Trails
sectionedDescription/access: The entire cabin.
sectionedDescription/description:
Trail Bandits Cabins and Cottages are non-smoking, sleeps up to 4 people and provides all the comforts of home. We are located near the Hatfield & McCoy trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. Cottages and cabins include Heat / AC mini splits, Free Wi-Fi, mini kitchen, Keurig coffee maker, refrigerator, three-quarter bath, 32” TV with Netflix/Directv, fresh linens, bath towels & housekeeping service. Outdoor fire pit and charcoal grill sit along Tug River. Privacy fence on premises.

Welcome to your home away from home! We’re committed to your comfort and adventure.

We are located with access to the Hatfield & McCoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails in the Beautiful mountains of West Virginia. You can ride your ATV/SXS directly to the trails from our cabins! 

Our small to mid-size cottages and cabins sleep up to 4 people are efficiency style units with a loft, full size bed and three-quarter bath w/ shower, sink, toilet and towel rack. Heat / AC Mini Split units, Free Wi-Fi, mini kitchen with Keurig coffee-maker, microwave and refrigerator and 32″ Smart TV with Netflix. Charcoal grill, picnic table and firepit outside.

All fresh linens, complimentary soaps, shampoo, conditioner and lotion, bath towels and wash cloths, grilling utensils, toilet paper, paper towels, firewood for the firepit are all included at no additional cost. Our cabins and cottages can be rented as a group, family or vacation getaway

There is also a second cabin “Bear Cabin -Hatfield & McCoy Trails" and a third rental available,  "The Cave- 2 Bedroom Cabin- Hatfield McCoy” on Airbnb as well that sleeps up to 6 people. These cabins are located on the same property like a mini resort. There is plenty of parking for trailers and ATVs / SXS and easy access to Hatfield and McCoy Indian Ridge, Pinnacle Creek, Pocahontas and Warrior Trails.

The entire cabin.

Drive directly to the Hatifield and McCoy trailheads on your SXS. 
Large Parking lot at the cabins.

We pride ourselves on your fun and crazy adventure while staying at Trail Bandits Cabins. Please help us keep it just as fun for our community and our fellow campers. Please read over our rental terms and conditions.

As always, remember to UNLEASH YOUR ADVENTURE!

Our Policy

Cabin rental incidental deposits are non-refundable if your reservation is cancelled with less than 30 days remaining before your arrival date.  Deposits for holiday/holiday weekends are not refundable under any conditions if cancelled.

Reschedule requests will be only be accepted if there are 30 days or longer remaining before your scheduled arrival date.  These requests are subject to availability. * Inclement weather cancellations will not be accepted.

Failure to adhere to your reservation with no communication will forfeit your deposit and you will be charged the remaining balance of your stay.

Cabin Terms and Conditions

Check-in time is 3pm on your arrival date, and check out time is 11am on your departure date. 

Guests will be charged a one time $50 cleaning fee at the time of reservation.

Cabins are non-smoking.  Guests will be charged a one time $250 cleaning fee if smoking is detected inside the cabins and you will forfeit your deposit.

The maximum capacity per standard cabin is 3 adults.  The maximum capacity for our larger cabin is 4 adults.   Violators will be evicted, and no refund will be issued.  Small children will be exempt from this rule. 

Playing on loft ladders is prohibited. Face the ladder when going up or down. Do not carry objects in your hands while on the ladder.

Park ONLY in the designated parking areas which is in front of your cabin or across the road in the grass area.  

Alcohol is permitted.  Disorderly conduct is not allowed.

*No atv or any off road vehicles are allowed in any of the rivers.

Please honor the posted speed limit in our atv community.  

The reserving guests will be responsible for any damages to your cabin or premises. 

Please do not place, burn or leave trash in your fire pit. Outside charcoal grills need to be cleaned prior to the departure of your stay.

We ask that all guest respect your fellow campers and community. 

Quiet the noise after 10:00pm for respect of the community and other campers.

No excessive riding in the cabin areas or driveways.   No driving or parking your ATV on the grass where the charcoal grills and picnic tables are located.

There are outdoor surveillance cameras around the campground for the protection of your items.

Ready to Reserve!

You must reserve with an incidental deposit of $250. Incidental deposits are refundable upon checkout as long as there are no damages or additional charges made. If additional charges or damages occur during your stay, you will receive the incidental deposit back less the cost of damages or additional charges. Cabins cannot be reserved and will not be held without a deposit.

All rentals require a 2-night minimum.

Pet Friendly – We love Pets!

Trail Bandits Cabins offers pet friendly cabins. 

Pets that are non-aggressive are allowed with a $50 per pet surcharge per night.  No more than 1 pet is allowed per cabin unless approved by host to have more.

All pets must be registered at check-in. If not registered and found on the premises, you will be evicted and deposit forfeited.

Excessive barking that is a disturbance to other campers will not be allowed.  

**Pets must be crated if left alone.

Pets should be on a leash at all times while outside. Please clean up any waste left by your pet.

Reserving guest is responsible for any damages caused by pets. If any damages occur, incidental deposit will be forfeited.

Pets must be 40 pounds or less due to insurance restrictions and campground policy procedures.

sectionedDescription/description:
Located slopeside at Winterplace Ski Resort.  Literally ski right onto the slopes!!  Perfect for family ski trip in the winter as well as other seasons!  Enjoy UTV/ATV riding at nearby Hatfield and Mcccoy trailheads, rafting at New River Gorge, climbing, biking, hiking, ziplining, and the list goes on and on!
Easy drive to Beckley, Princeton, Hinton, Fayetteville, and more!
Comfortably sleeps 18+
The Space
Enjoy your vacation with 3 levels - 2 full Kitchens - 5 bedrooms - 3 full bathrooms
The kids will love "The Bunkhouse" including 3 bunkbeds with Full size on the bottom and single on the top, a single,  plus a futon!  Great views of the Ski Slopes from the large windows.
Cozy living room include 2 full sofa's and a relaxing loveseat
First Floor game room with pool table - fun for the whole family!
Two Large Flat screen Smart TV - one in the living room and one in the game room 
Cable TV
WIFI high speed internet
Washer/Dryer - Dishwasher - 2 ranges - 2 refrigerators 
3 bedrooms have queen size beds
1 bedroom in the first floor has another bunkbed with queen on the bottom and single on top
What to Do
Ski right onto the slopes from your back porch
Enjoy multiple parks nearby including New River Gorge,  Pipestem State park, Bluestone state park
Enjoy the best ATV/UTV  riding on Hatfield McCoy riding trails
Whitewater Rafting on New River
Hiking - Fishing - Ziplining
And more!
Dining
Skyline Pub and Grill - located right at the bottom of the hill - Enjoy Live Entertainment (seasonal)
Weathered Ground Brewery
Eately - Italian
Many restaurants in nearby towns of Beckley, Princeton, and more

Step off the porch and your on the ski slope!  Bunkhouse for kids is awesome!  Safe, cozy, and conveniently located right off I 77.

We have amazing partners that are always available to help!

Located conveniently off interstate I77.  Close to Princeton,  Beckley, and others.

primaryHost/about: Hi! I own 2 Airbnb loft apartments in downtown Tazewell, VA. It brings me great joy to host visitors here in beautiful T-Town. I work with coal impacted communities in Southwest VA on Economic Development projects. I can be your personal tourism assistant while you’re visiting Tazewell, just ask!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Full access to entire apartment and balcony.
sectionedDescription/description:
Conveniently located on Main Street Tazewell, you’re within walking distance to 3 full service downtown restaurants, a coffee shop, brewery, boutiques, an art gallery and more! Spacious apartment, featuring a king suite and a second bedroom with a full sized bed. Pull out the futon for additional sleepers, and there’s a full sized couch as well. Kitchen features new appliances and everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals during your stay. Laundry room with washer and dryer for your use.

Built in 1878, this building was the original home to Clinch Valley News. This second story apartment is overflowing with charm & character. Guests have access to a full living room, featuring a sofa, chair and smart TV. An 8 person dining table, full kitchen, bathroom, king suite with a futon and a smart TV, and a full size bed in the second bedroom with a walk in closet.

Full access to entire apartment and balcony.

I am a phone call or text away!

Main Street Tazewell is home to a variety of restaurants and retail shops and is the gateway to the scenic Back of the Dragon. Parking is located in the back of the building, we share a parking lot with the Sheriff’s Department and the Library. There is plenty of safe and private parking.

Parking and entrance to the apartment is located in the back of the building. Turn onto Marion Ave from Main Street and take the left hand turn into the parking lot. The entrance is the white door. You will be given an access code to unlock the door.

WiFi, off street parking, trash pick up, washer and dryer inside apartment.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: Please load dishwasher before checking out. Sit full trash bags outside the downstairs entry door for pickup.

name: Winterplace Condo E202
primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring - fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and  out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort. This condo is located on the second floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests.
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Private deck to enjoy the views from.
~ DETAILS ~
~ Sleeps: up to 10  (for stays under 10 days) 
~ Master Bedroom: 1 Queen Size Bed with attached bath 
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed
~ Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (Bunk)
~ Living Room: 1 Double Size Futon and a pull out couch
~ Cable TV in Living Room and all three bed rooms
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen
~ Ski Rack
~ Small Dryer in the condo
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details. 
~ Views of Winterplace Ski Resort
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation. 
The living room consist of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains.
Everything you need to create great family memories!
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the sliding glass door. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.
~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of.There are several state and national parks near by, like Little Beaver State Parkand Grandview National Park. We are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

additionalHouseRules:
NO GUESTS UNDER THE AGE OF 18 ALLOWED. 19 AND ABOVE ONLY.

Thank you for choosing The Beckley Guesthouse for your vacation needs.  We appreciate and respect all of our guests, and hope that you will love and respect our home as much as we do!
In order for us to offer the same level of quality to each of our guests, we ask that you kindly respect the following house rules:


1.  Absolutely No Eating in any areas of the house except the kitchen and the dining room. Please do not carry food to bedrooms.
 PLEASE.....
2.  Always remove and leave shoes at the door.
3.  Please do not allow furbabies to sleep on beds or furniture. We make available extra sheets and blankets to cover beds and furniture.
3.  LEAVE ALL SKI EQUIPMENT on the deck.  You may bring ski boots inside, but please make sure they remain on the linoleum in the entryway.
4.  Do Not place luggage, bags, etc. on the bedding.
5.  Do Not Lounge or Sleep on top of the comforters or on the decorative pillows.   
6.  Do Not wear perfumes or colognes to bed.
7.  Do Not wear any type of jewelry to bed.  It picks and tears the sheets.
8.  Do Not Flush anything in the toilets except toilet tissue.
9.  Do Not Move furniture in the house without the help of the owners. 
10.  Please recycle all hard plastics, paper, cardboard boxes, aluminum and tin.  
11.  Place ALL TRASH in large kitchen trash bags before placing it in the large trash cans under the deck.
12.  Please return any books enjoyed to their proper place.
13.  Please leave the house in the same condition and placement in which you found it.    
                                     


Thank you!
Please enjoy your stay!

primaryHost/about: I'm a single mom living in wild, wonderful West Virginia. I and my daughters, who are in their final university years, have opened our home to travelers looking for a home-away-from-home. We understand the pleasure of comfort, clean beds, and warm hospitality.  We love West Virginia and its never-ending opportunity for year-round recreation. Hiking, biking, skiing, fishing, rock climbing, and whitewater rafting are all to be found among the national parklands within a drive of less than a half hour from our door.  We hope to meet you soon and share our beautiful home! Look for "Almost Heaven Home" on (Hidden by Airbnb) and other social media.
sectionedDescription/access: You will have the home to yourselves. The owner does not live in this home.
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to our happy Gathering Place....for friends and family to make their own forever-memories! The guesthouse is a spacious pet-friendly home set up with your comfort in mind. Featuring amazing original hardwood floors throughout, high-ceilings, large fully equipped kitchen with extra workspace, five bedrooms, three full baths and a study that can be used for extra sleeping space. Spacious common rooms to spread out, relax, play games or tackle a puzzle. Very comfy beds w/lots of pillows.

"The Gathering Place for Friends, Family and Fur Babies"

You will have the home to yourselves. The owner does not live in this home.

I love to meet all of my guests, however, I travel a lot for work and family so a friend/host may be there to greet you when I cannot.

The guesthouse is located in a nice, quiet neighborhood within walking distance of our lovely downtown area where you can make the short walk to local night life, restaurants and shops. We manage four of five houses on the street which are used as Airbnb homes and corporate rentals, so know who your neighbors are.

There are three off-street parking spaces behind the house exclusively for guest use and plenty of extra parking across the street in business parking lots that agree to overnight and weekend usage. If a private driver is needed, please let us know, and we can help you make arrangements with a local Uber driver.

We do not provide breakfast items for parties that book the house exclusively.

primaryHost/about: We love outdoor/water activities, hiking, biking and reading, but one of our favorite activities is sitting on the deck with a nice bottle of wine with friends and enjoying the view. We enjoy travel--anywhere around water is fine with us and we have fallen in love with Central America.The Lord has blessed us with many opportunities to travel and we hope to continue--we would like to explore South Africa next!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access:
The home is set on 5 wooded acres with over 300 feet of waterfront. Due to so many trees, we are unable to offer satellite TV; however we do have  a television and a movie library. There are many books, magazines and family games for your relaxation. Note: cell service is limited to Verizon and US Cellular.
Also due to the number of trees, campfires are not permitted.
sectionedDescription/description:
Your journey begins on a private gravel road that leads through the woods to a log home in the mountains of Virginia. Immerse yourself in the many outdoor activities just steps from the front door - fishing kayaking, splashing in the river or doing some fine "river-sitting". Nearby you can bike or walk the New River Trail, visit historical sites or visit the Blue Ridge Parkway. Wineries and antiques stores are within an easy drive! Or just relax on the deck and watch the sun set over the river~

The log cabin features a spacious great room with cathedral ceilings, hickory hardwood  and tile floors, custom pine cabinetry and a Jacuzzi tub in the master bath. Watch the sun set over the river from  the large deck with 2 covered porches while you listen to the melodic sounds of the river and use our large gas grill to prepare your fresh catch from the river!

The home is set on 5 wooded acres with over 300 feet of waterfront. Due to so many trees, we are unable to offer satellite TV; however we do have  a television and a movie library. There are many books, magazines and family games for your relaxation. Note: cell service is limited to Verizon and US Cellular.
Also due to the number of trees, campfires are not permitted.

Owners are available by phone, text and email. Please contact us with any questions about the property.
Guest access is provided by a coded gate and entrance to the home.

Our cabin is located in a family "compound" of about 40 acres. In summer, the other homes are not visible from the cabin, but you may see others enjoying the river upstream.

Nearby: Galax, Wytheville, Hillsville and Pulaski
Radford University and Virginia Tech are within 1 hour.
New River Trail 
Golf courses, live theater, wineries, Safari Park, Mount Rodgers and White Top Mountain
Foster Falls State Park offers horseback rides, canoe and tube rental
Crooked Road Music Trail-Blue Ridge Music Center and Rex Theatre
A car is necessary

Low Allergen Environment
Minimum age for renters
Children Welcome
Non-smoking only
Pets not allowed
Suitable for elderly or infirm (only 3 steps at the back entrance), single floor plan
***Bedroom Configuration:
Master-Queen
Bedroom #2-Queen
Bedroom #3 Full and Twin

sectionedDescription/access: Ample free parking.  We are right across the street from Pipestem State Park, and there are lots of recreational and outdoor activities available, including hiking, swimming, ziplining, dining, golf and horseback riding. Reservations are suggested.
sectionedDescription/description:
Property includes Four Luxury Chalets, nestled together, on the property of Pipestem Spa and Event Center. Pipestem Resort State Park is directly across the street.  Luxury spa services and many chalet amenities are available (please book those online).  

Well behaved small pets allowed with prior approval. Pet fee is $35 fee Per Pet, Per Day, to be paid to host upon arrival. If host is not notified of animals being present, the guest may be asked to leave immediately.

Comfortable cabin that is ideal for families with children. Sleeps up to 12 people. Main floor: Full, spacious kitchen, open to the living room and dining room with full bath. Family room has 50” flat screen TV with DirecTV. Upper level: Three bedrooms – Master has queen-size bed, private bath with Jacuzzi tub, and plenty of room for playpen or portable crib. Second bedroom has two queen-size beds. Third bedroom has two bunk beds with twins on top and queens on bottom. All three bedrooms have remote controlled, individual heating and cooling units. Washer/Dryer/Dishwasher. Front porch: Sassafras king chairs and one double king chair. Charcoal grill and fire pit available.

Ample free parking.  We are right across the street from Pipestem State Park, and there are lots of recreational and outdoor activities available, including hiking, swimming, ziplining, dining, golf and horseback riding. Reservations are suggested.

Four Mountain Chalets, located on the property of Pipestem Spa and Event Center, across the street from Pipestem Resort State Park. With Brandon's BBQ right around the corner.

Contactless check-in. Guest will be sent an email with personal door code and Wi-Fi access one day before arrival.  Guest may arrive at any time after 4 PM, and check out is 10 AM. 

Massage, facial, hair and nail appointments for spa services must be booked in advance!


Guests may order Fruit and Cheese Trays, Champagne in Chalet, Romantic Couple's Massage with Foaming Milk Bubble Bath, King and Queen Packages, or Surprise Birthday Package (cake and balloons) in advance by contacting the host directly.

sectionedDescription/description:
Property includes Four Luxury Chalets, nestled together, on the property of Pipestem Spa and Event Center. Pipestem Resort State Park is directly across the street.  Luxury spa services and many chalet amenities are available (please book those online).  

Well behaved small pets allowed with prior approval. Pet fee is $35 fee Per Pet, Per Day, to be paid to host upon arrival. If host is not notified of animals being present, the guest may be asked to leave immediately.

Gorgeous two story, three bedroom, two bath home, with ample porch, fire pit, BBQ grill, and fully equipped kitchen.  Linens provided.

Ample free parking.  We are right across the street from Pipestem State Park, and there are lots of recreational and outdoor activities available, including hiking, swimming, ziplining, dining, golf and horseback riding. Reservations are suggested

Contactless check-in. Guest will be sent an email with personal door code and Wi-Fi access one day before arrival.  Guest may arrive at any time after 4 PM, and check out is 10 AM. 

Guests may order Fruit and Cheese Trays, Champagne in Chalet, Romantic Couple's Massage with Foaming Milk Bubble Bath, King and Queen Packages, or Surprise Birthday Package (cake and balloons) in advance by contacting the host directly.

name: Winterplace Condo E303
photos/11/caption: Parking lot in front of Building E
primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring - fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort.This condo is located on the third floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests and for groups of 15 or more discounted lift tickets as well.
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Large deck to enjoy the views from.
~Details ~
~ Sleeps: 10  (for stays under 10 days) 
~ Bedroom Master: 1 Queen Size Bed
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed
~ Bunkroom: 2 Twin Size Beds (bunk bed)
~ Living Room: 2 Double Size Futons
~ Cable TV in Living Room, Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 2
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen
~ Ski Rack
~ Small dryer
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details.
~ Private deck with views of Winterplace Ski Resort 
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation. 
The living room consist of a wood burning fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views onto the mountains.
Everything you need to create great family memories!
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the couch. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.
~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of. There are several state and national parks close by, like Little Beaver State Parkand Grandview State ParkWe are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarackhas everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golf which doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

name: House on private 400 acre mountaintop farm!
p3SummaryAddress: Summers County, West Virginia, United States
primaryHost/about: Julia and I are year round Folly Beach residents, and in addition to managing our vacation properties, we also own and operate Bert's Market, the only grocery store on the island. We also have five children and would like you to know that U2 is the greatest band on the planet.
sectionedDescription/description:
This is not your average AirBnB - this is a farm! We offer a private 400 acre farm located 25 miles from Pipestem Resort State Park and 11 miles to New River Gorge National Park. Our farm house has 2 bedrooms, 1 loft bed, 2.5 baths, sleeps 8, and offers beautiful sunsets, hiking trails, fresh pond water to kayak in, and the comforts of home.  Explore nature by day and sleep under the stars at night.

There's something for everyone here with an open floor plan, 2 bedrooms, a loft area with a full bed, 2.5 baths. The master suite offers breathtaking views and the sitting room has a wood-burning stove and board games for you and your family to enjoy.

name: Town Creek Cottage in Downtown Abingdon
sectionedDescription/access: Parking is located right next to house. You can park up to 4 standard vehicles or one standard RV. Walking distance to all the favorite stops. if you walk over the bridge on the creek right next to the house to Main Street you will find the sweetest coffee shop “Raven” and just behind that is “Wolf Hills Brewery” . If you continue on main street you run into little boutiques and the famous “Tavern”, White Birch, Spring house, 128 pecan, Summers Roof top,The Barter Theater, Martha Washington Hotel and Spa. The best part is if you walk a bit more or take your bikes for less than a mile you will find the entrance of the Virginia Creeper Trail . That alone makes Abingdon that much more special . Please ask me for recommendations or things to do! I’d love to share and make you feel at home.
sectionedDescription/description:
If you follow the Town Creek, you will surely find this little hidden cottage at a corner street. Centrally located at the heart of Abingdon (downtown) and walking distance to all the local favorites. Virginia Creeper trail is less than a 13 minute walk or quick bike ride away.

She is 80 years old but she’s got strong bones. Renovated to make you feel like you never left your home with a modern feel. Two bedrooms with a king and queen bed and one bathroom. Both rooms have drawers and area to hang clothes during your stay. Additional blankets in bench storage. Dining room seats six with a espresso mini bar . Living room seating with a tv, Netflix, Hulu or hbo access. Bathroom has a private entrance. Kitchen has all the general essentials and additional items that will make you feel even more at home. Keypad entry into the home. Secure and safe . Basement is under renovation and unavailable at this time. Please enjoy the creek around back.

Parking is located right next to house. You can park up to 4 standard vehicles or one standard RV. Walking distance to all the favorite stops. if you walk over the bridge on the creek right next to the house to Main Street you will find the sweetest coffee shop “Raven” and just behind that is “Wolf Hills Brewery” . If you continue on main street you run into little boutiques and the famous “Tavern”, White Birch, Spring house, 128 pecan, Summers Roof top,The Barter Theater, Martha Washington Hotel and Spa. The best part is if you walk a bit more or take your bikes for less than a mile you will find the entrance of the Virginia Creeper Trail . That alone makes Abingdon that much more special . Please ask me for recommendations or things to do! I’d love to share and make you feel at home.

I am available for anything you may need. Don't hesitate to reach out to me with any questions or concerns during your stay. We want your experience in our home to be perfect.

Off Main Street, normal  traffic.
High season - medium traffic

Walking, riding bike, driving. Great locations within a 15 minute walk.

We do allow pets . Please inquire about pet fee when booking, it is dependent on length of stay and size of animal.$ 25-100

sectionedDescription/description:
Plan your unplugged (there is CELL SERVICE) getaway in our recently renovated, stylish, mountaintop cabin! Sleeps six to eight on two levels with plenty of room to congregate and also enjoy some well-earned solitude. Fish from the dock, hike the trails, or enjoy a bit of hunting on our one hundred acres of game filled mountainside!

We live on the adjoining property. I'm available by text or call!

Rural area. Near an AT trailhead. Large Amish store within 5 minute drive.

name: Maybeury ATV Resort
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to Maybeury ATV Resort! 

Our newly renovated, 2000 square foot lodge offers 4 private bedrooms (9 beds), 2 bathrooms and 3 showers. Enjoy features such as flat screen TVs, satellite TV, full kitchen, great room and plenty of parking for many trucks and trailers.

Our lodge can accommodate a group up to 18 guests.

We are located only 2 miles from the new Pocahontas Trailhead and can also access the Indian Ridge and Pinnacle Creek Trails to give you over 200 miles of riding!

additionalHouseRules:
PLEASE HONOR 10AM CHECK-OUT
The cleaning attendant will arrive based on scheduled check-out time.

No smoking inside the cabin.  Cigarette butts must be disposed of in the bucket provided on the front porch.

Please be attentive to your pets and dispose of any waste from them in the immediate, non-wooded area of the yard to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not allow pets on the furniture to avoid a forfeit of the deposit.

Please do not leave pet unattended while you are away from the cabin.

Please clean up excess dog hair or accident they may have in the house to avoid forfeit of the deposit.

Please DO NOT park on the grass to avoid forfeit of deposit.

No parties or events; Guests should leave premises in neat and undamaged condition.

Please RETURN ANY MOVED INDOOR OR OUTDOOR FURNITURE to its original location to avoid forfeit of deposit.
 
Please strip the beds before your departure.

No unregistered guests allowed, please adhere to property’s stated capacity.
 
Please respect the local noise ordinance of quiet time after 10p.m.

Please do not use grill up next to or on the front porch of the cabins.

Please wash and put away dishes before checkout.

Please remove all food from the refrigerator and cabinets before checkout.

Please dispose of all trash and place in the outdoor bins beside garage. 

Please report any damages and/or breakages in a reasonably timely manner.

rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
The Lodge on Little Creek is just a 15-minute drive from Wytheville, VA, off I-77. Although this beautiful property isn't far from restaurants and stores you will feel like you are a world away. This 3400 sq foot, 4 bedroom, 3 bath home is situated on 53 private acres bordering the Jefferson National Forest.   Enjoy private trails throughout the property. When daylight fades share stories with your family around a roaring campfire.   The lodge has a new filtration system for sulfur-free water.

The lodge has 4 bedrooms and a spacious loft overlooking the living room with full size bed, twin trundle bed and futon.  There is a bedroom upstairs with twin and toddler bed.  The king size master bedroom upstairs has a private bathroom.  The second king size bedroom located downstairs overlooks the creek as well as another bedroom downstairs with a full size bed.  The game room on the first floor has a futon sofa bed.

We are in a rural location; cell phone service is limited but we do have Hughesnet Satellite wi-fi, it doesn't stream video but allows for surfing the web, answering emails, wi-fi texting and calling(depending on you cell phone carrier plan).

As like many people in rural America we are on a well water system so the water has Sulphur, which is completely safe to drink and bath in but does have a Sulphur smell and is an acquired taste.  We supply a gallon of water but suggest our guests bring extra water for drinking due to the taste.

We are one hour from Virginia Tech in Blacksburg, VA and 55 minutes to Radford University.

We are pet friendly with lots of room for your pets to explore.
We charge a pet fee of $25 for the first pet per stay and $10 for each additional pet per stay. 

The pet fee is collected separately through AirBNB after the cabin is booked.

* Don't forget to bring your water shoes, folding chairs, beach towels and sunscreen.

***Please read below***

*The lodge has a neighboring cottage for rent on Airbnb, approximately 70 feet from the lodge called The Cottage on Little Creek (please see gallery for photo that shows proximity.


* Wi-Fi: 
As mentioned above, this is a rural location which is great to decompress and find peace and quiet but high-speed internet isn’t available in this area. We provide satellite internet, so guests can use Wi-Fi texting and calling (dependent on your cell provider- cell phone service is very limited), check emails and surf the web but streaming Netflix and downloading music unfortunately don’t work.  We have the highest number of gigabytes available with HughesNet Satellite but once the data caps are reached (which is easy to do if streaming is tried and continues to buffer) the internet eventually stops.  We ask you to please be conscientious with the internet usage, so all our guests are able to use it throughout their stay with us.

This place is so special, and we want our guests to love it as much as we do so if there is anything we can do throughout your stay we are happy to help.

name: Awesome Flat Top Farmhouse - Ashwood Rentals
p3SummaryAddress: Flat Top, West Virginia, United States
primaryHost/about: Professional who loves to travel!
sectionedDescription/description:
Ashwood Rentals

When I vacation in the mountains, I like to feel very comfortable ! From the minute that I arrive, I want to feel like I'm vacationing in my second home. I don't want to check-in at an office, and then go park my car far away from me. I want a place that has easy access to me unloading all of my luggage, groceries, skis, snowboard, and kids!

Linens are provided but please bring your own towels.

The house sleeps at least 15+ people. There is a bedroom on the main level with a queen bed. There is a sleeper sofa in the living room. The upstairs has two bedrooms.  One has a king bed and the other room has a queen bed and a full bed. In the finished basement there is currently two twin beds and two full beds. There is also some room in the basement for some air mattresses if needed.

Linens are provided but towels are not.

We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to various insurance sites for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsureMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
No pets.

In order to keep the house as allergen free as possible...guests found to bring pets will forfeit entire security deposit.

name: House on 100 Dillion St. Hatfield McCoy Trail
photos/15/caption: Worlds Longest ATV Train Trestle! You will ride this to the Rockhouse Trail System.
sectionedDescription/access: There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located in the heart of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System

HMT Rentals has direct trail access, we are  located in downtown Man, WV, less than one mile  from the Rockhouse Trailhead of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.

Check-In to our unit, drop your trailer, unload your machines and ride your ATV, UTV or Motorcycle directly to one of the local businesses in the Town of Man. Businesses include (Gas, Food, Bar and Grill, Sporting Goods!!)

There is parking for 4 trucks and trailers (20') at the house. If trailer is larger than 20' parking is available on our property across street, under the bridge. You can also text John for more details.

Ride your machine through town to access the Hatfield McCoy Trail. Access Rockhouse Trail, Devil Anse Trail and Buffalo Mountain Trail. Also, ride your machine into town to eat at one of our many restaurants.

name: Railroad Express Guest Suite
photos/1/caption: Bedroom with king bed,  roomy dresser and two nightstands with drawers
photos/2/caption: Classy closet space in an antique armoire
photos/3/caption: Windows offer views of Bluefield State and passing trains across Bluefield Avenue
photos/4/caption: Kitchen is outfitted and ready for meal prep
photos/6/caption: Kitchen window above refrigerator offers mountain view
photos/8/caption: Bathroom with shower. Bathroom door at left, decorative curtains inside.
photos/9/caption: Peruse our map of Railroad History Towns -- towns surrounding Bluefield -- while watching trains go by in the distance. Map shows towns with landmarks, restored depots or railroad museums.
photos/10/caption: Spacious back porch is perfect for relaxing or dining
photos/12/caption: Bluefield and nearby towns with railroad museums, restored depots or other landmarks. Bluefield -- at the center of the region's RR history!
photos/14/caption: Front entrance of townhouse, which is in the back of the house.
photos/16/caption: Parking for the Railroad Express Guest Suite
photos/17/caption: View of Bluefield State from the backyard
photos/18/caption: Not pictured: the railroad tracks are on the other side of Bluefield Avenue -- you can hear the trains.
primaryHost/about: I moved to West Virginia about 15 years ago. I love the beauty of this state with its mountains and rivers. I also love the old houses in Bluefield that were built a century ago to accommodate all those who prospered by working for the railroad, which was essential to the transport of coal. I undertook a major renovation of the home that contains the apartment we call the Railroad Express Guest Suite. The house has good bones and beautiful hardwood floors and was worth the effort!
sectionedDescription/access: Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the king bed in this newly renovated private guest suite with hardwood floors, ceiling fans, armoire, dresser and nightstands. Eat-in kitchen has microwave, fridge & induction cooktop. Porch is perfect for dining or relaxing. Convenient to Hatfield-McCoy Trails & historic Bramwell. RR enthusiasts will love Bluefield, a town that flourished when Norfolk & Western came to town in the 1880s. List of railroad museums, landmarks and depots can be made available upon request at check in.

High-speed wifi is provided.  Two windows, with screens, can be opened. The king mattress and pillows have allergy protective covers. An air mattress is available for children accompanying adults. Contact host if more than two guests are involved. Off street parking is available. Keypad entry.

Parking area, backyard, back porch (patio) and the entire suite is accessible to guests. The laundry room is down a shared staircase but is exclusive to the suite.

Host is nearby. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask! On longer stays, we will be in to clean the suite at least once every two weeks.

Are you a railroad enthusiast? Bluefield prospered as a center for the railroad transport of coal.  Norfolk Southern still maintains an office at 800 Princeton Avenue in downtown Bluefield. The city offers many vantage points for photography, with spots where you can pull off the road and take spectacular photos as the trains rumble by. Of interest to children: The Ridgerunner train leaves on a milelong loop, from noon to 6 p.m. on weekends, from Bluefield City Park from April through September, but be careful: That train whistle is loud! For researchers and scholars, a wealth of information is tucked away in the Eastern Regional Coal Archives, which are attached to the Craft Memorial Library in Bluefield, including railroad memorabilia, maps, company records and historic photographs and documents.

Both Bluefield, West Virginia, and Bluefield, Virginia, have extensive bus service. The driveway is large enough to accommodate a trailer. 
ATV parking may be arranged off-site.

Contact host for parking instructions and keypad code.

UPON CHECKOUT -- no need to wash linens, just please text or message host when you leave. Long-term guests may do light housekeeping (cleaning supplies provided), but hosts will arrange to enter the suite at least once every two weeks to clean.
sectionedDescription/interaction: Host is nearby. If you need anything, please don't hesitate to ask! On longer stays, we will be in to clean the suite at least once every two weeks.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Are you a railroad enthusiast? Bluefield prospered as a center for the railroad transport of coal.  Norfolk Southern still maintains an office at 800 Princeton Avenue in downtown Bluefield. The city offers many vantage points for photography, with spots where you can pull off the road and take spectacular photos as the trains rumble by. Of interest to children: The Ridgerunner train leaves on a milelong loop, from noon to 6 p.m. on weekends, from Bluefield City Park from April through September, but be careful: That train whistle is loud! For researchers and scholars, a wealth of information is tucked away in the Eastern Regional Coal Archives, which are attached to the Craft Memorial Library in Bluefield, including railroad memorabilia, maps, company records and historic photographs and documents.

sectionedDescription/space: High-speed wifi is provided.  Two windows, with screens, can be opened. The king mattress and pillows have allergy protective covers. An air mattress is available for children accompanying adults. Contact host if more than two guests are involved. Off street parking is available. Keypad entry.
sectionedDescription/summary: Enjoy the king bed in this newly renovated private guest suite with hardwood floors, ceiling fans, armoire, dresser and nightstands. Eat-in kitchen has microwave, fridge & induction cooktop. Porch is perfect for dining or relaxing. Convenient to Hatfield-McCoy Trails & historic Bramwell. RR enthusiasts will love Bluefield, a town that flourished when Norfolk & Western came to town in the 1880s. List of railroad museums, landmarks and depots can be made available upon request at check in.

I am from Lexington, NC. I have 2 boys and a beautiful wife. I have a vacuum business that allows me to travel all over the United States. We love riding as a family. It is great family time. This is what we want to provide a great relaxing trip for friends and family to enjoy.
