primaryHost/about: I have been in the vacation rental business for over 25 years! I love rescuing old wood, restoring antiques, collecting vintage clothing, and am always on the hunt for unusual finds. Decorating is a passion as well. I seem to find a place for everything! Beyond that, I love meeting and welcoming people from all over the world. I would love to add you to my list!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: During the day, guests may enjoy a walk to the barn in the lower pastures (following the designated path only). There you can access the river and fish (bring your own fishing pole and/or kayak) or have fun just splashing around! This area is restricted to day use only and no ATVs or dirt bikes are allowed on the property. No sport shooting on property.
sectionedDescription/description:
This historic cabin and farm has been featured in numerous print articles and 'Traveling West Virginia' TV segments.  Filled with glimpses of the past, guests enjoy charming antique-filled rooms, Wi-Fi, kitchen, new bath, queen bed, fireplace.  Near the New River Gorge National Park, Pipestem zipline, ATV trails, hiking, kayaking, caves/caverns & more. Watch deer graze in the pastures as you sit back and enjoy peace in the valley. Located just off I-77, exit 14. A step back in time ...

Guests will enjoy the whole house. Historic home is smoke free, pet free, and vape free. Each room is appointed with beautiful antique quilts, old trunks, and pieces of furniture used on the farm. It is like a museum! Of course, there has been added the modern recliner for sitting and sipping coffee while watching the deer eat apples from the old tree!

The main floor has a sunporch with a spectacular view of the valley. Guests can enjoy views of sunrise and sunset in both rain and shine! The main floor also has a kitchen, dining area, living room with fireplace, and sitting room. Beautiful tiled bathroom with shower is on main floor.  Choose to sleep on main floor or in loft. The loft has a queen size bed, sitting area, and closet. All rooms have antiques and beautiful furnishings.

If you are looking for pampered, modern conveniences this is not your place. If you want peace, quiet, tranquility amid old relics, antiques, and farm pastures you will enjoy this property. The homestead is much like it was during the time it was built (early 1900s). It is intended to give visitors and guests an idea of how living on the farm in the early years might have been. Not for the allergy sensitive as it is a farm with hayfields, etc.

Please note: This is an old cabin on a septic system in the countryside.  For safety reasons, we strictly enforce the use of it to 2 people ONLY. We do not share/offer property as a meeting or gathering place.

During the day, guests may enjoy a walk to the barn in the lower pastures (following the designated path only). There you can access the river and fish (bring your own fishing pole and/or kayak) or have fun just splashing around! This area is restricted to day use only and no ATVs or dirt bikes are allowed on the property. No sport shooting on property.

You may text me with questions at any time.

This property is located in the countryside surrounded by mountains and valleys. There are 2 churches (Methodist and Baptist), a post office, a school (K-5), and a small convenience store w gas/groceries is 3 miles away. This property is near Camp Creek State Forest, Pipestem, Bluestone State Parks, Pinnacle Rock State Park, outdoor rafting, ATV riding on the Hatfields and McCoys Trail, America's newest National park: The New River Gorge National Park, and much more! It takes approximately 5 minutes to reach Interstate 77 from the cabin, exit 14.

You will need transportation to get to everything to see and do. There is no public transit system in the countryside. :)

Diesel the farm dog may be around each day for his dog biscuit.
We love sharing our family's old log cabin with others. We strictly enforce the use of the cabin to no more than 2 adults, no pets.

name: The Armstrong Lodging
photos/16/caption: Room 2
sectionedDescription/description:
Newly opened in downtown Pinevile, WV. Each room has different scene. Cool gel beds with all white comforters,
patagonon rosewood floors, granite counter tops, and top of the line accessories.  Drinks, snacks and desserts included in price of rooms. Lots of free parking. Easy access. Close to the Hatfield McCoy Trail System.  Quiet and friendly town. Nice view of the historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Pinnacle Rock.

FREE WiFi, phones., parking. Easy Access. Handicap accessible
Free softdrinks, snacks and desserts. Feel right at home, if you get hungry, go to kitchen area and get a snack or pop some popcorn with softdrinks. Situated downtown Pineville, very quiet and friendly town. View of historical Wyoming County Courthouse and walking distance to Castle Rock. With 2 miles of the Hatfield McCoy Trail System. Plenty of parking for four wheelers and trailers.

On site employee til 9:00 p.m. and after hours emergency phone numbers provided. Maid service every day.

The Town of Pineville is very quiet and friendly town.  We have a
beautiful historical CourtHouse and a rock formation known as
Castle Rock. Pineville has access to the Hatfield McCoy Trail Head with 2 miles of town and four wheelers are allowed on the streets.  We have several restuarants to choose from. We are located downtown Pineville on Main Street.

Pineville has a park within walking distance, can hike Castle Rock and four wheelers and dirt bikes are allowed on the streets to get to the Hatfield McCoy Trails. No public transit is available. Host will be glad to take you where you need to go.

name: Private Luxury Cabin located on the H&M Trails!
photos/16/caption: Bedroom 2
sectionedDescription/description:
Hidden Hollow ATV Ranch is located on the Hatfield McCoy Pocahontas trail system just outside of Montcalm, WV. We are positioned conveniently on the Pocahontas connector trail with access to our private 90 acre ranch via a ½ mile private dirt road.  We are perfect for couples or families looking for a more privacy and seclusion than the typical large resort or campground.  

Included with your stay are:

Linens/Pillows
Free Firewood
Free Ice
Satellite TV
Wifi
Pet Friendly 
2A Friendly

The cabin and its location is geared towards the off road community.

Cabin is located on 90 acres with no other guests but you!  Owners and property manager do live on the premises as well.

ATVs can be driven on all roads in the area

Need extra room?  We offer a 50A Full RV hookup next to the cabin for an additional fee.

Please note:  Property Manager lives onsite in nearby house.  We respect your privacy and we are riders as well.

After 2/1/2022 the second bedroom will no longer contain bunk beds.  There will be 2 queen beds in their place.

name: Storybook Cottage with a View
photos/0/caption: View of the garden at the end of July- gourds and zinnias are growing!
photos/1/caption: An aerial view of the Storybook Cottage--- above the porch, a gnome sits in his rocking chair by candlelight watching over the cottage garden.
photos/2/caption: Above the porch, a gnome sits in his rocking chair by candlelight watching over the cottage garden.
photos/3/caption: Another view of the cottage- there is a seating area in front the cottage (in addition to the private back deck.)
photos/4/caption: View of the cottage garden - mid-July. Cucumbers are ready and tomatoes are green. Radishes have been canned, wind-fallen apple jelly has been made, and zucchini bread is being baked! Yum!
photos/5/caption: This is a view of the fire pit and the barn.  In the far left of the picture, you can see our largest grape arbor (muscadine grapes.)  We also have concord grapes here.
photos/6/caption: Looking through the front entrance to the cottage, into the cottage garden.  This is taken at the end of July- the gourds are growing well,  in addition to the morning glories and moon flowers!
photos/7/caption: Aerial view of the cottage. The pond is visible in the rear and there is a seating area in front of the cottage as well.
photos/8/caption: This is the "mudroom" - a place to unpack and take off your shoes.
photos/9/caption: This is the bedroom-- the view immediately as walking in from the mudroom.
photos/10/caption: This is a view of the kitchenette from inside the bedroom.
photos/11/caption: This is an antique dresser which converts to a lighted desk space.
photos/12/caption: This is a view of the kitchenette from inside the bedroom.
photos/13/caption: The bedroom is equipped with a television and dvd player.
photos/14/caption: This is a view of the bedroom from inside the kitchenette.
photos/15/caption: This is a view of the bedroom from inside the kitchenette.
photos/16/caption: This is the view of the pond from the bedroom.  There are sheers and room darkening panels as well.
photos/17/caption: A view from the bedroom looking out over the pond.  This door accesses your private deck.
photos/18/caption: The kitchenette has a table and chairs for two and is equipped with dishes.
photos/19/caption: The kitchenette is brightly lit and has a door to access the back porch and back entry.
photos/20/caption: This is a view of the pond from the private back porch. (The three ducks can be seen on the far left.)
photos/21/caption: The bathroom has an antique sink.  Toiletries are provided!
photos/22/caption: This bathroom has an antique claw foot tub with a shower. Toiletries are provided!
photos/23/caption: The bathroom has an antique claw foot tub and sink.  The tub also has a shower.  Toiletries are provided!
photos/24/caption: In the bathroom, you'll find a stocked travel case of toiletries, as well as towels, wash clothes, hand towels, and a hair dryer.
photos/25/caption: This is the back entrance which accesses the kitchenette.
photos/26/caption: View of the back entrance into the cottage.  This entrance is adjacent to the dedicated parking for the cottage- so it's the most convenient.
photos/27/caption: 123 Whimsy Way is your address at the Holliday Castle.
photos/28/caption: Private back porch looking over the pond.  The door shown (between the chairs) accesses the bedroom.
photos/29/caption: Nasturtiums are growing in the hanging basket on the back porch overlooking the pond. (Leaves are slightly peppery and similar to watercress in flavor.)
photos/30/caption: These are the ducks.  They have a terrific sense of humor. :-)
photos/31/caption: These are the chickens. (They're smiling - honest.)
photos/32/caption: On the right is the corner of our house, the gray building is our garage and there is a sitting area inside the stone wall- excellent for breakfast or relaxing during the evening.
photos/33/caption: Excellent picnic spot near the pond.
photos/34/caption: Excellent picnic spot near the pond.
photos/35/caption: Trail circles the pond and provides access to an excellent picnic spot.
photos/36/caption: Ishmael's Tackle Shop is located beneath the cottage. Just open the door to find all kinds of fishing supplies, as well as chairs to use.
photos/38/caption: A pear tree is growing to the left of the cottage. We can pears and make pear butter in the late summer/early fall. Delicious!
photos/39/caption: The Storybook Cottage does not have a key box or a code for entrance.  Instead, skeleton keys are used for every door.
photos/40/caption: Geraniums are growing in pots on the table.  Basil is growing in the planter on the porch.
photos/41/caption: Sunflowers are in bloom, alongside tomatoes and a baby grape vine, in the front yard at the Holliday Castle!
photos/42/caption: Access to a sitting area in front of the Cottage
photos/43/caption: View in October from the front porch of the Cottage.  This is the Cottage Garden.
photos/45/caption: Peppers growing in a pot hanging from the back deck.
photos/47/caption: Back porch at the Cottage after a good snow.
photos/49/caption: Back entrance at the Cottage and a view of the barn.
photos/50/caption: View from the mudroom looking into the bedroom.
photos/51/caption: Tiny Christmas tree in the mudroom and a basket of books and games.
photos/52/caption: Soldier standing guard at the Cottage!
photos/58/caption: Awesome view of the pond in December!
photos/61/caption: Our pet turkey, Pumpkin. He's a sweetie!
photos/63/caption: This is the view from the cottage porch (Pumpkin, the turkey, is hanging out!)
photos/65/caption: This is Jack sitting on the edge of the fire pit looking at the back of the cottage.
photos/66/caption: Duck peeking over the cottage garden wall.
photos/69/caption: King Arthur, the peacock, was raised here. However, he has now moved to a farm with two female peacocks.
photos/74/caption: Our first Granny Smith apple on the dwarf tree in the cottage garden.  August 2021.
photos/89/caption: Little black cat chilling on the bench beside Pumpkin's house...2022
photos/90/caption: Chicken Little...winter of 2021...view from inside the cottage looking out at front porch.
photos/91/caption: Pumpkin...Winter of 2021...view from the cottage back porch.
photos/92/caption: Pumpkin... Winter of 2021...view from the cottage bedroom
photos/93/caption: Jack on the handrail of the Blackberry Boardwalk....2022
photos/95/caption: A gnome watching over the cottage garden.
photos/98/caption: Sitting area with lights under the  muscadine grapevine overlooking the fire pit and pond ....2022
photos/102/caption: Fishing...catch and release...in the pond directly behind the cottage!
primaryHost/about: I'm a mom of 6 and stay home with our two youngest boys (who are 5 and 8.)  I love to garden, cook, can, sew, play the piano, read non-fiction, write, create and dream.  I have authored two books, "Fairly-Popular Fairy Tales and Classic Cookery" and "The Dandelion King."  I enjoy taking care of our animals (dog, cats, ducks, chickens, and turkey)  My husband and I are converting our 2 bedroom, 1940s house, into a castle. (I draw and he builds.)  We also design and build quirky playhouses and enjoy taking amazing road trips with our kids. Oh- and I collect pencils. :-)
sectionedDescription/access:
The entire Cottage is for your use.  

Rental of the cottage includes a souvenir fishing permit.  This will give you complete access to the fishing supplies in Ishmael's Tackle Shop.  Ishmael's is located just below the cottage- we'll have it unlocked for you.  We do require that after any photographs, you throw your fish back in the pond. (Swimming is not allowed in the pond.) (Ice skating on the pond is also not allowed.)

We are currently building a pencil museum for Jill's collection.  The pencil museum opens up to our Blackberry Boardwalk.  It's a nice walkway through the edge of the woods near the pond.  It also helps make the blackberries more accessible during season (they're typically ripe in August and you're welcome to help yourself!) Although the museum is still in a construction phase, the Blackberry Boardwalk is complete.

Also, we are located in a very popular area for ATV riders.  We are 38.8 miles to the Pocahontas Trail Head (Hatfield & McCoy ATV & UTV Trails).  You are welcome to use any tools in our garage for maintenance of your ATV or UTV while you are visiting. 

You're free to walk throughout the property, including the gardens.  Please also treat the gardens like a buffet.  You're welcome to eat all of the vegetables and fruit you want while you're here.  You're also welcome to help with any animal chores and gardening (especially fun for kids!) and we love to answer any questions you have.

When it is time for your check-out, you can just walk away!  No cleaning or locking up needed.  We like for folks to be able to completely relax and not worry about any of the details. :-)
sectionedDescription/description:
Stay in the Storybook Cottage at the Holliday Castle!  The Storybook Cottage is a tiny crooked fairytale house located behind our home (which is being converted into a castle!)  Enjoy the view from your private back porch! Close to ski resort!

The Storybook Cottage is a fairytale-inspired tiny crooked house.  The Cottage is located directly behind our house - which is in the process of being converted into a castle. Our property houses apple trees, plum trees, cherry trees, grapevines, peach trees, blackberries, raspberries, blueberries, and pear trees- in addition to mass quantities of vegetables. 

In the photographs posted, you'll be able to see more about the property, the placement of the Cottage in relation to the main house, and some of the animals. :-)

In the Cottage, you'll find books, board games, and general whimsy. During the late spring and summer, the front porch opens up into an edible front yard- feel free to help yourself!  The back porch overlooks the pond (beautiful, but not suitable for skating!).  Rental of the cottage comes with access to the fishing supplies located in Ishmael's Tackle Shop.  Ishmael's is located just below the cottage- we keep it unlocked for our guests.  (However, swimming is not allowed in the pond- and when it's frozen over, no skating is allowed either.)

The Cottage is a tiny house, yet still has a lot of amenities!  You have your own private kitchenette, equipped with a sink, mini-fridge, breakfast station (which includes a coffee pot, toaster oven and griddle), a microwave and a table with seats for two.  (Due to the size of this kitchenette, we were unable to include a traditional oven with stovetop. If you have any questions about the kitchenette, please just let us know! ) This kitchenette also includes dishes (mugs, larger cups, plates, bowls and silverware)  and a folding tray for reading or enjoying your meals in bed.  During the warmer season, we provide a retro cooler for your use while fishing or picnicking.

You will also have your own private bathroom with an antique sink and claw foot tub (with shower).  We provide you with towels, washcloths, soap, shampoo, conditioner, bubble bath and a hair dryer. (If you've forgotten anything else, just let us know- we probably have extras!)

The Cottage also has, what we call, a "mud room."  It's a small room where you'll find a bench and a picnic basket (during season).  During the holidays, the mudroom is decked out with a Christmas tree. The mudroom is intended as a place for you to unload, store your umbrella and shed your shoes.  In the winter months, this room is also outfitted with boot warmers.  

The main room houses a queen size bed, a rocking chair, a tv (w/ dvd player), and a dresser (which converts into a lighted desk.) We also provide you with an iron and ironing board.  There is not a closet; however, there is a hook on the door for hanging your garment bag. The bedding is composed of two down alternative pillows, two "SpaLuxury" pillows, and two 100% cotton blankets.  There are three separate heaters located throughout the cottage. There is also a window air conditioner. The main room/bedroom overlooks the pond with an entire wall of windows (don't worry- there are room-darkening curtains if you prefer to sleep in!)  

If you would like to bring your child(ren), please send me a message beforehand.  I am sure that a small air mattress will fit beside the queen size bed (and I will prepare it for you!), but I want to share exact dimensions with you to ensure you'll be pleased with the layout of the room. Also, if you're bringing young children, please let me know!  I will ensure the cottage is stocked with some age-appropriate toys. 

Regarding breakfast, your kitchen will be stocked with a standard brew of coffee, as well as tea bags.  Upon your arrival, you will find a basket of fruit and zucchini bread (or something similar), as well as a couple bottles of water in your fridge. We have decided to leave this welcome/breakfast basket for you so as not to disturb your sleep the next morning.  During the winter months, your kitchen is also stocked with hot cocoa mix.

We currently have a dog, cats, and a chicken.  This past winter has been hard on the animals.  Pumpkin, our pet turkey passed away, as well as our duck, and one of the chickens. This spring (2023), we will be getting baby chickens, ducks and turkeys.

**Update April 2023:  We had a very bad windstorm and a handsome little rooster blew in and has fallen deeply in love with our Chicken Little.  They have moved into Pumpkin's old house and are inseparable. We realize he's an early riser and not all of us are--- so we are now providing ear plugs for each guest in the cottage (just in case.)

The entire Cottage is for your use.  

Rental of the cottage includes a souvenir fishing permit.  This will give you complete access to the fishing supplies in Ishmael's Tackle Shop.  Ishmael's is located just below the cottage- we'll have it unlocked for you.  We do require that after any photographs, you throw your fish back in the pond. (Swimming is not allowed in the pond.) (Ice skating on the pond is also not allowed.)

We are currently building a pencil museum for Jill's collection.  The pencil museum opens up to our Blackberry Boardwalk.  It's a nice walkway through the edge of the woods near the pond.  It also helps make the blackberries more accessible during season (they're typically ripe in August and you're welcome to help yourself!) Although the museum is still in a construction phase, the Blackberry Boardwalk is complete.

Also, we are located in a very popular area for ATV riders.  We are 38.8 miles to the Pocahontas Trail Head (Hatfield & McCoy ATV & UTV Trails).  You are welcome to use any tools in our garage for maintenance of your ATV or UTV while you are visiting. 

You're free to walk throughout the property, including the gardens.  Please also treat the gardens like a buffet.  You're welcome to eat all of the vegetables and fruit you want while you're here.  You're also welcome to help with any animal chores and gardening (especially fun for kids!) and we love to answer any questions you have.

When it is time for your check-out, you can just walk away!  No cleaning or locking up needed.  We like for folks to be able to completely relax and not worry about any of the details. :-)

You will see us on the property.  We have five children living here, ranging in age from seven to eighteen.  Don't worry- they will not bother you at all- but you will probably see them outside playing.  If you need anything, I am a stay-at-home mom and am easily accessible during the day.  I can frequently be found in the kitchen, our library or the greenhouse.  We dearly love to show folks around our place and answer any questions you may have about our home, gardens, animals and/or the area.

We are only a little over a mile from I-77.  We are less than a mile from Winterplace Ski Resort, Dollar General, Exxon and Little General Gas Stations, Ski Barn, and the Ghent Post Office.  We are almost exactly halfway between Princeton, WV and Beckley, WV.  We are 17 miles from Beckley and 22 miles from Princeton.

**Important to note:  We are a castle-in-progress, so you will see construction materials in the common areas.  Believe me, we're working as fast as we can! :-) Thank you for understanding!

name: Warrior trail: Love Shack Caretta 879 ATV lodging
primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!

sectionedDescription/description:
2 Bedroom 1 bath creekside house located 7 minutes from War, WV. Just off Warrior trail#16. 
Surrounded by mountains and Outlaw Trails. Cozy dine in kitchen, comfortable living room with smart tv and wifi.
plenty of parking for trucks and trailers. Creekside firepit and charcoal grill for outdoor entertaining.

All access to the house

Feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns, or if you just want advice on some of the Outlaw Trails.

This house is located just minutes from access to Warrior Trail # 16, from the town of  War for restaurants, gas and groceries, and from Berwind Lake for scenic route and relaxation.

There is parking available on both sides and in front of this house for trucks and trailers. You can ride your ATVs almost anywhere you want to go from this house.

Local grocery store and restaurants are only 7 minutes away. Most close by around 8 pm if not earlier. The gas station remains open until around 11 pm.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Smoking is allowed outside only.

All garbage must be bagged before putting in trash receptacles. 

Pets must be kept off the furniture.
sectionedDescription/interaction: Feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns, or if you just want advice on some of the Outlaw Trails.

sectionedDescription/description: Brand new cabin located in Welch overlooking Elkhorn Creek!! Very close to Hatfield & McCoy trails!! Plenty of parking for ATVs and trailers!!! Cabin is within walking distance to several amenities including a carwash!! Grab your trail pass, cold drinks, gas, & snacks at Welch Bantam Market. End your day of trail riding and grab a sandwich at Subway!! All right there at your convenience!! Please bring your linens and towels!!

primaryHost/about:
Christian Couple who loves to enjoy time together in the outdoors! We enjoy meeting new people, and spending time with family and friends.
We are parents, grandparents.. youth leaders, business owners... dog-lovers!
When we get a free moment we take off to WV to ride Four-wheelers with our friends and family. We love to discover new trails, sights, and attractions. 
We are new at hosting, but excited to share our home with others who love to get "out and about"!
sectionedDescription/access: Entire house is available. There is a basement which may contain some owner storage, but is accessible if anything in needed.
sectionedDescription/description:
ATV FRIENDLY: 3 Bedroom, 2 Bath house near War, WV. Easy Access to the new Hatfield McCoy trail system and Outlaw trails. Within 7 minutes to War, WV, and 10 minutes to Berwind Lake to enjoy fishing, swimming pool, and hiking. A 20 minute drive to Welch, WV to enjoy the historic town and movie theatre. Parking out front and in back for trailers. Park and ride! Just off Warrior#16.
Surrounding towns are ATV friendly and you can travel to most restaurants by ATV!

ATV FRIENDLY! Ideal for large family/large group gatherings. Spacious and Cozy cottage-style house with creek behind it, firepit, and charcoal grill. House has large dining and living space for groups to enjoy. Guests may bring air mattresses if more sleep space is needed. (Additional guest fees may apply).  Plenty of parking: in front, left side, and out back.

Entire house is available. There is a basement which may contain some owner storage, but is accessible if anything in needed.

We do not live close by, but we are available by phone or text to answer any questions or give recommendations.

Quiet residential neighborhood; on main road from War to Welch
Excellent location for access to Hatfield McCoy's newest trailhead: the Warrior Trail, and plenty of free local "Outlaw Trails" which lead you through scenic areas of creeks, hills, and small towns.

Roadside parking out front, and beside home. Parking for atv trailer out back with additional parking . Park, unload and ride ATVs anywhere you want to go.

Most restaurants in town close around 6, and the grocery stores close at 8. If you are arriving late, you may need to plan accordingly.

additionalHouseRules:
Not suitable for infants and young toddlers due to safety issues, example, the home has stairs and there are no baby gates or cribs yet.

We ask, before checking out please leave the house as you found it. Please clean up what you have used. Thank you for being our guest.

1. Clean out the refrigerator and microwave then put the dishes in the dishwasher and please start it. Wipe down anything in the kitchen that has been used. 

2.  Put dirty towels in the hamper in the washroom. 

3. Sweep if needed, And take out the garbage to trash cans outside. 

4. Do Not remove bed sheets or spread. The housekeeper will remove for laundry.
 
5. Turn off heat/ air conditioner and lights in each room. 
  
6. Text CHECKED OUT through Airbnb App

Thank you for coming!

primaryHost/about:
Hello, we are Debbie and Wayne Muncy and we’re  excited to have been hosting since 2020. Wayne is a minister and we have worked in ministry for years. Wayne also works full time as a custodian and I am a retired nurse.  We currently take care of my mother and another lady who has been a part of our family for 23 years. We have two grown children and two little grandsons. 
We live here locally and have all of our lives. Our goal for our guests is to have a pleasant and enjoyable visit while here in WV. Please feel free to contact us anytime during your stay. We’d be happy to assist you.
sectionedDescription/access:
There is PARKING in front of the house, back and side, as well as, in the back across the alley road directly behind the house. The whole area is graveled. When unloaded there’s room to park. If you have several trailering, there is EXTRA PARKING available at the school located 4 houses down at the back entrance. It is very easy to see, can’t miss it. 
The water hose is on the FRONT side of the house if you need to wash off your ride. You can pull up an park there or pull the hose around the front to the other side and back if you’d like.
The storage building in back yard is not accessible to guests, neither is the basement.
sectionedDescription/description:
Located approximately 8 minutes to the Hatfield McCoy Warrior Trail System. We are on Rt 16, part of the”Head of the Dragon” Motorcycle Riding Route in Caretta, WV.  You will have easy access to “The Warrior trail” at Caretta or at War. 
The house  sleeps 9 and there's space for addition air mattresses. We have gravel parking in the front, back and side of property. There is a HOT water on demand system, Cable TV, WiFi, kitchen, and washer/Dryer.

You can access the trail from Caretta or ride over to War which is a 6 min ride to Grants Supermarket🍎🍉🥦🥑and the local restaurants, The Owl,🌭🍟
The Holy Moly Cafe🍔🥗🍕🍽🥧 also 
Taco Todd’s 🌮and, A Scoop of Heaven 🍧🍦🧋
You can get gas ⛽️ at Hillbilly Market and purchase Trail permits. We also have Walgreens and a Dollar General. A two minute drive through town will take you to the Warrior Trailhead. You may travel anywhere on your ATV, or SxS.
Berwind Lake is about 4 miles from War. There’s fishing, Canoeing, picnics and a beautiful hiking trail to walk around the lake. The 💧lakes swimming pool 💧is open this season.
At  the upper end of the lake you can ride a dirt road across barewallow hollow which is a beautiful adventurous ride.

There is PARKING in front of the house, back and side, as well as, in the back across the alley road directly behind the house. The whole area is graveled. When unloaded there’s room to park. If you have several trailering, there is EXTRA PARKING available at the school located 4 houses down at the back entrance. It is very easy to see, can’t miss it. 
The water hose is on the FRONT side of the house if you need to wash off your ride. You can pull up an park there or pull the hose around the front to the other side and back if you’d like.
The storage building in back yard is not accessible to guests, neither is the basement.

We live locally and encourage you to contact us with any questions or assistance you may need. We would be glad to help with directions or points of interest. It is our goal to help your stay be enjoyable.

We are just a 6 minute ride to War, WV where we have Grants supermarket. There is a Walgreens, Dollar General, Hillbilly Market (where you can gas up your ATV). Restaurants are Holy Moly Cafe, The Owl, Taco Todd’s  and A scoop of Heaven across the street from the Dollar General. 
The Warrior Trail Head is in War, WV and the trail office to obtain trail passes. Berwind Lake is approximately 4 miles from War, WV  there is a pool at the lake. 
We are only a 20 min ride to Welch, WV from the house and Coalwood is 10 minutes, where there is a Country Corner Store on main road and gas available. At Coalwood you can take frog level road to the end and go to Wilmore dam

Welch has a Wendy’s, Goodsons Supermarket, McDonalds, Subway, KFC, PIzza Hut, Walgreens, and Welch Community Hospiital. A must try is the Sterling Drive In. You can find them online or look in our guidebook on  this listing. There is the Pocahontas Theater. In Welch, WV, and Linkous Park is in Welch.

Our county is ATV friendly. You are welcome to ride your ATV wherever you may want to go.

name: 3-storey log cabin, in private woodland setting
sectionedDescription/description: This spacious 3-story log cabin, features all the conveniences one could wish for. The total square footage of 1800 can comfortably house 8 people. There is a wrap around deck over looking 10 acres of private woodland. Perfectly located, just behind the golf course of Pipestem State Park(hiking, fishing, horseback riding, ziplines, full 18 and 9 hole golf course and lots of other seasonal activities) and only a mile away from McKeever Lodge

accessibilityModule/amenities/0/descript: The room is on the ground floor or accessible by a lift or ramp, and there are no stairs, steps, or thresholds higher than 2 inches (5 centimeters) between the guest entrance and the room.
accessibilityModule/seeAllSummary: This host has reviewed their place for accessibility features. Wide entrances are at least 32" (81cm).
additionalHouseRules:
Additional rules

-Please do not use water hose to wash your machines. The water hose is to be used to spray off muddy clothes only. 

- Please be courteous and remove muddy clothes and boots either outside or in mud room/laundry room. 

-Please do not place muddy clothes in the washer without being sprayed off with water hose first. 

-Please do not use our white bath towels to clean up your machine. 

- Please place all used towels in the hamper located in the bathroom before departure. 

- Guests are responsible to wash all dishes before departure.

- Guests are responsible for making sure the grill is cleaned up after each use. 

-Gather all sheets on beds used and place them in the laundry basket located in the laundry room before departure.

- The house is located in close proximity to wooded areas with wildlife. Please DO NOT feed the Deer or Bears.

-Do not leave any trash or food outside.

- Guests are responsible to clean up any spills and messes they make.

- Place full trash bags in the container outside for pickup.

-No Offroad Vehicles allowed in front yard, on back porch or outside the graveled area.

-If additional parking is needed we have a large parking area about 100 yards from the property for large trailers and trucks. 

- You may not book if you live locally without asking for permission and letting us know why you need a place in town.

- To protect the host and guest, we must verify all guests ahead of the stay. Please be aware: As a part of the verification process, you may be asked to provide a copy of your official government-issued photo ID, confirm your contact information, and pass through our guest portal. The information is collected for screening and verification only and is not stored or used for any other purposes.

- You understand that your check-in instructions will be sent after successfully completing the guest portal.
 
- THERE WILL BE A $500 CHARGE FOR SMOKING, PARTYING, OR BREAKING ANY OTHER HOUSE RULES!
 
- Please do not bring glitter, confetti, etc. to any of our properties.
 
- Please ensure that you review the cancellation policy as it pertains to any cancellation for any COVID-19 reason. We encourage guests to purchase travel insurance because we cannot operate outside of our cancellation policy for any reason.

- Due to our close proximity to wooded areas, we have a large population of insects, including ladybugs, house flies, stink bugs, millipedes, carpenter bees, and wasps. Although all of our properties are sprayed regularly by a professional pest control company, the mountains are not. During various times of the year, these insects may find their way into the property. By booking, you understand that is a possibility during your stay and understand that there will be no refunds related to bugs getting into the property. We will be happy to work with you to get pest control back out if necessary. 

Hillbilly Rentals, LLC’s Vacation Rental Terms and Conditions  (the “Terms”) apply. Renter will receive and agrees to sign the Terms immediately after making reservation, which will include, but not be limited to, the following:
 - The “Minimum Age” to rent the Property is 18 years of age.
 - By booking you agree to provide a copy of a valid government-issued ID directly to us. We will request this after your reservation has been made
 - The Renter is solely responsible for Renter’s actions and the actions of all family members, guests, and invitees.
 - Noise audible outside the Property is prohibited between 11 p.m. and 7 a.m.
 - Unless authorized by the Property Manager, the number of people present at the Property may not exceed the maximum occupancy indicated in the listing or the reservation for the Property.
 - Check-in is 4:00PM and Check-out is before 11:00 AM.
 - If you do not vacate by check-out time, you authorize us to charge a late departure fee of up to one night’s rental and we may remove all Occupants and their personal property from the Property.
 - No smoking is permitted on the inside of the Property at any time. 
 - No animals or pets of any kind are permitted at the Property except bona fide service animals that we are required by law to allow.
 - Renter authorizes us to bill the credit card on file for the full amount of the Rental Fee at the time of booking.  Renter agrees not to make chargeback claims with its credit or debit card issuer.

 - Neither the Property Manager nor the Owner will be liable for special, incidental, or consequential damages of any kind, including bunk beds on the property.
 - Upon your arrival at the Property, you should inspect the rental unit to ensure the Property condition is to your satisfaction. If you find any conditions you need to report as unsatisfactory or damaged upon your arrival, you should report such conditions within two hours after the time you arrive at the Property. After the two-hour period expires, the Property is provided as is and we are not responsible for the interoperability or unavailability of any amenities.

sectionedDescription/description:
⚡️This home is an absolute must see!⚡️ Fully furnished 5 bedroom 2 bath sleeps 14 people. Very quiet neighborhood, owned and operated by owners of Logan Motorcycle Sales authorized Honda, Yamaha, Polaris and Kawasaki dealer with all your Powersports needs. 💥Located 3 miles from downtown Logan, Bearwallow Trail connector, 10 miles to Devil Anse, Rockhouse, and Buffalo Mountain connectors.💥Ride your machine from the house to everything you would ever need or want.

The home is completely furnished with all brand new furniture and appliances. Fire pit and game room for guests to enjoy.

I will be available during your stay if needed and I can keep in touch through text.

We have a huge gravel parking pad located at the home. However if you need more space for parking we have additional parking located 100 yards from the house that is under surveillance for your piece of mind.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
Additional rules

-Please do not use water hose to wash your machines. The water hose is to be used to spray off muddy clothes only. 

- Please be courteous and remove muddy clothes and boots either outside or in mud room/laundry room. 

-Please do not place muddy clothes in the washer without being sprayed off with water hose first. 

-Please do not use our white bath towels to clean up your machine. 

- Please place all used towels in the hamper located in the bathroom before departure. 

- Guests are responsible to wash all dishes before departure.

- Guests are responsible for making sure the grill is cleaned up after each use. 

-Gather all sheets on beds used and place them in the laundry basket located in the laundry room before departure.

- The house is located in close proximity to wooded areas with wildlife. Please DO NOT feed the Deer or Bears.

-Do not leave any trash or food outside.

- Guests are responsible to clean up any spills and messes they make.

- Place full trash bags in the container outside for pickup.

-No Offroad Vehicles allowed in front yard, on back porch or outside the graveled area.

-If additional parking is needed we have a large parking area about 100 yards from the property for large trailers and trucks. 

- You may not book if you live locally without asking for permission and letting us know why you need a place in town.

- To protect the host and guest, we must verify all guests ahead of the stay. Please be aware: As a part of the verification process, you may be asked to provide a copy of your official government-issued photo ID, confirm your contact information, and pass through our guest portal. The information is collected for screening and verification only and is not stored or used for any other purposes.

- You understand that your check-in instructions will be sent after successfully completing the guest portal.
 
- THERE WILL BE A $500 CHARGE FOR SMOKING, PARTYING, OR BREAKING ANY OTHER HOUSE RULES!
 
- Please do not bring glitter, confetti, etc. to any of our properties.
 
- Please ensure that you review the cancellation policy as it pertains to any cancellation for any COVID-19 reason. We encourage guests to purchase travel insurance because we cannot operate outside of our cancellation policy for any reason.

- Due to our close proximity to wooded areas, we have a large population of insects, including ladybugs, house flies, stink bugs, millipedes, carpenter bees, and wasps. Although all of our properties are sprayed regularly by a professional pest control company, the mountains are not. During various times of the year, these insects may find their way into the property. By booking, you understand that is a possibility during your stay and understand that there will be no refunds related to bugs getting into the property. We will be happy to work with you to get pest control back out if necessary. 

Hillbilly Rentals, LLC’s Vacation Rental Terms and Conditions  (the “Terms”) apply. Renter will receive and agrees to sign the Terms immediately after making reservation, which will include, but not be limited to, the following:
 - The “Minimum Age” to rent the Property is 18 years of age.
 - By booking you agree to provide a copy of a valid government-issued ID directly to us. We will request this after your reservation has been made
 - The Renter is solely responsible for Renter’s actions and the actions of all family members, guests, and invitees.
 - Noise audible outside the Property is prohibited between 11 p.m. and 7 a.m.
 - Unless authorized by the Property Manager, the number of people present at the Property may not exceed the maximum occupancy indicated in the listing or the reservation for the Property.
 - Check-in is 4:00PM and Check-out is before 11:00 AM.
 - If you do not vacate by check-out time, you authorize us to charge a late departure fee of up to one night’s rental and we may remove all Occupants and their personal property from the Property.
 - No smoking is permitted on the inside of the Property at any time. 
 - No animals or pets of any kind are permitted at the Property except bona fide service animals that we are required by law to allow.
 - Renter authorizes us to bill the credit card on file for the full amount of the Rental Fee at the time of booking.  Renter agrees not to make chargeback claims with its credit or debit card issuer.
 - Events and commercial photography or filming are prohibited at the Property without our express written permission.
 - Use of the Property for any criminal activity is prohibited.
 - Neither the Property Manager nor the Owner will be liable for special, incidental, or consequential damages of any kind, including bunk beds on the property.
 - Upon your arrival at the Property, you should inspect the rental unit to ensure the Property condition is to your satisfaction. If you find any conditions you need to report as unsatisfactory or damaged upon your arrival, you should report such conditions within two hours after the time you arrive at the Property. After the two-hour period expires, the Property is provided as is and we are not responsible for the interoperability or unavailability of any amenities.
 - You further agree to give us a reasonable amount of time to respond to your report and to cooperate with our efforts to address the concern or provide a remedy.
 - You acknowledge that you may be required to undergo a background check if mandated by the property management company or the building, as stated in accordance with your rental agreement and condition of the booking.

sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy two whole floors of great gathering place...
sectionedDescription/description:
To do our part during COVID 19: Parties and events are not allowed.
Why rent a house or cabin when you rent the whole mountain!
PIPESTEM PARK JUST ADDED A WORLD CLASS ZIP LINE PARK! 
Ultimate Outdoors-ATV'ing, Rafting, Zip Lining, Lakes, Rivers, Golfing, Horse Riding, Hunting... and more!
Close to Interstate 77 exit 14 only 7 minutes. You’ll love my place because of the views, the highest lodge in Mercer County WV. Great for couples, business travelers, families, and up to 14 adults.

Over4000 sq ft of mountaintop home with 2000 sq ft wrap-around deck, sliding doors in every room. 7-Bedrooms and you can roam the whole mountain!

Enjoy two whole floors of great gathering place...

7 minutes from Pipestem State Park, 20 minutes from Winter Place Ski Lodge, 20 minutes from Bluestone Lake, 15 minutes from the New River... an surrounded by awesome nature. Just 14 minutes from exit 9 on interstate 77 where all the major chains are available, Wal Mart, Out Back, Chili's, Applebees, Mc Donalds, Taco Bell and many more!

name: Winterplace Condo E306
photos/10/caption: Newly Painted E building and Lodge
primaryHost/about: My husband and I grew up here in WV and love the area.  There is so much to do outdoors, and the scenery is wonderful. Our family loves spending time by the water (lakes and rivers) in the summer and playing in the snow in the winter.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Slow down and enjoy mountain views and breezes from your private deck. Try this condo in our off season (spring - fall) and enjoy a quiet place when your not out exploring WV. In winter, ski in and out from this condo onto the slopes of Winterplace Ski Resort. This condo is located on the third floor and the deck overlooks the 'Last Chance' and 'Last Run' trails. It is also close to Beckley and Princeton, Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve and southern WV whitewater country. During the ski season, we offer discounted equipment rentals from Ski Celebrations for all of our guests and for groups of 15 or more discounted lift tickets as well.
The condo sleeps up to 10, great for a large family or a couple of small families with separate bathrooms or for those that just want some space and privacy that you can't get in a hotel. Large deck to enjoy the views from.
~ Details ~
~ Sleeps: up to 10  (for stays under 10 days) 
~ Bedroom 1: (Master) 1 Queen Size Bed with attached bath
~ Bedroom 2: 1 Queen Size Bed & 1 Twin Cot
~ Bunk-room: 2 Twin Size Beds
~ Living Room: L shaped couch and full size futon
~ 2 Full Bathrooms
~ Cable TV in Living Room, Bedroom 1 and Bedroom 2
~ Fully Equipped Kitchen
~ Ski Rack
~ Pets welcome with paid pet fee  (for stays under 10 days)  Contact us for more details.
~ Private deck with views of Winterplace Ski Resort 
~ Closest to the Lift Number 1 and Highland Run
The kitchen is totally equipped with all the essentials, including crock pot, coffee maker, pots and pans, a built-in microwave, dishwasher and everything that you need for your vacation. 
The living room consist of an electric fireplace and a view out the sliding glass doors onto the slopes. The master bedroom has a queen bed with a bath and views of the mountains.
Everything you need to create great family memories!
The condo has electric baseboard heaters in each room, so you can adjust the heat to the temperature that you prefer when it's cold outside. When it's hot, there is an AC unit installed in the living room above the sliding glass door. This is for AC only. We are not allowed to do duct work in the 2nd or 3rd floor condos, so this is the only practical way to get AC in the unit, leaving room doors open as often as possible helps to keep the whole condo cool.
Please be aware there will be a $200 security deposit that will be pre-authorized on your credit card the day before you arrive and is released 7 days after you depart unless there is damage. This is a standard practice for vacation home rentals as there is no staff at the facility and this allows you to check in with an electronic door code and check out by just texting us and leaving the morning of your last day.
Also, the road to the condos is a gravel, hilly, road that Winterplace Ski Resort is paid to take care of it. Sometimes through the year, we will have heavy rains that create ruts in the road and Winterplace Ski Resort, being closed, is slow in making the repairs. Low clearance vehicles will need to be very careful coming up the hill from Winterplace Ski Resort's main parking area. In the winter, they grade the road and keep it plowed and put cinders on the road but please be prepared and understand you may need a four wheel drive, all wheel drive or chains to help get up the hill.
We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to www.InsureMyTrip.com for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsuraneMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.
~Long Term Stays ~
For those looking to stay for more than a week, the following changes apply:
- We only allow 3 people to stay per condo
- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Most of our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of. There are several state and national parks near by, like Little Beaver State Parkand Grandview National Park. We are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarack has everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

- No pets allowed
- We do not provide daily maid service but will provide clean linens weekly. 
Please contact us for further information.
WINTERPLACE SKI-IN SKI-OUT CONDOS
Enjoy skiing or snowboarding right outside your door while staying on the slopes at Winterplace Resort. Easy access to all the runs. Most of our condos are located on the top (3rd) floor with great views. Winterplace also offers snow-tubing runs and a snowboard terrain park. Winterplace Resort is conveniently located only 5 minutes from I-77 at the Ghent exit.
NEAR BECKLEY AND WHITEWATER COUNTRY
During the spring, summer and fall don’t think there is nothing to do. We are close to all the fun that southern West Virginia has to offer. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, river tubing, rock climbing, hiking, horseback riding etc. All different kinds of outdoor fun are waiting for you to take advantage of. There are several state and national parks near by, like Little Beaver State Parkand Grandview National Park. We are also near Summit Bechtel Family National Scout Reserve. The temperature in the mountains of West Virginia remains cooler than a lot of the surrounding states, so this is great place to come cool off. Enjoy something different from the beach, take your family out into nature.
And for anytime of the year fun, Beckley has something for everyone. Of course, there are all your favorite fast food and sit down restaurants, as well as some home-grown restaurants that might become your new favorites. There is a wide variety of different shops. The Tamarack has everything you might want to see from our unique West Virginia craftsman. There are a lot of different antique shops and Crossroads Mall for those that might want something a little familiar. There is the Beckley Exhibition Coal Mine, where you can tour an actual coal mine and let the kids explore the coal mining town and the Youth Museum. During good weather, there are also trails, playground, basketball and tennis courts and a pool with a waterslide. There is also, Mountain State Miniature Golfwhich doesn’t have just mini-golf but offers a small coffee shop and an indoor climbing wall. Beckley is a great place to spend a few days exploring all it has to offer and it’s only a quick drive up Interstate 77.

primaryHost/about:
Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Partake in endless outdoor activities while staying at ‘Snowed Inn,’ a ski-in/ski-out 4-bedroom, 3-bath Ghent vacation rental cabin! The property offers a kitchen to prepare home-cooked meals, a TV to watch your favorite shows, and a gas grill to cook outdoors. Friends and family will enjoy instant access to Winterplace Ski Resort, West Virginia's most southern ski mountain. Ski, snow tube, hike, and so much more before relaxing at this charming home!

* NOTE: Due to Covid-19, the Lodge at Winter Place is currently closed *

Bedroom 1: Queen Bed, Twin Bed | Bedroom 2: Queen Bed | Bedroom 3: Queen Bed | Bedroom 4: 2 Queen Beds | Second Floor Living Room: Queen Sleeper Sofa, Twin Sleeper Sofa | Third Floor Living Room: Queen Sleeper Sofa, Twin Sleeper Sofa, Twin Bed 

Upon arrival to this two-story 2,000-square-foot cabin, drop off your bags and strap on your skis to immediately shred the snowy hills of Winterplace Ski Resort! You'll love the option of returning home when you desire while your fellow guests continue to play in the frozen landscape. 

During your downtime, relax in the warm living area featuring family-friendly entertainment on the flat-screen cable TV and sumptuous leather couches. If you find yourself feeling crowded, head upstairs to the third floor, boasting an additional living area with a second flat-screen cable TV and quaint kitchenette. 

After a strenuous day outside, you'll be ready for a delicious homemade meal! Whip up whatever you're craving the in the fully equipped kitchen and savor it around the 6-person dining table. 

Thoroughly tired, retreat to one of the 3 comfortable bedrooms found on the second floor or venture upstairs to the third floor to dream in 2 plush queen-sized beds. No matter where you sleep in the home, you're guaranteed to wake up feeling refreshed and ready for the next adventure!

** Please note that this unit is the 2nd and 3rd floor of a 3-story chalet with separate entrances so there may be other travelers staying on the 1st floor during your stay **

Evolve makes it easy to find and book properties you’ll never want to leave. You can relax knowing that our properties will always be ready for you and that we’ll answer the phone 24/7. Even better, if anything is off about your stay, we’ll make it right. You can count on our homes and our people to make you feel welcome--because we know what vacation means to you.

Located at the base of Winterplace Ski Resort, this home allows you to wake up to views of skiers and snowboarders riding the lift up to the top of the mountain. Join the fun on the 27 trails ranging from easy-to-difficult terrain served by 9 lifts! 

Additionally, snowboarders will love testing their skills on rails, tabletops, and other obstacles including a half-pipe. If you can't make it out during the day, hit the illuminated runs at night! 

Everyone will adore speeding down one of the 10 lanes at West Virginia's largest snow tubing park! If you prefer a slower pace, relax at one of the several restaurants while you enjoy a refreshing beer and warm meal. You might also enter into the Karaoke Contest on Saturdays to win cool prizes! 

If you visit during the warmer months, seek out scenic hikes at destinations such as Bluestone State Park or Pipestem Resort State Park, both located within 19 miles of the home. Afterward, enjoy a family picnic, swim, or even horseback ride! Adrenaline junkies might prefer whitewater rafting down the New River or rock climbing in the New River Gorge!

Furthermore, you'll find golf courses such as Glade Springs Resort Golf Course, fun events like art festivals, and delicious restaurants including Skyline Lodge all within a close distance to the property.

Key Residence Features:
- Amenities include a fully equipped kitchen, kitchenette, gas grill, 2 flat-screen cable TVs, linens/towels, in-unit laundry machines, free WiFi, complimentary toiletries, air conditioning, 10 driveway parking spots, and so much more 
- Incredible Ghent location at the base of Winterplace Ski Resort - Ski, snowboard, and snow tube instantly during your stay at this ski-in/ski-out rental property! In addition, you're also close to scenic hikes, golfing, and other outdoor activities!
- Nearest Commercial Airport: Greenbrier Valley Airport (~59 miles away)

additionalHouseRules:
You should receive and acknowledge these rules prior to check in. They are provided for the safety, security, and protection of our guests, the owners, and the property. 

Please know that you can contact us anytime if you have a question or issue. We have family locally that can assist if needed.  Kristen’s cell phone number is (540)239-6882.  In case of an emergency, call 911 - the house address is 1120 Big Ridge Road, Independence, VA 24348. 

Base rules
   o NO SMOKING inside the house!  If you smoke, please do so outside, away from the house. Please clean up after yourself, and do not leave cigarettes or butts on the property. 
   o Please only park in the driveway, and do not drive across the yard or fields. Even though the house is privately situated in a rural area, we recommend locking your cars and not leaving valuables or food that might attract wildlife in your car.
   o Be sure to lock the house when you leave and at night.  This is for your safety. 
   o You may close the front gate at any time during your stay using the chain and snaplinks, but do not lock the padlock. Guests do not have the padlock key, and locking the gate could impede emergency services if needed. The gate will be open when you check in. 
   o There are two owner’s closet areas with locked doors, one upstairs in the loft area and one in the basement. In addition there are two sheds outside. We are the only key holder’s to these areas; please don't attempt to open or access those spaces. 
   o Trash: We will leave trash bags and cleaning supplies in the pantry closet in the kitchen, and under the bathroom sinks. At the end of your stay, make sure to bag all your trash for easy removal. County trash pickup is on Friday mornings, so if your booking includes a Friday morning, please feel free to use the service. Just have the bags of trash by the mailbox no later than 8:00am.  Please do not leave the bags out overnight, critters will get in the trash and make a huge mess.
   o Do not alter, adjust, or disconnect any electronics or connections to the network router, wifi, security system, or other connected devices without express permission.  You may manually adjust the thermostat to your comfort; but if you have a problem, or the HVAC doesn't seem to be working correctly, contact us immediately.
   o Do not use the fireplace without express permission. This is for your safety. 
   o Do not rinse heavy grease or other chemicals down drains. Dispose of large food scraps and/or grease in the trash, the garbage disposal is for small crumbs and plant matter only. Do not flush items other than bodily waste and toilet paper in the toilets. The house uses a septic system that will be damaged by draining or flushing non-degradeable materials. You may use the garbage disposal for rinsing light food waste, but for larger waste, feel free to deposit food scraps etc. in the woodline away from the house. 
   o There is a dehumidifier available in the basement. If you use it, please be sure to drain the basin if it fills up. 
   o Feel free to use the Roku television apps, but do not make purchases from accounts other than your own. If you log into your own accounts, be sure to log off before you leave, for your protection.

Checking out 
   o Please be courteous, and tidy up. Place all trash in bags or trash cans.
   o Load and run the dishwasher, handwash any non dishwasher-safe items, and leave them out to dry on a rack or pad. 
   o Leave bath and bed linens where they can be easily found. 
   o Check to be sure you haven't left anything behind. 
   o Turn off lights, and close and lock all windows and doors.
   o Return the house keys to the key lockbox, and reset the dials. 

Occupancy Rules
   o We do not allow extra guests to sleep at our Airbnb unless previously agreed upon during the booking process. Seven (7) is the maximum number of guests in the house.
   o No unregistered guest allowed due to insurance requirement.
   o Minimum age to rent the property is 24 years old. 
   o NO PARTIES or special events are allowed on the property without express prior written consent from the owners.  We will send an amended house rules document to cover any parties or special events we approve.
   o Pets are not allowed.

Outdoor Safety
   o Be aware there are wild and possibly dangerous animals on the property.  
   o No hunting, trapping, or game activities are allowed on the property. 
   o Respect property boundaries when exploring. Fencing exists along much of the property boundary, but all property lines are marked with orange blaze rings around trees approximately every 25 to 50 yards, and outward facing posted signs every 50 to 100 yard. If you think you've inadvertently left the property, it's ok, the neighbors are nice, but please retrace your path back. 
   o Do not wander in the woodline at night or in poor weather. Do not go down if you cannot come back up. There is steep and rough terrain throughout the property, including several cliffs and rock faces. We encourage you to seek adventure, but you are at your own risk, so do so within your capabilities. 

Care of Property
   o Please take care with the furniture and carpets. Accidents happen, but avoid putting wet items directly on wood surfaces, and be careful with food and drinks. If a spill occurs, clean it up quickly using provided supplies. 
   o Be courteous and take off muddy or wet shoes at the door and before walking into carpeted areas. 
   o If you break or damage anything, please let us know immediately. Guests will be liable for any broken items or damage to the property due to negligence or malice, but more importantly, even in the case of an accident we want to make sure the problem is corrected for your safety. Ok

name: Whitetail Spur - Panoramic Valley View!
photos/16/caption: Bedroom 2
photos/25/caption: Valley rainbow
photos/26/caption: Wedding venue
photos/30/caption: New for 2020: enjoy an evening around the fire just steps from the back patio.
primaryHost/about: Native Virginians with roots that span from the Tidewater to the Appalachians. Currently exploring central Florida.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take in stunning views of Elk Creek Valley and Jefferson National Forest from every room of this comfortable and updated home sitting at 3500ft elevation. Privately situated with all-weather access via a paved road off US-21. When you’re not exploring the country outside the gates, you can roam 48 acres of authentic Appalachian terrain right on the property. You’ll find unimproved wildlife trails through the forested hills, large rock formations, a seasonal spring, and a cascading stream.

Three bedrooms sleep seven comfortably (4 adults, 3 kids). The spacious new kitchen has everything you need to settle in for a while with all the necessities. Sip your coffee over breakfast, and take in a gorgeous panoramic sunrise over distant hills before heading out for the day. Marvel at the warm glow lighting the valley right from a large sectional sofa as the sun sets. Enjoy a night cap outside and see millions of stars and the sweep of the Milky Way as you haven’t seen it before in Virginia from the deck after the sun sets.

We have a stone fire pit just off the back patio. Guests can relax in the evenings around a fire regardless of the season, while still enjoying all of our magnificent views!

We're so happy to have you as guests, and we want to make sure your stay is amazing. While very accessible and convenient to many stores, the house is in a rural area, and you'll want to be prepared to make the most of your stay. Please contact us with any questions you have about the amenities here before check in. We aren't local but we can walk you through a remote check in ahead of time, and we have family just down the road to help. See the additional information in this listing for complete details; some details are only available to guests with reservations.

Only minutes from the town of Independence and its historic courthouse, restaurants, shops, and seasonal farmers markets, Whitetail Spur is convenient to countless attractions in southwest Virginia and nearby North Carolina.  Hike the Appalachian Trail at Mt. Rogers, Virginia’s highest peak; go tubing and kayaking on the New River; or take a cruise along the Blue Ridge Parkway. The area is the home of Bluegrass music, and hosts several festivals and themed events throughout the year. Tour area wineries and catch trout for dinner from one of the many state-stocked streams.

Whitetail Spur has a presence on social media. Search for us by name on popular platforms to see additional photos and updates, and to share your experience with friends. We only accept booking requests through registered members on Airbnb.

If you think you've inadvertently left the property, it's ok, the neighbors are nice, but please retrace your path back. 
   o Do not wander in the woodline at night or in poor weather. Do not go down if you cannot come back up. There is steep and rough terrain throughout the property, including several cliffs and rock faces. We encourage you to seek adventure, but you are at your own risk, so do so within your capabilities. 

Care of Property
   o Please take care with the furniture and carpets. Accidents happen, but avoid putting wet items directly on wood surfaces, and be careful with food and drinks. If a spill occurs, clean it up quickly using provided supplies. 
   o Be courteous and take off muddy or wet shoes at the door and before walking into carpeted areas. 
   o If you break or damage anything, please let us know immediately. Guests will be liable for any broken items or damage to the property due to negligence or malice, but more importantly, even in the case of an accident we want to make sure the problem is corrected for your safety. Ok
sectionedDescription/interaction: We're so happy to have you as guests, and we want to make sure your stay is amazing. While very accessible and convenient to many stores, the house is in a rural area, and you'll want to be prepared to make the most of your stay. Please contact us with any questions you have about the amenities here before check in. We aren't local but we can walk you through a remote check in ahead of time, and we have family just down the road to help. See the additional information in this listing for complete details; some details are only available to guests with reservations.
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie: Only minutes from the town of Independence and its historic courthouse, restaurants, shops, and seasonal farmers markets, Whitetail Spur is convenient to countless attractions in southwest Virginia and nearby North Carolina.  Hike the Appalachian Trail at Mt. Rogers, Virginia’s highest peak; go tubing and kayaking on the New River; or take a cruise along the Blue Ridge Parkway. The area is the home of Bluegrass music, and hosts several festivals and themed events throughout the year. Tour area wineries and catch trout for dinner from one of the many state-stocked streams.
sectionedDescription/notes: Whitetail Spur has a presence on social media. Search for us by name on popular platforms to see additional photos and updates, and to share your experience with friends. We only accept booking requests through registered members on Airbnb.
sectionedDescription/space:
Three bedrooms sleep seven comfortably (4 adults, 3 kids). The spacious new kitchen has everything you need to settle in for a while with all the necessities. Sip your coffee over breakfast, and take in a gorgeous panoramic sunrise over distant hills before heading out for the day. Marvel at the warm glow lighting the valley right from a large sectional sofa as the sun sets. Enjoy a night cap outside and see millions of stars and the sweep of the Milky Way as you haven’t seen it before in Virginia from the deck after the sun sets.

We have a stone fire pit just off the back patio. Guests can relax in the evenings around a fire regardless of the season, while still enjoying all of our magnificent views!
sectionedDescription/summary: Take in stunning views of Elk Creek Valley and Jefferson National Forest from every room of this comfortable and updated home sitting at 3500ft elevation. Privately situated with all-weather access via a paved road off US-21. When you’re not exploring the country outside the gates, you can roam 48 acres of authentic Appalachian terrain right on the property. You’ll find unimproved wildlife trails through the forested hills, large rock formations, a seasonal spring, and a cascading stream.

additionalHouseRules: Please load the dishwasher and run prior to leaving, as well as stripping the sheets and starting a load of laundry. If you do have pets, please dispose of pet waste. Please remove trash in the home to the outdoor trash bin. Trash must be in a trash bag before being placed in the bin. Thank you!

Situated on the corner of a four way country road that divides our farm, our home sits in the middle of rolling hills with gorgeous views.

The house, fenced in back yard, our pond across the road.

sectionedDescription/description:
Property includes Four Luxury Chalets, nestled together, on the property of Pipestem Spa and Event Center. Pipestem Resort State Park is directly across the street.  Luxury spa services and many chalet amenities are available (please book those online).  

Well behaved small pets allowed with prior approval. Pet fee is $35 fee Per Pet, Per Day, to be paid to host upon arrival. If host is not notified of animals being present, the guest may be asked to leave immediately.

Magnolia Chalet is a spotless, luxurious space for two, with king size bed, fireplace in the bedroom, spa tub, full kitchen, with dishwasher, w/d, sectional couch, 55" flat screen TV with premium channels, front porch, fire pit and BBQ grill (charcoal).

Complete privacy, guests have entire home to themselves. Contactless check-in. Guest will be sent an email with personal door code and Wi-Fi access one day before arrival.  Guest may arrive at any time after 4 PM and check out is 10 AM.

Pipestem Park is across the street, several wonderful restaurants nearby, and many outdoor recreational activities to enjoy, such as zip lining, horseback riding, swimming, fishing or hiking.

Romantic options include Chocolate Covered Strawberries, Champagne, Fruit and Cheese Tray, or spa services, such as  Romantic Couple's Massage with Foaming Milk Bubble Bath or King and Queen Packages, or consider an elopement, and get married or renew your vows. Details on our website, and must be reserved in advance.

name: Room 2 at Bramwell Adventures-2 Min. to Trail!
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/description:
Bramwell Adventures (formerly Bramwell ATV Resort) offers a comfortable stay in Appalachian paradise. Our 6 riverfront, pet-friendly* rentals are a minute from the Hatfield-McCoy trails. If fishing's more your thing the Bluestone River is right out back. White-water rafting on the world-renowned Gauley or New River, zip-lining, hiking, biking or horseback riding at Pipestem Resort State Park...whatever fun mountain stuff you're into, you'll find it nearby. *See Pet Policy in House Rules.

Room 2 is a single-room efficiency on the riverfront with a kitchenette, private bathroom and shower, 1 double bed, and

1 twin bed over a double bunk bed for a maximum capacity of 5 guests.  The kitchenette is equipped with a compact refrigerator, 2-eye hotplate, dishes, pots, pans, cooking and eating utensils, coffee pot and microwave oven. Rooms 1 and 2 are connected by a lockout door and may be rented together for a party of up to 12. WiFi is included, as well as onsite parking for trailers, trucks, and ATVs at no additional cost to our guests.

Holiday weekends during high season (April-October) require a three-night minimum stay. Off-season dates (November-March) require a two-night minimum stay.  Pets require an additional cleaning fee and guests must agree to pet policy.  (See House Rules for details.)  If you're interested in kayaking the Bluestone River, please speak with owner to make arrangements.

sectionedDescription/description:
Set in  a 10 acre wooden area right next to Pipestem state park, full log cabin with cathedral ceilings and loft room. 4 bedrooms, 3 baths, bathed in light, Jacuzzi tub in one bathroom, central air and heat, fully equipped kitchen, authentic log furniture. A stone fireplace with a pellet stove makes for cozy winters and above the fireplace.

The house offers easy access for those with moderate mobility problems, as we installed a gently sloping ramp between the parking lot and the front door.

Enjoy quiet wooded rural setting, just outside Pipestem state park

additionalHouseRules:
-Check-in: after 3:00 pm, Self check-in with keypad or Lockbox. Guest will be sent detailed check-in instructions 1 day prior arrival date on airbnb inbox. Access code will be provided for self-check in.
-Check-out: 10:00 am,  avoid extra day charge. 
-Before rental you need to submit the names of all occupants. 
-No subletting is allowed.   
-There shall NOT be smoking, vaping, e-cigarettes allowed inside the apartment. Extra cleaning fees ($1,000.00 dollars) minimum charge to remove odor and stains, eviction from Rental Unit.
-Pets are NOT allow in this property. Unauthorized Pets $500.00 dollars, plus any damages and additional cleaning cost incurred, eviction for rental unit without refund.
-Guest(s) are only allowed to be accompanied by members of the party, no additional visitor who is not member of the party or in the list.
-Damaged or Missing items varies depending on cost of items.
-Complaints, or potential warning issues, if necessary, eviction, without refund and a charge of up to $500.00 dollars.
-NO opening any of the windows.
-NO PARTIES or EVENTS
-PLEASE WASH YOUR DISHES after used; sink, dish-washing machine and soap are available.
-Excessive cleaning Up to $150.00 per hour of additional cleaning needed
-Prefer NO shoes in the apartment
-NO candles.
-Do not alter or tamper with security system, if you do, your stay will be immediately terminated without refund.
-There is no video surveillance monitoring in the interior of the apartment.
-For all stays over 28 days, we require access to the unit for maintenance, you will be inform one day before maintenance occurs. 
-We can provide you with a pack n play or toddler bed if you ask for one before you stay.
-Illegal downloads are forbidden.
-Before checking out, take out any food and garbage, trash must be in a trash bag. You will find the garbage bins outside down the stairs.
Thank you!
