name: Holston River House - a Sojourn in Serenity...
photos/0/caption: South Fork of the Holston River is your playground for trout fishing or just enjoying the majesty of nature.
photos/1/caption: Our home is designed and appointed for comfort and enjoyment.  Hot tub, open deck, covered porch, perched above the river yet close to town ensure your pleasure.
photos/2/caption: The mighty Holston River is a renowned hatchery supported trout fishing mecca.  We enjoy just sitting above and reflecting on our day.
photos/3/caption: The patio furniture on the deck is to die for...
photos/4/caption: The River House is so close to Abingdon, the Barter Theater, Virginia Creeper Trail, national forest, Marion, Bristol Motor Speedway, Mt. Rogers and more!
photos/5/caption: Peace and quiet abounds on the Holston River in Adwolfe section of Marion, VA.
photos/6/caption: In season you will love the flowers from knock-out roses and azaleas to burning bushes, rhododendron, mountain laurel and more.
photos/7/caption: A mountain river getaway perched on a high bank that slopes to an easy river entry.  You can fish, sit on the bank in our Adirondack chairs, soak in the hot tub and let time roll by...
photos/8/caption: The abundant grounds of the river house are lovely for croquet, peace and quiet and privacy.
photos/9/caption: The River House combines the tranquility peace of nature with extraordinary proximity to Marion, Abingdon and all the amenities of Southwest Virginia.
photos/10/caption: Floating in the warm, wet wonder of the hot tub overlooking this world-class trout stream is an experience that will transport you from the stress of your workaday world to the sublime serenity of nature and contenment.
photos/11/caption: At night the colors and bubbles of the hot tub jets add texture to your experience as you sit above the river's rapids and underneath the mesmerizing, brilliant firmament of dazzling stars and moonlight.
photos/12/caption: Imagine a million ways of engaging this wonder of the world - the South Fork of the Holston River.  Fed by the cold pure mountain spring waters of Mt. Rogers, it is the quintessential habitat for trout.  But it's exquisite merely to meander along.
photos/13/caption: Sometimes our relation with family and friend merely needs time and space to rejuvenate and thrive.  Come, eat, talk and re-connect!
photos/14/caption: Our exquisitely set hot tub is easy to reach with robes and towel in the armoire at the patio door.  But you may linger on the patio furniture and absorb the grandeur of the river.
photos/15/caption: Our home makes it easy to enjoy this magnificent river.  With almost thirty places to sit along and around the river, we've simply ensconced it with comfort.
photos/16/caption: Everything is easy at The River House.  Everything you need for a quiet getaway is right at your fingertips.
photos/17/caption: You'll find the flow and floor plan are easy to navigate and connect you to the covered porch and open deck while giving everyone as much privacy as they desire.
photos/18/caption: You will love the tufted leather furniture in the family room and how natural golden sunshine floods in the floor to ceiling windows.
photos/19/caption: Exquisite Persian Carpets dignify every room with a supple elegance.
photos/20/caption: Play board games at our many tables in almost any indoor or outdoor space you desire.
photos/21/caption: Our lovely day bed with trundle adds two sleeping berths besides our two bedrooms.  And then there are the luxurious sofas...
photos/22/caption: The hall bath is light and airy with attractive ceramic tile.
photos/23/caption: The master bedroom is an excursion into the realm of decadent luxury with a king bed, oriental rug, love seat all on pretty hardwood floors.
photos/24/caption: Our king-sized bed fitted with Macy's "Hotel Collection" finest thread-count cotton linens will leave you in the lap of luxury.
photos/25/caption: The queen bedroom is beautifully appointed with a stout brass rail and piquant artistic lamps.
photos/26/caption: The great room is our pride and joy with a panoply of fine pieces by Hooker, Ferguson-Copeland, Bob Timberlake and more.  The bohkara carpet elevates the entire room.
photos/27/caption: Our great room is your launching point to the open deck and hot tub.  Return to a blazing fireplace in cold weather or let the breeze blow through all summer.
photos/28/caption: Choose between nature or interior.  When you tire of exertion in natural majesty of the river, return inside or outside the River House to rejuvenate.
photos/29/caption: All the baths are clean, light, airy and convenient.
photos/30/caption: Did we say 8' billiard table in the lower level?  Ensconced with a widescreen TV and additional seating it's yet another place to repair privately for nice time with those we love.
photos/31/caption: River breezes are our favorite!  Simply sitting outside around sunrise or sunset are events of breathtaking beauty.
photos/32/caption: Some of the best conversations ensue at this table over grilled steaks, seafood and wine by the Holston River.
photos/33/caption: What we love about our patio is the heavy, supple, comfortable patio furniture.  Of course you'll also love the view and sound of the river and pastoral meadow setting.
photos/34/caption: The covered porch is a godsend on rainy days.  And don't forget about the large outbuilding with ping pong and plenty of sofas for a gallery of judges.
photos/35/caption: One of the problems is wherever you sit, you're looking at somewhere else beautiful.  You'll find yourselves walking everywhere just to absorb some more magic!
photos/36/caption: The sounds of the river totally permeate the covered porch.
photos/37/caption: We always find ourselves solving problems sitting around this heavy glass table surrounded by the sounds of the river.
photos/38/caption: This 8-person Jacuzzi hot tub is one of their flagship models with controls that allow increasing or decreasing jets, colors and currents.  The concrete walk keeps your feet free from debris and the bench make it easy in and out. Float over the river
photos/39/caption: Our storage building is the ultimate man cave.  On rainy days you can solve all the worlds problems right here.
photos/40/caption: Ping pong is fun especially on a quality table.  Open the overhead doors and party the night away.
photos/41/caption: You may own all the tea in China but you'll never know a higher grandeur than lolling above the banks of the South Fork of the Holston River.
photos/42/caption: Our job is to make being by the river easy to enjoy.  So we've got seats galore and unobtrusive safety lights on the river path so you can safely see the edge in the evening.  If you haven't accomplished a thing your whole visit, we've done our job.
photos/43/caption: Stay long enough and you'll begin to notice fine and subtle shades of difference in the time of day by color, sound, scent and sky.  You'll get back in rhythm with nature at the River House.
photos/44/caption: A Cornucopia of natural majesty awaits you at the River House.  Slow down, sit around and just watch people grow.   Get a whole new perspective on life and those you love in a long interlude at the River House.
photos/45/caption: Of the thirty some seats outdoors at the River House, we're sure you'll find your favorite spot.  But we think you'll like em all!
photos/46/caption: Another wonderful sunrise beside the Holston River.  Any direction you look holds sublime wonder and beauty.  From the river to the mountains to the farms, pastures and forests.  Come enjoy all of Southwest VA at the River House, then come back again
sectionedDescription/access:
Guests have private access to the entire 1.5 acre property - the cottage, outdoor spaces including open deck for grilling, 6 person aqua jet Jacuzzi, Adirondack chairs on 500+ ft of river frontage,  easy access to the river for fishing or wading, copper firepit (split wood provided), picnic table, hammock, level side yard for croquet, bocce ball, three Nel Lusso cruise bikes (helmets not provided).  Guests also have access to a pole style barn building with ping pong table and comfortable seating. 

Upon request host will provide trail maps for guests interested in hiking/walking neighboring 240 acres which boast spectacular mountain views and woodland trails. Picnic, take nature photos.  Surrounded by acres of freshly mowed hay and endless views of ancient mountains and hollows and verdant valleys, even the most jaded cynic will succumb to the beauty and majesty of nature.  Be prepared to experience lower blood pressure, slower heart rate, crystal clear thoughts.  Oh, I think I got carried away:)  You will, too!
sectionedDescription/description:
Natural splendor awaits you at The River House!  Perched on South Fork Holston River, a trout fly fishing mecca, it resonates tranquility.  The home is appointed by the finest in interior furniture and bedding.  Hike, bike, fly fish, tour nearby Mt Rogers, Grayson Highlands, Jefferson National Forest, VA Creeper Trail, or dine in historic Abingdon.  Take in small town vibe at First Friday in Marion.  Enjoy hot tub, ping pong, billiards, croquet, or lolling by the river.  Welcome!  Come enjoy!

The River House is a gorgeous, quiet getaway perched sublimely on the banks of the South Fork of the mighty Holston River in the Adwolfe area of pastoral Smyth County, Virginia.  Nestled peacefully on five hundred feet of this state-hatchery supported trout stream, you’ll find your cares slipping into oblivion regardless of which riverside Adirondack chair or seat in the hot tub you pick.  Here time disappears as your rhythm changes with days dissolving into dusk, sunsets become sunrises and back again.  The sound of the river will resonate in your soul.  Perfectly placed on a private triangle of land, it commands hundreds of feet on the river.  And if you need anything you’re equidistant to Marion or Chilhowie, and even closer to Jefferson National Forest, Mount Rogers, and Grayson Highlands State Park.  

Once you’re acclimated to the serene sounds and sights of this constantly coursing stream, you’ll grow to love the subtle and supple quality of The River House.  Pulling into the driveway you’ll come first to the covered porch with several seating spaces for those times when the rain washes the valley.  Off to the right, along the riverbank is a raised deck, jutting out over the stream.  Further down the bank, are a row of inviting Adirondack chairs.  As I am in this narrative, you’ll find yourself irresistibly drawn to the outside because of its unique, natural power and beauty.  But come inside for a minute.  Let’s cross the threshold.  Here’s a modest but updated kitchen, replete with a coffee bar beside the front door to accommodate company in the kitchen. From the kitchen window you’ll see a wonderful view of the river wending its way north.  Looking left, you’ll see a generous, sunny family room with a café table and six chairs, an exquisite, tufted, Cordovan leather sofa, matching chair, and daybed with trundle for an extra two sleeping berths.  Sink your bare feet into the burgundy wool and silk Persian carpet.  Walk through this sunny space and you’ll enter the hallway to the sleeping quarters.  On the right is the master bedroom appointed with a stout, king-sized furniture suite, another exquisite Persian carpet and carved floral love seat.  Across the hall is the guest bedroom with another compelling queen set.  Our choice of bedding is the Frontgate Resort line.  Linens are from Macy’s Hotel Collection.  Bedding is dried “en plein air,” so you’ll slumber in fragrant mountain sunshine.   We don’t want to anesthetize you, but you’ll love your slumber as much as your waking hours!  

Let’s step down to the lower level and see what’s going on there.  Taking the staircase from the kitchen, we alight on the lower level.  We think you’ll be delighted with the 8’ Brunswick billiards table appointed nicely with a green and buff Tiffany-style billiards light overhead.  Adjacent is an intimate two-chair café table, and wide-screen opposite.  Especially in inclement weather this is another nice and separate gathering space.  We make it easy for folks to converge and diverge. 

Back through the kitchen we come to the large gathering room with full bath.  Quietly dominating this space is a scarlet Bokhara Persian carpet – truly art underfoot.  The generous leather furnishings, glow of the fireplace and overall ambiance may invite you to linger longer than you intended.  In cold weather you’ll love the fireplace radiating warmth and light.  With the spa towels and robes in the nearby armoire, it’s tempting to take a turn in the hot tub.  

Open the patio doors and step out onto the open deck.  Out here you’re going to find your senses beset by a panoply of natural amenities competing for your attention.  You’ll see and hear the unique sounds of the river, the trees waving across green meadows in the wafting wind.  Depending upon how your day has gone, you may just decide to plop down here on the patio to relax and decide what to do next.  That may constitute nothing more than enjoying the experience of the The River House. This open deck is a natural gathering place for sitting, talking, eating and engaging with friends and family surrounded by nature’s bounty and beauty.

Or, grab your towels and robes and head for the spa.  Follow the sidewalk to the Jacuzzi six-person spa with lighting, aqua massage jets for a moment of pure relaxation on the banks of the Holston River letting the water work its wonder.  Others may prefer relaxing on the river-bank in one of the Adirondack chairs.  Recline in these comfy seats and contemplate nothing more than the moving waters.  Or light a campfire in the copper pit or carry a basket of goodies down to the picnic table.  For group lawn games, you can choose between ping-pong, croquet or bocce ball.  You can also access the adjacent storage building with ping pong table and comfortable sofas. 
Here you’ll find three easy-mount bicycles for pure holiday fun.  And if you’d rather hike, we’re happy to provide a trail map to some of the prettier vantage points on our adjacent 240 acres.  You can easily hike 1-5 miles and picnic out in the open with some of Smyth County’s most spectacular views.  Check out our trail maps.  Did we mention trout fishing!  And you can also content yourselves streaming video inside or roaming around outside with our wi-fi music speaker.  Just come have fun!

As you can see, The River House is an experience waiting to unfold beautifully and uniquely for all of our guests.  Hungry Mother State Park, Virginia Highlands Festival, Mount Rogers Naturalist Rally, Virginia Creeper Trail, Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, Appalachian Trail - endless opportunities for adventure are just minutes away.  Experience an outdoor adventure or quiet serenity.  Embrace togetherness or seek your own solitude.  However, you choose to personalize your own River House revels, we hope you leave with memories for a lifetime and long to return to do it all over again!  When you return to reacquaint yourselves with its magic, we’ll have everything ready and waiting for you.

Consider renting the river house for a romantic weekend, or a girlfriends only getaway, or a fly fishermen's holiday, or make up your own reason to spend time at the river house.  Maybe the river is calling you!

Guests have private access to the entire 1.5 acre property - the cottage, outdoor spaces including open deck for grilling, 6 person aqua jet Jacuzzi, Adirondack chairs on 500+ ft of river frontage,  easy access to the river for fishing or wading, copper firepit (split wood provided), picnic table, hammock, level side yard for croquet, bocce ball, three Nel Lusso cruise bikes (helmets not provided).  Guests also have access to a pole style barn building with ping pong table and comfortable seating. 

Upon request host will provide trail maps for guests interested in hiking/walking neighboring 240 acres which boast spectacular mountain views and woodland trails. Picnic, take nature photos.  Surrounded by acres of freshly mowed hay and endless views of ancient mountains and hollows and verdant valleys, even the most jaded cynic will succumb to the beauty and majesty of nature.  Be prepared to experience lower blood pressure, slower heart rate, crystal clear thoughts.  Oh, I think I got carried away:)  You will, too!

Host lives 5 minutes from The River House.  Personal cell number will be shared with confirmed guests upon request.

Adwolfe is a picturesque pastoral valley in the lea of Flat Ridge section of Iron Mountain adjacent historic Mount Rogers.  The valley is dominated by the South Fork of the mighty Holston River, a state hatchery supported trout fishing destination.  The peace and quite may be overwhelming to city dwellers.  The sounds of rippling water over age-old rounded stones, the brilliance of starlight above an open meadow,  the smell of newly mowed hay, the tickle of dew-wet grass between your toes,  the taste of  grilled trout paired with your favorite Sauvignon Blanc...

Where ever your senses carry you, we hope your river house experience will culminate in life-long memories of fun and affection shared with family and friends.
sectionedDescription/interaction: Host lives 5 minutes from The River House.  Personal cell number will be shared with confirmed guests upon request.
sectionedDescription/name: Holston River House - a Sojourn in Serenity...
sectionedDescription/neighborhoodOvervie:
Adwolfe is a picturesque pastoral valley in the lea of Flat Ridge section of Iron Mountain adjacent historic Mount Rogers.  The valley is dominated by the South Fork of the mighty Holston River, a state hatchery supported trout fishing destination.  The peace and quite may be overwhelming to city dwellers.  The sounds of rippling water over age-old rounded stones, the brilliance of starlight above an open meadow,  the smell of newly mowed hay, the tickle of dew-wet grass between your toes,  the taste of  grilled trout paired with your favorite Sauvignon Blanc...

Where ever your senses carry you, we hope your river house experience will culminate in life-long memories of fun and affection shared with family and friends.
sectionedDescription/space:
The River House is a gorgeous, quiet getaway perched sublimely on the banks of the South Fork of the mighty Holston River in the Adwolfe area of pastoral Smyth County, Virginia.  Nestled peacefully on five hundred feet of this state-hatchery supported trout stream, you’ll find your cares slipping into oblivion regardless of which riverside Adirondack chair or seat in the hot tub you pick.  Here time disappears as your rhythm changes with days dissolving into dusk, sunsets become sunrises and back again.  The sound of the river will resonate in your soul.  Perfectly placed on a private triangle of land, it commands hundreds of feet on the river.  And if you need anything you’re equidistant to Marion or Chilhowie, and even closer to Jefferson National Forest, Mount Rogers, and Grayson Highlands State Park.  

Once you’re acclimated to the serene sounds and sights of this constantly coursing stream, you’ll grow to love the subtle and supple quality of The River House.  Pulling into the driveway you’ll come first to the covered porch with several seating spaces for those times when the rain washes the valley.  Off to the right, along the riverbank is a raised deck, jutting out over the stream.  Further down the bank, are a row of inviting Adirondack chairs.  As I am in this narrative, you’ll find yourself irresistibly drawn to the outside because of its unique, natural power and beauty.  But come inside for a minute.  Let’s cross the threshold.  Here’s a modest but updated kitchen, replete with a coffee bar beside the front door to accommodate company in the kitchen. From the kitchen window you’ll see a wonderful view of the river wending its way north.  Looking left, you’ll see a generous, sunny family room with a café table and six chairs, an exquisite, tufted, Cordovan leather sofa, matching chair, and daybed with trundle for an extra two sleeping berths.  Sink your bare feet into the burgundy wool and silk Persian carpet.  Walk through this sunny space and you’ll enter the hallway to the sleeping quarters.  On the right is the master bedroom appointed with a stout, king-sized furniture suite, another exquisite Persian carpet and carved floral love seat.  Across the hall is the guest bedroom with another compelling queen set.  Our choice of bedding is the Frontgate Resort line.  Linens are from Macy’s Hotel Collection.  Bedding is dried “en plein air,” so you’ll slumber in fragrant mountain sunshine.   We don’t want to anesthetize you, but you’ll love your slumber as much as your waking hours!  

Let’s step down to the lower level and see what’s going on there.  Taking the staircase from the kitchen, we alight on the lower level.  We think you’ll be delighted with the 8’ Brunswick billiards table appointed nicely with a green and buff Tiffany-style billiards light overhead.  Adjacent is an intimate two-chair café table, and wide-screen opposite.  Especially in inclement weather this is another nice and separate gathering space.  We make it easy for folks to converge and diverge. 

Back through the kitchen we come to the large gathering room with full bath.  Quietly dominating this space is a scarlet Bokhara Persian carpet – truly art underfoot.  The generous leather furnishings, glow of the fireplace and overall ambiance may invite you to linger longer than you intended.  In cold weather you’ll love the fireplace radiating warmth and light.  With the spa towels and robes in the nearby armoire, it’s tempting to take a turn in the hot tub.  

Open the patio doors and step out onto the open deck.  Out here you’re going to find your senses beset by a panoply of natural amenities competing for your attention.  You’ll see and hear the unique sounds of the river, the trees waving across green meadows in the wafting wind.  Depending upon how your day has gone, you may just decide to plop down here on the patio to relax and decide what to do next.  That may constitute nothing more than enjoying the experience of the The River House. This open deck is a natural gathering place for sitting, talking, eating and engaging with friends and family surrounded by nature’s bounty and beauty.

Or, grab your towels and robes and head for the spa.  Follow the sidewalk to the Jacuzzi six-person spa with lighting, aqua massage jets for a moment of pure relaxation on the banks of the Holston River letting the water work its wonder.  Others may prefer relaxing on the river-bank in one of the Adirondack chairs.  Recline in these comfy seats and contemplate nothing more than the moving waters.  Or light a campfire in the copper pit or carry a basket of goodies down to the picnic table.  For group lawn games, you can choose between ping-pong, croquet or bocce ball.  You can also access the adjacent storage building with ping pong table and comfortable sofas. 
Here you’ll find three easy-mount bicycles for pure holiday fun.  And if you’d rather hike, we’re happy to provide a trail map to some of the prettier vantage points on our adjacent 240 acres.  You can easily hike 1-5 miles and picnic out in the open with some of Smyth County’s most spectacular views.  Check out our trail maps.  Did we mention trout fishing!  And you can also content yourselves streaming video inside or roaming around outside with our wi-fi music speaker.  Just come have fun!

As you can see, The River House is an experience waiting to unfold beautifully and uniquely for all of our guests.  Hungry Mother State Park, Virginia Highlands Festival, Mount Rogers Naturalist Rally, Virginia Creeper Trail, Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, Appalachian Trail - endless opportunities for adventure are just minutes away.  Experience an outdoor adventure or quiet serenity.  Embrace togetherness or seek your own solitude.  However, you choose to personalize your own River House revels, we hope you leave with memories for a lifetime and long to return to do it all over again!  When you return to reacquaint yourselves with its magic, we’ll have everything ready and waiting for you.

Consider renting the river house for a romantic weekend, or a girlfriends only getaway, or a fly fishermen's holiday, or make up your own reason to spend time at the river house.  Maybe the river is calling you!
sectionedDescription/summary: Natural splendor awaits you at The River House!  Perched on South Fork Holston River, a trout fly fishing mecca, it resonates tranquility.  The home is appointed by the finest in interior furniture and bedding.  Hike, bike, fly fish, tour nearby Mt Rogers, Grayson Highlands, Jefferson National Forest, VA Creeper Trail, or dine in historic Abingdon.  Take in small town vibe at First Friday in Marion.  Enjoy hot tub, ping pong, billiards, croquet, or lolling by the river.  Welcome!  Come enjoy!

additionalHouseRules:
Minimum age to rent is 25 years old.  Maximum guests are 22

No Smoking on property. Refundable deposit will not be returned if there is any sign of smoking or cigarette butts are left on the property. 

No events, parties, kegs or excessive drinking allowed. This is not the house for you if you intend to have a party. You may be asked to leave and no refund will be provided if there is an event, party or excessive drinking occurs. There are cameras monitoring the home. 

No pets allowed in the homes or on the property during your stay. 

Any issues with the house must be reported upon arrival. 
All checkout procedures must be completed before leaving.
Any damage or issues that occurred during your stay must be reported before checking out.

Any disregard for house rules may result in termination of the rental agreement and guests will be asked to leave before the end of the scheduled stay and will not be provided any refund.

sectionedDescription/access:
Guests have access to the whole house with keyless entry thorough doors on both the first and second level. 
Code provided prior to arrival. You will receive arrival information approximately one week before your stay and it will be available in the app.
sectionedDescription/description:
Highlander 1 - Sleeps up to 22 people! 6 Bedrooms, 3 bathrooms 2 Kitchens & living rooms with plenty of room to spreadout.
Located off of I-77 at Winterplace Ski Resort. 
Slopeside, ski-in/out in the winter. Close to rafting, climbing, hiking and biking in the New River National Park and several WV State Parks.
35-40 minutes to the New River Gorge area and super cool town of Fayetteville, WV. 20 minutes to Pipestem State Park,  Beckley or Princeton.

Enjoy starlit nights by the fire pit, grilling on the back deck, and comfortable space for you and all of your friends and family. 
This cabin can sleep up to 22 people.

Slopeside in the winter (ski in and ski out) and easy access to the best of West Virginia's recreation areas in the Spring, Summer, and Fall.

Feels like a secluded cabin in the woods, but has the convenience of a 2 minute drive to the highway. 

Highlander 1 sleeps up to 22 in beds (with 2 people in fulls & queens). We no longer have the pull out couches and limit the group to 24 people maximum.
Level 1: 
One bedroom with a queen bed 
One bedroom with a queen and full bed
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 2: 
One queen bedroom 
One bedroom with one queen and one twin
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 3: One bedroom with two full beds
One bedroom with two queen and two twin beds (has opening to cathedral ceiling above living room)

Guests have access to the whole house with keyless entry thorough doors on both the first and second level. 
Code provided prior to arrival. You will receive arrival information approximately one week before your stay and it will be available in the app.

Our Hospitality manager Linnea, is available during business hours 8am-6 pm if you need any assistance during your stay. You may reach her at 

If it is outside business hours you may contact me through the app.

This cabin is located at Winterplace Ski Resort - bustling in the winter, secluded and peaceful in the spring, summer and fall. Easy access to hiking, biking, and world class climbing and rafting in the New River Gorge. Pipestem State Park and Little Beaver State Park within 15 minutes. Beckley and Princeton within 30 minutes.

There are two cabins, side by side, identical to each other. Each sleeps up to 22 people.
PLEASE NOTE:
1. In the winter (high busy season), bed linens are provided, but TOWELS are not.  Please bring any bath towels you may need. Bath towels are provided off season but ONLY indoor bath towels. Please bring towels for any outdoor activities or use. Missing or damaged towels will be charged to the guest from the deposit. 

2. Starter supplies such as TP, paper towels, shampoo and trash bags are provided. Please bring your own supply of toilet paper, paper towels, trash bags, dish soap, toiletries, laundry detergent, etc. to have enough supplies for your stay.

name: Parker House
sectionedDescription/description:
The Parker House is a Beautifully decorated 1950's era home with amazing detail.  
It is 3 bedrooms and 2 full baths with 1 half bath, a living room kitchen dining room, and a back deck that leads to a shared courtyard. 
It is located in the Heart of Hintons Historic district, a gateway to The New River Gorge Nation Park.
You can enjoy the quiet getaway or can venture out to many close-by attractions such as Sandstone Falls, Winterplace Ski resort, water rafting, hiking trails and so much more.

There is an outside deck that leads to the shared courtyard, it has beautiful landscaping and is perfect for sipping that morning cup of coffee on. 
In the shared courtyard you will also find a gas grill that is ready to be fired up at all times and enjoyed by your family.

We are a non-hosted Bed and Breakfast that utilizes self-check-in. The day before arrival a hospitality specialist will call you and go over your check-in instructions and then will send you check-in codes.  We are available at all times if you need something so don't hesitate to call.
You will get a complimentary breakfast that is self-serve, cereal, oatmeal, milk, juice, water, and coffee.

The neighborhood is very quiet and surrounded by beautiful historical architecture, Perfect for an evening stroll. 
There are several small shops and a few restaurants within walking distance of the Parker house. 
If you want to venture out further there are many close-by attractions as well as 2 state parks and you are minutes away from public water access points. Hinton is surrounded by 3 rivers, The Greenbrier River, The New River, and Bluestone lake.

Hinton is very rural there are no buses or uber in our town at this time.

additionalHouseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

primaryHost/about: I love the outdoors, especially riding the trails and exploring the mountains. I grew up and raised my family here enjoying the vast offroad trails this area has to offer, often riding all day to return at dusk with my son on his 90cc and me on my 325 Polaris.  We offer our guests the same opportunity but now the trails are mapped and marked  to make exploring easier.
rootAmenitySections/1/subtitle: The host hasn't reported a carbon monoxide detector on the property.
sectionedDescription/access: Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.
sectionedDescription/description:
For the ultimate in space and privacy, "The Whole House" accommodates groups of up to 24 people with all the features of home. Enjoy private access to our outdoor swimming pool & direct access over 500 mi. Hatfield-McCoy Trails and Spearhead Trails!

The Whole House is all three of our units - the larger Blizzards Roost, and two smaller units the Coaldale Condo and Miners Den(ADA) - available to rent as a group and offered at a discounted rate. The top two floors (The Blizzards Roost) features 3 bedrooms and 2 full baths with a full kitchen, dining room, sun room, living room and a washer/dryer, range and dish washer. It has two HD TV's and a stereo connected to HD service with Wi-Fi coverage through-out the house. The lower floor units (Coaldale Condo and Miners Den) are connected by a lock-out door and feature a combined 4 bedrooms and 2 full baths 1ADA,, a full kitchen and a half kitchen, a stacked washer/dryer unit and three TVs, one is a smart TV. All three units are fully equipped with towels, linens, utensils, coffeemaker's and crock pot's, stove/oven or hotplate, full size fridge's, microwave's - basically everything you need to feel right at home. Beds include 3 queens, 12 twin XL, 1 full, 2 twin, and 3 couch beds. Corn-hole and freezbie-golf, (one station) on site. Plenty of parking for the big rigs too! Great WiFi!

Guests have access to private, secure parking for vehicles, trailers and ATVs; a heated swimming pool shared with other guests; and a grill and fire pit.

When you book, you'll be given a door code that will unlock the front door during your stay. Owners live 15 minutes away and can be reached by telephone anytime for questions or concerns.

Home is in a rural setting, surrounded by mountains, with few neighbors and many ATV trail systems within riding distance.

Located directly on Route 52, within 15 minute drive of shopping and dining in Bluefield and Princeton, WV. Bramwell is accessible via car (3 minutes) or ATV (15-20 minutes)

Trail permits are REQUIRED to ride on the Hatfield-McCoy Trail System. Please let us know if you need trail permits; we can include them in the total cost of your stay and have them ready when you arrive. Also note that listed rates do not include 12% tax (6% state and 6% local hotel/motel); if you choose to book, your rate will be adjusted 12% to include taxes.
sectionedDescription/houseRules:
The Landlord has the right to inspect the premises without prior notice at any time to enforce the terms of this agreement. Should the Tenants violate any of the terms of this agreement, the rental period shall be terminated immediately. The Tenants waive all rights to process if they fail to vacate the premises upon termination of the rental period. The Tenants shall vacate the premises at the expiration time and date of this agreement.

There is an international calling block on the telephone - a calling card is needed for international calls. Emergency medical and police service can be called by dialing 911.

The Tenants shall maintain the premises in a good, clean, and ready to rent condition, and use the premises only in a careful and lawful manner. The tenants shall leave the premises in a ready to rent condition at the expiration of the rental agreement, defined by the Landlord as being immediately habitable by the next tenants. Tenants shall pay for maintenance and repairs should the premises be left in a lesser condition. The tenants agree that the Landlord shall deduct costs of said services from the security deposit prior to refund if tenants cause damage to the premises or its furnishings.

The Tenants shall dispose of all waste material generated during the rental period in a lawful manner and put bagged trash in the bin along the fence near the roadway for pickup. Tenant is cautioned not to leave trash outside because it attracts animals.

The Tenants shall pay for any damage done to the premises over and above normal wear and tear.

No animals or pets of any kind will be brought onto the premises.

The Tenants shall not sublet the property.

The Tenants shall have no more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises. The Tenants shall notify Landlord immediately if the planned number of guests increases. Tenants renting a unit with per-person charges authorize a charge of $20 per night per person if more than [RGUESTS_TOTAL] persons reside or sleep on the premises.

The Tenants shall behave in a civilized manner and shall be good neighbors respecting the rights of the surrounding property owners. The Tenants shall not create noise or disturbances likely to disturb or annoy the surrounding property owners. Creating a disturbance of the above nature shall be grounds for immediate termination of this agreement and Tenants shall then immediately vacate the premises. Quiet hour starts at 10 PM and Pool and outdoor noise should be kept to a minimum.

There shall be no smoking inside the premises. Smoking is permitted outside the home.

Landlord shall provide towels, linens, cups, knives, forks, spoons, dishes, and other items as commonly used by the Landlord’s family. Toilet paper, soap, dish detergent, laundry soap, shampoos, and other consumables are to be purchased by the Tennant. No reimbursement will be made for unused consumables left at the premises. If consumables exist at the premises when the Tenant arrives the Tenant is free to use them...

The Tenants and Tenants' Guests shall hereby indemnify and hold harmless the Landlord against any and all claims of personal injury or property damage or loss arising from use of the premises regardless of the nature of the accident, injury or loss. Tenants expressly recognize that any insurance for property damage or loss which the Landlord may maintain on the property does not cover the personal property of Tenants, and that Tenants should purchase their own insurance for Tenants and Guests if such coverage is desired.

Tenants agree to pay all reasonable costs, attorney's fees and expenses that shall be made or incurred by Landlord enforcing this agreement.

Tenants expressly acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is for transient occupancy of the Property, and that Tenants do not intend to make the property a residence or household.

We occasionally experience outages that are beyond our control.  We report outages as each occurs.  No refunds or compensation will be given for any outages.

There shall be no refunds of rents due to shortened stays or ruined expectations because of weather conditions.

If the property should go on the MARKET FOR SALE, it may be shown to qualified buyers during the Tenants’ stay.  Every effort will be made to schedule the showing at a convenient time and not interrupt the Tenant’s vacation. Tenant shall allow reasonable viewings of the home between 9 am and 8 PM present or not.

There shall be no refunds of rents because of shortened stays or ruined expectations due to work and family emergencies or other commitments.

It is the tenant’s responsibility to learn about safety precautions, warning signs of water conditions, and safety procedures concerning swimming in or being around the pool. Tenant agrees to have a responsible adult supervising minors while they swim in the pool. Tenant is hereby notified that the pool can be dangerous and tenant accepts fully the risks involved. Tenant is further notified to be cautious when exiting the rear of the home as the pool is open and in close proximity to the entry ways and can be a hazard. There are no rails to prevent a fall into the pool.

Only legally owned and permitted firearms shall be allowed on the premises according to State and local laws.

Tenant agrees that Fireworks and other hazardous materials shall not be used in or around the property.

Tenant shall use the property for legal purposes only and other use, such as but not limited to, illegal drug use, abuse of any person, harboring fugitives, etc. ; shall cause termination of this agreement with no refund of rents or deposits.

Tenant agrees not to access the “owner’s closet”, even if unlocked, which contains cleaning supplies and chemicals that could be hazardous to children and adults. The owners closet is located just inside the main front entry way.

Tenant is advised that the property contains a gas stove and cook top, gas heating, gas grill, and other gas powered items and will seek help from management if the proper operation of such items is not fully understood.

The property has a fire extinguisher installed near the kitchen area. The fire extinguisher was fully charged at last inspection. It is the duty of the tenant to inform management immediately should the fire extinguisher become less than fully charged. Tenant agrees to use the fire extinguisher only for true emergencies.

The property has fire alarms installed and they are believed to function properly at the time of rental. Tennant will notify management without delay if a fire alarm “chirps” or has a low battery condition.

Tenant is advised that there is no carbon monoxide detector on the property and accepts the risk involved in not having one.

Tenant shall see to their own security while in the property by locking doors, windows, garage doors, etc. when it’s prudent to do so.

Valuable items left behind by tenant will be held for the tenant and every reasonable effort will be made to contact the tenant for return. If items are not claimed for longer than 6 months they shall become the property of the Landlord. The Landlord shall not be held liable for condition of said items.

Cable TV is provided and service level has been chosen by the Landlord. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, or personal preferences with regard to cable TV service.

High speed wireless internet is provided as a convience only and is not integral to the agreement. No refund of rents shall be given for outages, content, lack of content, speed, access problems, lack of knowledge of use, or personal preferences with regard to internet service.

Tenant agrees that Air conditioning shall not be set below 73 degrees and heat shall not be set above 78, and that the fan setting shall be “Auto”. Doors and windows shall be closed when either heat or air conditioning is in operation.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant understands that the Trail Map Tablet is provided "as is," and that the maps installed on the tablet were created by a third party and have not been verified for accuracy, safety, legality or difficulty by Landlord. Tenant agrees to follow all applicable federal, state and local laws, and Hatfield-McCoy Trails' rules and regulations as applicable, when using the Trail Map Tablet. Tenant shall agree to defend, indemnify, and hold harmless Landlord from liability and claim for damages that arise from use of the Trail Map Tablet, including but not limited to: injury, illness, death, property damage, and criminal charges.

(Applicable only if "Trail Map Tablet" is rented) Tenant agrees that in the event the Trail Map Tablet is lost, stolen, damaged or destroyed, Tenant will be billed according to the following schedule: $50 for mounting hardware, $150 for Trail Map Tablet. Loss of or damage to Trail Map Tablet must be reported immediately to Landlord, and broken items must be brought back to Four Wheeler Heaven. Tenant acknowledges that the Trail Map Tablet is not waterproof, and that it should not be submerged in water or used in rainy or snowy conditions.

name: Buffalo Mountain Mountain Retreat in Williamson
sectionedDescription/description:
Entire large 4 bedroom home completely covered in wood. Perfect for a large group of riders and even multiple families.  Has large pool area with covered deck, rear deck and front porch.   Very large bar and game room area on far side of home away from all but master bedroom. 

Bedroom 1 - 1 King 1 twin daybed with pullout twin trindle. Sleeps 4
Bedroom 2 - 2 twin daybeds with twin trindles. Sleeps 4
Bedroom 3 - 1 King bed. Sleeps 2
Bedroom 4 - 1 King bed with 2 Twin beds. Sleeps 4

Plenty of street parking in front and behind home for trailers.  With a 3 car covered carport.   Plenty of street lighting and very safe area.  

whole city is ATV friendly so you can unload and ride around and right to the trailhead  1/4 mile away.

name: Winterplace condo lodge - Ski in Ski out
primaryHost/about: Professional who loves to travel!
sectionedDescription/description:
The lodge at Winterhaven is perfect for church groups, scout groups, or other large groups of people that are looking for slope side accommodations at Winterplace Ski Resort.

The lodge has enough room to sleep up to 32 people in bunk beds, couches, mattresses, and other cushions.  

There is also a large kitchen where meals can be prepared.

Please bring air mattresses... Or whatever else you want to sleep on. 

It does not have the amenities or feel of a condo.

There are no sheets or towels.

We highly recommend that you purchase travel insurance. Problems can arise in multiple ways and travel insurance can be a low cost guard against losing your money if you have last minute problems and have to cancel. In the past, some of our guests have obtained insurance by going to various insurance sites for details and to purchase. We did call the people at InsureMyTrip and they do have plans that will cover for Covid issues but there are several important steps and needs to be done shortly after making your first deposit. The plans are called "Cancel For Any Reason" CFAR. Check with your insurance agent before deciding what insurance to purchase. We DO NOT endorse any insurance in particular.

name: Simply Southern Cabin
sectionedDescription/description:
Beautiful log cabin in a private setting. Outside fire pits and picnic area. Large yard for outdoor lawn games. Pipesteam State Park is only a half a mile away with many adventure activities. Bluestone Lake is a few miles down the road with boat & jet ski rentals. Winter Place Ski Resort is 30 minutes away. Come & spend your adventures at our beautiful log cabin.

Our home away from home is a peaceful setting in the tall pine trees. Enjoy a cup of coffee on the front porch in the swing or rocking chairs. Or have your breakfast on the back porch. You’ll also see occasional wildlife such as deer or wild turkeys.

We are always a phone call away if any issues would arise.

Historic Hinton is close by with quaint little shops and restaurants. Princeton is in the opposite direction with your chain restaurants, box stores, and many other conveniences

Pipesteam State Park has many hiking trails. Boat rentals available at the Bluestone Lake. 
No public transportation in the area.

The 4th bedroom is actually in the open loft where the pool table is located. It does have a king size bed.

sectionedDescription/access:
Every group has a private entrance, living room, kitchen, and bathroom area, as well as a back deck or porch.
The house has a keyless entry. Code provided prior to arrival. Site manager will be in contact via text with arrival information approximately the week before your stay.
sectionedDescription/description:
Complete anti-viral scrub down before every group.

Highlander 2 - 6 bedrooms! Sleeps 20 people.
Located off of Rt. 77 at Winterplace Ski Resort. Slopeside, ski-in, ski-out in the winter. 
Feels like a secluded cabin in the middle of the woods, but has the convenience of a 2 minute drive to the highway. 
30-45 minute drive to the New River Gorge Recreation area and Fayetteville. Less than 30 min. to Pipestem State Park, Beckley or Princeton.

This cabin is awesome for large groups. There are 6 bedrooms and sleeping space for more than 20 people.
Slopeside (ski-in, ski-out) in the winter, and easy access to the best of West Virginia's outdoor recreation in the Spring, Summer, and Fall.

Highlander 2 sleeps up to 20 in beds. (with 2 people in fulls & queens). We no longer have the pull out couches and limit the group to 24 Max
Level 1: 
One bedroom with a queen bed 
One bedroom with a queen and full bed
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 2:
One queen bedroom 
One bedroom with one queen and one twin
Kitchen, living room, bathroom, washer/dryer

Level 3: 
One bedroom with two full beds
One bedroom with one queen, one full and one twin bed

Every group has a private entrance, living room, kitchen, and bathroom area, as well as a back deck or porch.
The house has a keyless entry. Code provided prior to arrival. Site manager will be in contact via text with arrival information approximately the week before your stay.

This cabin feels like it's a million miles from anywhere, but it's an easy 2 minute drive to the highway. 15 minutes to Pipestem or Little Beaver State Park, 20 minutes to Beckley or Princeton, and approximately 35 minutes to Fayetteville and the New River Gorge area.

There are two cabins side by side, private, but able to be rented together to accommodate really big groups. The cabins identical to each other. Each sleeps 20- 22 people in beds.
PLEASE NOTE:
1. In the winter, linens are provided, but TOWELS and other paper products/toiletries ARE NOT. Please bring your own towels, toilet paper, paper towels, dish soap, toiletries, laundry detergent, etc. if you stay December through March.
2. In the spring, summer, and fall this cabin is approximately 45 minutes from the New River Gorge Recreation Area.
sectionedDescription/houseRules: You must be 25 years old to rent. NO PARTIES OR EVENTS. No excessive drinking, kegs or smoking. We reserve the right to terminate the reservation and ask guests to leave with no refund if any house rules are broken. This home is monitored by video surveillance for our guests safety.

name: Spacious Mountain Chalet in the Blue Ridge
photos/0/caption: View from the front porch. plenty of chairs and small tables make eating on the porch easy!
photos/2/caption: Dining table seats 10 with lots of elbow room or 16 if you get cozy
photos/4/caption: Kitchen is fully stocked with everything you need to cook meals for a crowd including a toaster oven, microwave, slow cooker, pots/pans, popcorn maker, and double fridges
photos/5/caption: This room is called Independence. It has 3 sets of bunks with queens on the bottom and fulls on top. There is a queen sized futon/sofa that can be used as an additional bed. This room also has a large, flat screen tv for gaming or watching DVDs.
photos/10/caption: Please use outdoor wood for the fire pit and save the stacked firewood on the porch for the indoor fireplace (we purchase cured wood that doesn't smoke for indoors)
photos/15/caption: Cocktail hour in the hot tub!
photos/16/caption: Ring the camp bell! We ring on arrival and departure, and also to call people to dinner when they are scattered across the property
primaryHost/about: I am a professor at Rowan University. I teach and study the impact of climate change on our food supply. I just celebrated my 30th anniversary with my favorite person in the world - my husband Jamie. We have 4 children, 2 dogs, 2 cats, and 8 chickens. I am an avid gardener, growing everything you can possible grow in NJ dirt. I love hospitality and making sure you have the best stay ever is important to me!
sectionedDescription/access: You will have access to the entire property, buildings, rooms, trails, etc... except a small owners closet where we keep extra supplies
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to "glamping!" Check-in to this spacious camp in the Blue Ridge Mountains and enjoy the hot tub, 32 acres of trails, stunning views from the front porch, fire pit and s'mores bar. The property has two buildings: the lodge with kitchen, entertainment area, dining area (table seats 12 or more), and enormous fireplace. The second building houses 5 bedrooms and 13 beds. The fully stocked kitchen has dinner service for 22

The property is two buildings that are right next to each other. The main building has the views and overlooks the valley. It has several seating areas, dining area, full kitchen, powder room.

The second building is all the bedrooms and they are named for easy reference. 
Tall Pines and Sweet River have queen beds and share a bathroom. 
Briar Patch has two sets of twins (four beds total) and has a private bathroom. Independence has 3 sets of bunks with a fulls on top and queens on the bottom. There is a large private bathroom in Independence and also a queen sized futon for extra guests. 
Administration has a king bed and a private bathroom.

You will have access to the entire property, buildings, rooms, trails, etc... except a small owners closet where we keep extra supplies

Nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains just outside of Jefferson National Forest. All our neighbors are farmers, goats, cows, horses, and chickens. Nearest convenience store is 10 min and nearest grocery store is 20 min. It's rural mountain vacationing at its best!

There is room for 4 cars at the top of the driveway by the lodge. More cars can be parked lower on the property.

This is a remote property. There are some quirky things about it. The oven has to be lit by guests - we can't leave it on. There are bugs galore(hey, you are in the mountains) but oddly, no mosquitoes.  Sometimes things stop working but we have a property manager down the street who will assist guests with any problems. The views of the sky at night are spectacular and often you can see the milky way with the naked eye.

Rustic cabin absolute perfect spot to relax and unwind after a long day riding the trails. Amazing waterfall  views while grilling on your Blackstone out back back. Have a cup a coffee from the Keurig on the back porch to get the day going!!

sectionedDescription/access: Our home set off the road in the country (very accessible with any type vehicle). Multi-vehicle parking available.
sectionedDescription/description:
Welcome to Three Springs Farm. Sit back & relax on the front porch while enjoying the long mountain range views.Watch the sun rise&set over a private fully stocked 2.5 acre pond, swim, kayak, fish, & float.Goat herd that loves attention & snacks! Fully equipped kitchen & grill for all cooking needs. Linens & basic toiletries are provided with laundry facilities. 6 person hot tub, 2 Kayaks, john boat, fishing rods. Minutes away from restaurants, hiking, horse trails,& the New River.

10 acre farm with 2.5 acre stocked pond and goat sanctuary. Trails, streams, and small waterfall throughout the property.  Large front porch overlooking the pond and long mountain ranges. Large Private back deck with outdoor dining and hot tub.  Upon entry you will find a well maintained open concept living area with rock fireplace with electric insert and 75" screen HDTV.  Newly installed 100 mbps internet for all your needs. Comfortable clean furniture throughout. Fully equipped kitchen to cook your favorite meals or grill outside and picnic under the umbrella.
First Large Master Suite is located on the main level with a King sized bed and private full bath with large tub and shower. Second Master Suite is located upstairs with a Queen sized bed, Pack N Play with bassinet and changing table. With a private full bath tub and shower.  Third Bedroom complete with a Queen and full size beds. Bunk Loft (not a closed room) has two twin over full bunkbeds and a full bathroom with bath tub and shower. Half bath located downstairs. All bedrooms are very spacious and have TV's.  We also provide a Queen blow up mattress if needed.

Our home set off the road in the country (very accessible with any type vehicle). Multi-vehicle parking available.

We will be available to contact during your stay and won’t be far away if you need anything.

Rural country setting. There are neighbors but you definitely have your privacy.

Maintained pavement roads leading up to a gravel driveway. Plenty of room for multiple vehicles to park.

All water activities are at own risk (some life jackets are available). 
No Life Guard on Duty
We will provide maps for local attractions in your guest book.
Home has 100 mbps Wi-Fi and a cell phone booster but this home is in a rural area so cell reception is not the best in areas.
We do allow events onsite for an additional cost per our approval.
sectionedDescription/interaction: We will be available to contact during your stay and won’t be far away if you need anything.

primaryHost/about: I enjoy traveling to new places and meeting new people. my children are my favorite people on earth!
sectionedDescription/access: guess have entire apartment with private entrance and stairwell. the private fenced backyard with fire pit and comfortable patio chairs. large carport and Street side parking
sectionedDescription/description:
This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit.Located in the heart of Welch. Part of the Hatfield and McCoy trail system.

this basement apartment is like staying in a cozy nostalgic time capsule. located in a quiet, historic, beautiful Mountainside neighborhood. the extensive Stone walls and stairways is reminiscent of Villas in Italy. 360 degree Mountain views. overlook the river while enjoying the sound.

guess have entire apartment with private entrance and stairwell. the private fenced backyard with fire pit and comfortable patio chairs. large carport and Street side parking

guess can reach me by text or Airbnb messaging or if I am within sight

the neighborhood is composed of many big beautiful older homes. built on four different Mountainside tiers. this is a safe, quiet, friendly residential area. located on the very south east end of Welch. the downtown area is directly down Riverside Drive to the West. there is Renegade Outfitters for Trail Riders. 3 Exxon convenience stores and 1 Exxon gas station. two grocery stores within 3 miles or less. Dollar General and Family Dollar combo Dollar Store. a shoe show. one locally owned thrift store and one antique store all within three miles. the Pocahontas movie theater approximately one mile. McDonald's, KFC, Wendy's, Pizza Hut, Subway fast food restaurants within 3 miles or less. The Howdy house, Sterling Drive In,  spikes dawg house, and three little cupcakes bakery, independently owned restaurants all within six miles or less.

personal vehicle, walking, public transportation. best of all the town of Welch and many surrounding towns are ATV friendly. Therefore you can ride on most streets. trail connector signs are placed well to assist Riders.

there is plenty of ATV traffic on roads around location.

sectionedDescription/space: this basement apartment is like staying in a cozy nostalgic time capsule. located in a quiet, historic, beautiful Mountainside neighborhood. the extensive Stone walls and stairways is reminiscent of Villas in Italy. 360 degree Mountain views. overlook the river while enjoying the sound.
sectionedDescription/summary: This special place is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit.Located in the heart of Welch. Part of the Hatfield and McCoy trail system.
sectionedDescription/transit: personal vehicle, walking, public transportation. best of all the town of Welch and many surrounding towns are ATV friendly. Therefore you can ride on most streets. trail connector signs are placed well to assist Riders.

primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.

sectionedDescription/access:
Guest have full access with private entrance and private parking. This unit is part of the main house but you will be amazed at how private it is.
Your own outdoor space with a firepit and bbq grill.
sectionedDescription/description:
Take a step back in time. Rural America. Before fast food chains, and even before Walmart...

Surrounded by Mountains and conveniently located, direct access to Warrior Trailhead and High Rocks. Enjoy Wilmore Dam, or perhaps a day at Berwind Lake trout fishing, or hiking.

This can be purchased with the main house or as a stand alone unit. If purchased together the price will be reduced to $40 a night.
 Guest will have entire space to themselves.

Cozy suite convient for 1 or 2 people looking for a peaceful getaway. Features 1 Bedroom/1 Full Bath, and a Kitchenette with breakfast nook (refrigerator, microwave, and coffee maker.) Comes with clean linens, towels, and bedding. 
Bedroom has a flatscreen TV with Roku access (Netflix, Prime etc.) and WIFI.
Has a private entrance.  Perfect for traveling with a group that purchases the main house but likes your own space or traveling as a couple alone.

Like us on Facebook to stay up to date on what's going on in the area.

Guest have full access with private entrance and private parking. This unit is part of the main house but you will be amazed at how private it is.
Your own outdoor space with a firepit and bbq grill.

Our Mission is to make your stay at The Cove Suite as enjoyable as possible.

We live locally and respect your privacy. We'll give you the space that you want or the help that you need.

Quiet Neighborhood, close to everything. Welcoming small town with all the conveniences.
Restaurants, grocery store and gas station. 

Warrior Trail with direct connection to Pinnacle Creek,  Indiana Ridge, and Pocahantas Trail.

Located off of RT 16 WV

War is a ATV friendly town, you are welcome to ride your ATV anywhere for the duration of your stay. No trailering to the trailhead entrance.

Day trips in the area:
86 Miles to New River Gorge
64 Miles to Beckley Exibition Coal Miner Youth Museum

**Check out our other Listing**

name: Cozy Two Bedroom Apartment located in Welch
photos/14/caption: Guests have access to the front yard
primaryHost/about: My wife Elise and I have lived in McDowell County since November 2015. We moved from New England to help the community through outreach and ministry and we've fallen in love with the area and the people here. We love to go for walks, listen to music, travel anywhere & everywhere, and meet new friends.
sectionedDescription/access: Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. It is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.
sectionedDescription/description:
Enjoy the modern and vintage charm of our 1920's home. Located in the heart of McDowell County in Welch, West Virginia. We take pride in offering the most comfortable hypoallergenic bedding for a wonderful night's sleep and the softest towels so our guests will have a lavish experience.

This apartment is located in a home with an additional unit across the hall and it is above another apartment. It is located across the way from City Hall and the Welch Library.

We thoroughly clean and disinfect after each guest's stay. The cleaners and detergents used on our property are eco-friendly, sustainable and biodegradable.

Enjoy the scenic mountain view from our quiet and cozy front porch. Park right in front of the residence. It is a two minute walk from downtown Welch.

As hosts, we are always available for any assistance and advice while guests navigate the area.

There is truly no other place like Welch, WV. Once a booming coal town, Welch now has a much smaller population. Welch and McDowell County have garnered much attention over the past decade. The New York Times and CNN have published and produced different pieces highlighting the county and its unique way of life that still exists here in the mountains. Even the late chef, author, and documentarian, Anthony Bourdain spent time filming in McDowell and was quoted saying it was one of the most unique places he had traveled to.
 https://www.wvpress.org/breaking-news/anthony-bourdain-mcdowell-best-place-earth/

You can see McDowell County's episode on season 11 of Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown.

This home is within walking distance to a gas station, a library, town hall and the movie theatre. The Jack Caffrey Arts and Culture Center is a short distance away. Small shops, grocery stores and restaurants are all one to five miles away. There is a Bluefield Area Transit Bus route that runs through town on weekdays.

There is no kitchen in this unit. There is a key code for the front door of the house and for the apartment door. There are stairs  leading to this apartment.

We prefer no shoes in the apartment. 
Please leave beds unmade.

photos/0/caption:
Newly Renovated very nice, clean, spacious 3 bedroom, 2 bath, kitchen and living room house. Perfect fit for large groups or small. Convenient for riding HMT trails or outlaw trails.
Quiet neighborhood plenty of parking for trucks and trailers.
photos/1/caption: Spacious living room with a large sectional sofa and extra seating.  Plenty of comfy seating to lounge around  after a day on the trails. Also includes a futon couch that can be used for additional sleeping arrangements.
photos/2/caption: Amenities include a 65" flatscreen TV with Roku access (Netflix, Prime, etc), high speed Wifi and a designated work space.
photos/3/caption:
Fully equipped, large eat in kitchen. 
Perfect for large groups or a small family to dine in during your stay.
photos/5/caption: Maybe one of the most important things in the house. The coffee pot! Both a single serve as well as a regular pot. If you are like me we gotta have our coffee.
photos/6/caption: Bedroom #1 has 2 queen size comfy beds. Extra blankets and fresh linens. It also has a walk in closet and an on Suite adjoining bathroom.
photos/7/caption:
On suite adjoining bathroom with bedroom #1. Clean towels,
Fully stocked with all the necessities soap, shampoo, etc.
photos/8/caption: On suite bathroom 5' ceramic tiled walk in shower for bedroom #1.
photos/9/caption: Bedroom #2 Sleeps 3. 1 comfy queen size bed and 1 single bed. Clean linens and extra blankets. Clothes hanging rod with hangers.
photos/10/caption: 2nd bathroom shared by bedroom two and 3. Fully stocked necessities hair dryer, soap, shampoo, etc.
photos/11/caption: 2nd bathroom 36" ceramic tiled walk in shower.
photos/12/caption: Bedroom #3 has 2 comfy full size beds. Clean linens and extra blankets. Clothes hanging rods with hangers.
photos/13/caption: Laundry area extra large drum washer and dryer to wash riding clothes. Comes complete with laundry soap and a iron.
photos/14/caption: Yes it's true! We have parking to accommodate your trucks, trailers and equipment.
photos/15/caption: Entrance off of War Cove Circle. Well lit with security lights.
photos/16/caption: Covered Patio/Porch with outdoor seating and a gas grill. Perfect for sitting out at night and watching the stars.
photos/17/caption: Enjoy the evenings sitting by the fire pit talking and spending quality time with your family and friends. There's also a set of corn hole boards in the master closet.
photos/18/caption: Electronic lock for easy check in when you arrive.
photos/19/caption: Exterior security cameras for added security
photos/20/caption: Plenty of parking for trucks and trailers
photos/21/caption: Entrance to the house off of War Cove Circle
photos/24/caption:
Rick and I own A Scoop of Heaven
Best icecream in town. Open seasonally April-October. THU-SAT  from 12-9pm. Stop by and say hey and get a 10% discount.
photos/25/caption: ATV friendly town off load when you get here and drive you ATV where ever you want to go. The Owl serves inexpensive but tasty breakfast, lunch and dinner 6 days a week and lunch and opens at noon on Sundays.
photos/26/caption: Warrior Trailhead office sells HMT passes as well as souvenirs. Located on River Rd. Open from 9am-2pm everyday.
photos/31/caption: War area scenic views
primaryHost/about:
My husband and I relocated to West Virginia in 2014 from Ohio. We run a ministry (A New Beginning) located downtown. 
We opened A Bit of Heaven Rental in Sept. 2018 when the trails opened in our area. We currently have 5 units we rent. We also opened A Scoop of Heaven Icecream in 2021.
We live local across the street from The Calvary House and are available if you need us. We love the small town atmosphere that our town has to offer and the friendly folks that live here.
I love to cook and spend time with our family and grandbabies. 
We enjoy meeting new people, having cookouts in the summer, and going to the lake.
